loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is a very young and enthusiastic woman from Dhupguri.  She studied up to grade 10 and then got married at a very tender age.  She is now only 25 and a mother of 2 sons, one of whom is in school and the other is too young for school.  She lives with her family in a remote village (Madhya Boragari in Jalpaiguri district).

Mira's husband, 38-year-old Raman, is associated with land cultivation. He started this farm business 10 years ago and it has now been the principal source of income. His wife has been his right hand and together they fight to give their family better living conditions. Every morning, fresh air caresses the face of Mira and her husband who with much energy, want to analyze the conditions of their crops. They always make sure that the vegetables that they grow (such as potatoes, beans, gourds, and eggplant are fit to be consumed and they are very concerned with the wellbeing of their customers.

Mira is now requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) in order to increase their capital production. They want to cultivate paddy, which is a very profitable and all-season crop. She needs to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, manure and other necessary things to start cultivation as early as possible.

She is grateful to her lenders for the loan, which will make it possible for her to earn better income to cover the costs of the family.  She hopes that her crop yields will be good. One of her goals is to improve the infrastructure of her home as well as the business.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is a married woman with three children (two sons and one daughter).  She is from Dhupguri. Two of her children are receiving an education (in grade one and grade two) and one is too young for school.  She received an education until grade four and her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name.  They live in the small village of Madhya Boragari in Jalpaiguri district.

Minu is a housewife and her husband is a land cultivator who has a plot of agricultural land where he grows various vegetables to sell in the local markets. Minu is a big support in his work, especially at the time of harvesting. But the income from this business hardly covers the household expenses of the family. They have decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland for additional income.

Minu is a tenacious woman who is ready to give her best effort for the betterment of her family. She has taken economic support from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, etc.  Her long-term goal is to go ahead with paddy cultivation as it is profitable, being the staple food for the people of their region. She and her husband want to harvest the crop in abundance.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, cooking oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more green vegetables and mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is a 38-year-old young woman from the village Zghuderi. She has two sons and a husband, who works as a private artisan and approximately generates 300 GEL (Georgia lari). Her son is a salesperson also at a local store and gets insignificant income. 

Shorena can't find any stable job and is involved in agricultural activities, in order to do her bit for the family's welfare. She cultivates a plot of agricultural land and harvests wheat, potatoes, onion and apples. Shorena sells the mentioned products locally and gets a small income. 

She has a great desire to expand her agribusiness and start dairy farming. That's why she has requested a loan from MFO Credo, which finances start-up businesses. Shorena plans to purchase two milk cows, start producing cheese and sell it locally at a good price.
 
The loan will greatly assist Shorena, and she will be able to continue her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, Shorena has a big list of loyal customers. She will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To buy two milk cows and produce cheese

loans.name: Gunel

texts.en:
Gunel is 24 years old. She has been married for over four years and has two children. They are living in the Absheron region but are internally displaced persons (IDPs) from Khojaly city. Gunel's mother-in-law helps her educate and take care of children. A while ago Gunel and her husband decided to open a new women's dress shop and they have opened the store. 

Today Gunel wants to support the family business and for that she needs a loan in amount of 2,300 Azerbaijan new manat. With this amount Gunel wants to buy more clothes for selling in order to develop her business to increase her monthly income. 

Gunel wishes the best for her children and she works hard. Gunel says, “Thanks, dear Kiva lenders, for your support. I’m greatly thankful to you.”

loans.use: for buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is a 30-year-old divorced mother of two, and she works hard to provide them with the best education and living through developing her business properly to make sure it will stay a good income business.

Rachelle is a hard worker, well known in her region with her special talents. She has ten years of experience in the beauty business, which is based at her home.

She has lived with her children at her parents' house after she got divorced, and she is the sole breadwinner to her family members. Her income covers their living expenses, but she needs extra income to cover unexpected bills and increasing living needs. For this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her childrens' increasing school tuition fees.

She hopes that one day she can move her business outside her house, get more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: pay for her childrens' increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Safahat

texts.en:
Safahat is a 42 year-old-married man and he has two sons. He lives with his family in a small home in a tiny village. His wife is a homemaker who does the household chores and raises their children. In order to have a steady income to live on, Safahat has his own business. He fattens and sells cattle. His wife also helps him with his business. She sells the milk that she gets from the cows. 

Safahat wants to buy a yearling sheep to increase the size of his herd in order to expand his business. This is why is requesting a loan from Aqroinvest. He says thanks in advance to all!

loans.use: to buy a yearling sheep

loans.name: Margen

texts.en:
Margen helped her husband in managing their own farm to make a living.

She used her previous loan to buy fertilizer and it brought good returns for the family. She took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer. Improving the farm is her dream, for she wants to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more goods such as red oil, salt, rice, onions, batteries etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Ke Ohe Awomli Group

texts.en:
The Ke Ohe Awomli (Be Counted) Group is made up of five members who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that the group has requested a loan from the field partner ID Ghana to expand their businesses (newspapers, bread, lining, phone credit cards and paints).

Emmanuel is the group representative. He is 62 years old and married to Elizabeth; they have two children. Emmanuel attended school to the secondary level. He lives together with his wife and their dependent children. Between them, they provide for the expenses of their household. In order to do this, Emmanuel sells newspapers in a kiosk at the road side in his neighborhood. He buys from publishing houses in Accra.

Emmanuel is trying to please his customers and increase his earnings, so he and the other members of the group have requested this second loan from the field partner ID Ghana. The loan will enable them to increase their stock levels and attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy newspapers in Accra to sell to his customers

loans.name: Xalida

texts.en:
Xalida is a 57-year-old divorced woman. She is trying to raise her children without them feeling the absence of their father too much. 

In 2009, she started her own business by opening in her house a small room for selling clothes with her special selling methods and by selling high quality products. She is well known in her region for the special talents in her domain. 

Today, Xalida is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Aqroinvest, to increase her business merchandise with new and special collections of clothes, to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income. She is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to expand her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new and special collections of clothes.

loans.name: Rashidah

texts.en:
Rashidah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

Rashidah operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last three years. She has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, rice, beans and serving utensils. 

Rashidah's major challengea include seasonality of different food types. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge to serve her customers better. She has her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, rice, beans and serving utensils

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita lives in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. 

She has helped her husband to manage their own farm for many years in order to make a living. Their farm provides a better income for them and she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used this loan for their farm. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to improve their farm as well as the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel wants to buy another motorcycle so that he can work more. He has been providing transportation services for many years in order to support his family. 

To keep safe and comfortable, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs of motorcycle repairs. By doing this, he will have more financial stability and can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motorcycle repairs.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Yeghegnadzor with her father and two children. She works as a teacher at the local secondary school. 

Because of a low salary, Hasmik has always been forced to look for other revenue sources. In particular, she has been engaged in beekeeping for nine years. Hasmik already owns 42 bee colonies and now wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit. She is planning to buy six more colonies with beehives. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of USD 2,100. The family is in a quite hard financial situation, which is why this loan will be a huge support for them. Let's help Hasmik and her family make their goals come true.

loans.use: to purchase six bee colonies with hives.

loans.name: Luz Damaris

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 
Desde hace muchos 10 años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, oficio que aprendió de manera empírica por medio de la observación a una tía y, poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller, para lo cual adecuó un espacio en la casa donde reside y con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas, trabaja sola todos los días, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de una persona, dependiendo de la cantidad de contratos que tenga.
Así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar. El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará una máquina fileteadora y una maquina plana, con las que podrá agilizar el proceso de producción y adquirir más contratos, generando mayor rentabilidad en el negocio. 
Luz manifiesta que su mayor desafío es la competencia en el mercado, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Luz is 34 years old. She's a hardworking and energetic woman who is always looking for alternatives that allow her to progress.

For some ten years, she's earned her living working in the clothing field, a job she learned empirically by observing an aunt. Little by little, she perfected her technique and increased her knowledge through practice. 

This prompted her to start her own workshop, for which she improved a space in the house she lives in. With some savings she had, she bought her first machines. She works alone every day, but sometimes receives help from another person, depending on the number of contracts she has. Through this, she's succeeded in earning enough to pay for household expenses. 

The loan she's seeking is support for is to strengthen her work. With the money, she will buy a serger (a type of sewing machine) and a tabletop sewing machine. With these machines, she will be able to streamline the production process and get more contracts, generating better profitability in the business.

Luz says her biggest challenge is competition in the market. However, it's that which continues motivating her to continue offering a better service and fighting to make her dream of accrediting her business a reality. This will allow her to generate employment opportunities and thus improve her quality of life, and those of the people affecting the work.

loans.use: to buy a serger and a tabletop sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as soap, oil, pepper, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, pure water and soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Bioche Group

texts.en:
Arsenia is the featured borrower of Bioche group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their home town in the Philippines to work as housekeepers in Lebanon.

Arsenia is a 30-year-old married mother of two, who works hard to support her family in the Philippines. Her acquired loan will be invested in sending the money to her family back in the Philippines, to cover their increasing living expenses.

Arsenia is the first lady at the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Judy Ancheta is the lady in the center of the picture, while Analiza is the first on the left.

loans.use: to send money to her family back in the Philippines to cover their increasing living expenses

loans.name: Birthday Group

texts.en:
Materesa is the featured borrower of Birthday Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their home town in the Philippines to work as housekeepers in Lebanon.

Materesa is a 37-year-old divorced mother of two, who works hard to support her family in the Philippines. Her acquired loan will be invested in sending the money to her family back in the Philippines, to cover their increasing living expenses. Materesa is the first lady on the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Helen is the lady in the center of the picture, while Divinia is the first from the left.

loans.use: to send money to her family back in the Philippines, to cover their increasing living expenses.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe has been a farmer for many years and, with the help of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), she has been able to improve her farm. Over the years, she has been engaged in a retailing business, and her previous loan from GDMPC microcredit contributed to the improvement of her business. She has been able to sustain it. Recently, she took a loan  to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Ariane

texts.en:
Ariane owns and operates a retail store selling grocery goods to earn a living. For more than five years, Ariane has earned well, and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase more varieties of groceries items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. All she wants is to have a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of groceries items to sell.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Phanice who is 26 years old, and is very hardworking and friendly. She lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, an area that has good weather patterns and is well known for banana farming, and their staple food is “matoke” which is made from bananas. 

Phanice is a loving mother of one child, and her primary source of income comes from selling milk and eggs, and tea planting. Through funds from these ventures she has been able to take care of her family's basic needs and always puts a smile on her child. Profits from farming have allowed her to earn a decent and honest living. Phanice has been doing farming for the past year and has never regretted even a single bit, venturing into farming because of the profits she has been making.

Although she has been making profits, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum, and for this reason she is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to start poultry farming. Through this loan she will be able to combine profits that she will get and improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Phanice wants to secure the future of her child that is why she will do anything good to be able to realize that dream. Phanice is sure that through the profits she will be reaping she will comfortably pay the loan and even ask for more money so that she will improve her life and give her child a solid education.

Phanice's dream is to be able to grow and have an impact in society through employing people to work for her in her poultry farm.

loans.use: to start poultry farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods like salt, pepper, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Jackline, who is 34 years of age and hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area that has good weather patterns that favor farming. Jackline is a kind, loving mother of two children and has been farming for the last two years. Due to the good weather patterns that are experienced in Nyamira, Jackline has been able to practice mixed farming--that is, dairy farming and crop farming. Through these ventures Jackline has been able to support her family and always put food on the table. Jackline is very proud of farming and cherishes every moment that she is on her farm.

Although Jackline has been making profits, not everything has been rosy. There are challenges that she is facing on her farm and in her life because of inadequate finances. Jackline is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES to be able to start banana farming. Coming from a region where the cash crop is bananas and everybody grows bananas, Jackline wants to take advantage of the good weather patterns experienced there and the demand for bananas and turn that dream into more cash.

Because of the increasing client base and market, Jackline is sure that she will reap more profits and be able to provide for her family and ensure a secure future for her two adorable kids. More profits will translate to a flourishing business and hence she will be able to increase and start other business ventures through the accumulated profits. Jackline has gone through the repayment schedule and is very comfortable with the payments, and she is sure that through the accumulated profits from selling bananas she will impact the society. 

Jackline feels relieved to know that there are people and institutions that support and generate opportunities to progress and for this reason she is very optimistic that the loan will be of much help and she will progress in life.

loans.use: To start banana farming

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Jermuk town of Vayots Dzor village with her husband, parents and 22-year-old son. She works as a masseur at the local sanatorium. In order to earn sufficient amount of money for her family, Karine has been forced to look for other revenue sources. Particularly, she has been engaged in beekeeping for six years already. She already owns 20 bee colonies, but now wants to expand her agribusiness. 

Karine has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her agribusiness, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Karine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. With the loan's help, she is planning to buy 15 bee colonies with hives and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase 15 bee colonies, beehives and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, biscuits and local cereal for resale.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a 29-year-old man, married to Maureen, who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with one child. Titus has been operating a pharmacy business for two years, earning himself an income of 8,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Titus is now servicing his third loan of 20,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this entire amount to pay school fees. The profits he earns will be used to add to his personal savings to clear the remaining fee balance structure for his child. He hopes to be a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To add to his savings to pay school fees.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 50 years old and married to Pamela. They are blessed with six children aged between 2 years and 16 years. He has been making and selling bricks to his customers in the community for the last 10 years and earns an income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
He has applied for his third loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this loan amount to buy more materials for making bricks so that he can meet the demand of his customers. He paid his previous loan successfully.                                                                                             

The profit he earns will be used to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making bricks

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old single Syrian citizen who has been working in a business manufacturing and selling aluminium since 2009. He has fourteen years of experience in his field. 

He is a hard worker, who had to quit school during his intermediate classes to work hard in order to support four extra members of his family. Life wasn't fair for him, since he had to be a responsible man during his teenage years, while he had to enjoy these days with people from his age.
 
Ali is developing his parents house, but he needs to finish some legal documents, to continue his construction work. His income isn't enough to cover these extra requested needs, which is why he applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for necessary legal issues to get his house construction permit.

He hopes that one day he can open his own aluminium shop in the future and develop his living.

loans.use: to pay for necessary legal issues to get his house construction permit.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a 30-year-old hardworking widow who supports a family of six children and has been operating a cereals business stall for eight years earning an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings) at the end of every month.

Evaline is now using her second loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to add more stocks of cereals to boost her business and meet her clients' expectations. 

Evaline plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and be able to further their education to higher levels and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: to add additional stocks of cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 32-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a transport business alongside farming and selling matooke as his sources of income. He faces a challenge of limited capital, however, he has hopes of constructing a better home and educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Christopher needs a loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is 29-year-old divorced woman, from the village of Tsodniskari. She lives with her blind grandmother and school-aged son. Nunu has developed anagricultural business, as she can't find any stable job. She is engaged in cattle and cow breeding and in cultivating plots of agricultural land and using harvested products for local trading. This is the only source of livelihood for her family. 

Simultaneously with this business, Nunu teaches a profession. In specific, she is a masseuse and has her own clients. Nunu has a great desire to expand her own business, to purchase all needed equipment and tools, and to open a massage room. After this, Nunu will be able to get more clients, serve them in a pleasant environment, and make more savings. 

She will be really grateful for the help, and for giving her a chance to make a better lifestyle for her son and grandmother and keep doing her lovely job among her loyal costumers. Nunu awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to open a massage room and purchase all needed equipment and tools.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, a single mother, is involved in her business of selling electronic load (prepaid cell phone credit) and is happy to say that she earns a better income for her needs. She joined GDMPC (Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative) and has taken out a new loan to buy more electronic load. 

In the future, she wants to improve her business because she wants to provide her child with a better education in the future.

loans.use: to buy more electronic load (prepaid cell phone credit).

loans.name: Mwelu

texts.en: Mwelu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Baala

texts.en:
Baala is a hardworking man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in transport and commercial farming, a business he started with the hope of earning a living and looking after his big family. He faces the challenge of weather changes. His dreams are to educate all his children to higher levels of learning and to expand the transport business by buying more motorcycles. 

Baala has asked for a loan to mulch his banana plantation.

loans.use: to mulch his banana plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her business by buying more used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards. It enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household consumables, cooking oil, wheat flour, salt, sugar and soap for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, cooking oil, wheat flour, salt, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Sekiyanja

texts.en:
Sekiyanja is married with six children. He keeps cattle in order to sell their milk and distills a banana-based Ugandan alcohol known as waragi for additional income.

Because he faces the challenge of high transportation costs, Sekiyanja is applying for a 1,800,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy a motorcycle to carry his milk to market, among other things. His goal is to meet all of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 34 years old and married to Dancan, and they are blessed with three children aged 14, 9, and 8 years. Eunice has been selling assorted cereals such as dry maize, peas, green grams, beans and millet. She has been in this business for the last eight years and earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Eunice has applied for her second loan of 30,000 KES after paying back her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy more stock of dry maize, peas and millet to sell. She will save the anticipated profits and buy a plot for future development.

In the future Eunice plans to expand her business and start selling cereals wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more assorted cereals

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase milk, sweets, cooking oil and wheat flour for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sweets, cooking oil and wheat flour for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, 33, from the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe, is married with three children and is a strong businesswoman. She has gone through several ups and downs trying to raise funds for her family. She started a poultry business in 2010 as there were very few suppliers of chickens in her area. She is now a reliable supplier of chickens to her entire community. She produces 50 birds every two weeks and would like to grow her business. Maria volunteers as a Community Health Trainer as well as a Learner Guide promoting study skills at the local school. With the requested loan, she would like to build a bigger foul run and buy broiler chicks and feed so that she can expand her monthly production.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Loveness

texts.en: Loveness is a 22-year-old up-and-coming businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Nyaminyami district of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at her local secondary school, assisting students with life and study skills. Loveness has been selling groceries successfully for over two years now. She started her business so that she could provide the community with supplies that are scarce in her small village, as the nearest shopping center is 15km away. Loveness sells products such as sugar, rice, tea, stationary, salt, cooking oil and snacks. She has been able to help sustain her family with the profits from her business, but she would also love to see it expand. With the requested Kiva loan, Loveness plans to make bulk purchases of sugar, rice, tea, stationary, salt, cooking oil and soap. She hopes to continue to support her parents and siblings with the increase in profits.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of sugar, rice, tea, stationary, salt, cooking oil and soap.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 26-year-old married woman who supports a family of two children, and her husband adds additional income to their family. Millicent has been operating a retail stall for five years, earning an income of 6,000 KES every month.

Milicent was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now taking out her first loan of 10,000 KES. She intends to use the entire amount to add additional and new stock to boost her business. She plans to use the anticipated income to build a permanent stall and educate her children, and she hopes to buy a piece of land for the family and have a bright future with her family.

loans.use: To add additional and new stock to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothing

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 25-year-old businesswoman who is married and the mother of one. She lives in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a flea market from her home since 2012 as an addition to the few funds she receives from her husband. She started as a door-to-door vendor and has now converted the veranda of her house into a small shop. She sells skirts, blouses, panties, bras and shoes. When she is not working, she volunteers in her community by cleaning the health clinic or helping the elderly with everyday chores. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide assisting students at the local secondary school. With the requested loan she intends to make bulk purchases of clothing to expand her business and also give back to her community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make bulk purchases of clothing to increase her inventory for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothing to cut down her initial costs.

loans.name: Ruvarashe

texts.en:
Ruvarashe is a 25-year-old businesswoman. She is divorced with three children and lives in the Nyaminyami district of Zimbabwe. She is a source of inspiration to most young people in her community because she is determined to succeed. She often volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide and helps with the cleaning of the school. 

Ruvarashe operates a grocery shop at her local business center selling sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks. She hopes to expand her business into a retail shop if profits allow. Ruvarashe will use the Kiva loan to purchase her products in bulk, boosting the sales and volume of profits. With the additional income, her wish is to send her children to boarding school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen used the previous loan to buy first-class clothes to sell, and he has continued with that business hand-in-hand with phone charging, burning CDs, and retail in order to boost his income. He faces challenges of low capital; however, he hopes to have a fully installed charging system. 

He needs a loan to buy a solar panel.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for lighting.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 35-year-old married businesswoman with three children. She has been successfully operating a poultry project for over two years and is proud of the growth she has achieved so far. She currently produces 50 birds every six weeks. With the requested loan Faith would like to renovate the current fowl run and double the number of chickens she produces to meet the current demand of her community. With additional profits she hopes to improve her standard of living and send her children to better schools.

loans.use: to renovate the current fowl run and double the number of chickens she produces

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is a young and enterprising woman of 23 years from the small village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter) who are too young for school. She and her husband Tapan both have an elementary education.  She studied until grade 10 and her husband until grade 8. 

Nilima's husband is a street hawker who earns too little to make ends meet. So Nilima has been practicing cattle farming for last five years to give sustenance to her family through dairy.  She finds dairy farming enjoyable and profitable.  She has a dairy cow on her farm.  She supplies milk from door-to-door to her neighbors. In order to increase her business, she needs to purchase one more cow.  But the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Nilima is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow.  It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more and satisfy her customers.  Thus, she will earn more.  So she has taken a loan from BJS.  The loan will greatly help her to organize her farming in more effective ways. She wants to assist her husband economically and educate her children properly to establish them.

She dreams of purchasing more cows in the future to make a herd and save money from her profit to construct a decent and better house for them. She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is a 34-year-old businesswoman and a divorced mother of one. She has been successfully running a stall at the local flea market selling clothing and accessories for two years now. When she is not working at the flea market she volunteers as a Community Health Trainer. With the requested loan she intends to make bulk purchases of shirts, skirts, dresses, jackets, petticoats, bras and bags to reduce transport costs and maximize profits. This loan will help her improve the status of her business and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of shirts, skirts, dresses, jackets, petticoats, bras and bags to reduce transport costs and maximize profits for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Muyanda

texts.en: Muyanda is a 30-year-old businesswoman who is married with two children and lives in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for over a year with the assistance of her family. She sells soap, cooking oil, salt and sugar to her community. When she is not working in her shop she does volunteer work cleaning the school yard and helping the elderly in her community. Muyanda is also a Learner Guide at the local secondary school assisting students by providing life skills sessions. With the requested loan Muyanda intends to increase her stock, improve sales and increase profits. She is also hoping to create employment within her community.

loans.use: To increase her stock, improve sales and increase profits for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in transport, the business he started with a hope of employing himself. He is facing challenges of competition and bad roads that lead him to constant mechanical breakdowns. However, he has a vision of having a well-built permanent house. Ismail needs a loan to buy building materials like cement.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 33-year-old businesswoman. She is married with three children. She lives in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe where she has been successfully operating a flea market for over a year and a half. Dorcas initially started the business to raise income for her family and send her children to school. When she is not at the flea market she does volunteer work helping the elderly and running a Child Abuse Awareness campaign Programme in local schools. With the requested loan, she intends to expand her business into a large boutique. With the profits she wishes to provide for her family and hopes to create employment within the community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Laiza

texts.en: Laiza is a 31-year-old businesswoman and a mother of three. Since her divorce, she has vowed that her children would not lack anything, so she took it upon herself to start her own business going door-to-door selling matemba (dried sardines). She also volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in her community and in local schools. With the requested loan, she intends to buy a fridge and build a drying rack at her house for the fish.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and build a drying rack at her house for the fish.

loans.name: Shupikai

texts.en: Shupikai is a 36-year-old businesswoman who is married with three children. She lives in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe where she has been selling clothing for the past two years with great success. She sells skirts, blouses, trousers and jackets for all ages and genders. Shupikai is the bread winner for her family because her parents are disabled and unable to work. When she is not selling clothing, she volunteers as a Learner Guide and Community Health Trainer at local schools. Shupikai will use the requested loan from Kiva to buy skirts, blouses, trousers and school uniforms in bulk to reduce costs. She also hopes to open a boutique and give her parents the best care they can get.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Pramilabala

texts.en:
Pramilabala is a rural woman from Dhupguri.  She lives with her family in Kalirhat, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district.  Her family consists of her husband Shankar and two children (one son and one daughter).  Both are students and are in different grades in secondary school. Pramilabala attended up to the second grade; it took a huge effort given her economic situation at that time.  Her husband studied until grade nine.

Pramilabala's husband is associated with agricultural activities and she takes care of the household chores. Her husband grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells them in the local markets. But he mainly grows paddy, which is a crop in much demand by his customers, being the staple food for the people of their region. His customers like his simple and polite behavior. He also sells good quality products at cheaper rates.  But to have financial sustenance, he needs to generate more income. That is only possible by increasing his cultivation.  He wants to grow paddy in larger quantities.

Pramilabala wants to help her husband. She is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy manure and seeds to grow paddy. She believes that it will be of great help to her to improve her living standard by generating more profit. Her dream is to improve her kachha house (made of straw, mud and wood) to a decent one.

She gives her thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and other agricultural inputs for cultivation.

loans.name: Sukla

texts.en:
Sukla hails from the very remote village of Satvendi in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is only 22, married and blessed with two young children (one son and one daughter), one of whom is in preprimary school and the other is too small to go to school. She is married to Jyotish, who is a 29-year-old land cultivator.  Both are illiterate and can only sign their names. They were deprived of an education due to their parental poverty.

Sukla's husband has been practicing crop farming for many yeras. He has a plot of land that he got as an inheritance, where he primarily grows potatoes, beans, gourds, eggplant, lady fingers, etc.  He sells his crops to the wholesale distributors.  He is the only earning member in the family and the whole household expenses depend on his income.  He is known as a principled, honest, respectable and dependable man.  These qualities helped him gain many buyers of his good quality crops. In order to satisfy his valuable clients and earn more income, he has decided to cultivate a profitable crop like paddy. He has chosen this crop to cultivate as it is in very good demand in the market. He thinks financial help will do to fulfill his requirement.

So Sukla has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to help her husband to continue cultivation. Sukla plans to use the earnings from the loan to strengthen their financial condition and to renovate her home in the future.

She appreciates the financial help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en: Cecilio is a new cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of San Antonio, in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for himself and his family. He also believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop, which is both good for the environment and will help develop his local community. He wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan so that he can purchase grafted, high-yielding, disease-resistant cacao seedlings. He plans to use the revenue generated from his cacao crop to educate his children and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase high-yielding grafted cacao trees for his agriculture business.

loans.name: Edeline

texts.en: Edeline is a 29-year-old businesswoman. She is married with one child and lives in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. For the past six months, she has been successfully running a stall at her local flea market selling clothing with the assistance of her husband. Edeline started the business because it is profitable in her area due to the high demand for apparel. She originally started as a door-to-door vendor and is proud of the growth she has achieved. When she is not working, Edeline volunteers as a Seed Money Scheme Trainer in her community. With the requested loan she intends to make bulk purchases of clothes and become a viable uniform supplier to the schools around her.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en: Tendai is a 24-year-old female tailor. She is married with one child and lives in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating her business for six months now. She sews uniforms and sells them to the local school. When she is not working, she volunteers in her community cleaning and hosting awareness campaigns. She is also a Learner Guide at the local secondary school assisting students with their studies. With the requested loan she will buy materials in bulk to increase sales and profits. She is also hoping to create employment within her community and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials in bulk to increase sales and profits in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara is a woman of 41 years who lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter) in a small mud house. They live in the village of Baroghoria, which is a remote area in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family belongs to the below poverty line category.  Zahara and her husband Chapiruddin both are uneducated and can only sign their names.  All their children are attending school.

Zahara's husband has been running a business selling tea. Every morning Zahara makes tea, which her husband carries in a pot to the local railway station.  His main customers are the train passengers and passersby. This small business is the main source of income for the family, which hardly covers even the food expenses. So, the family is in an acute financial crisis. He purchases stock for his business from the wholesale sellers three times a week.  Due to a lack of sufficient money, he has to purchase items on a regular basis, which unnecessarily increases costs in both finance and labor.  Zahara and her husband want to increase their stock of products such as tea leaves, sugar, milk and other items to expand the business for more income. But their main challenge is capital.

Hearing from her neighbors that BJS gives business loans to rural women, Zahara took a loan from them to purchase the required items for their business. Zahara hopes this will help her to increase her income to achieve her dreams of constructing a better house and providing a better education for her children.

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her husband's business of selling tea.

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena is a married woman of 42 years.  She is from the village of Boragari in Jalpaiguri district. She lives there with her husband Babur and two children (one son and one daughter). She and her husband did not receive an elementary education. So they are illiterate and can only sign their names.  One of their children is in grade nine and the elder one works as a laborer for daily wages.

Amena's husband, age 47, is associated with agricultural activities.  He mainly grows rice paddy and vegetables like potatoes. He has good knowledge and experience about paddy cultivation. Amena has also been engaged in this business. They have their own plot of land where they work from dawn to dusk.  Her goal is to get ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her family.  But the income from this business is very inconsistent and at the same time, insufficient to cover all the necessary expenses of the family. So she has decided to cultivate more paddies, which are a profitable crop.  Paddy is a crop that grows well in a tropical country like India and the rainy season is the best time for the cultivation of the crop. But she cannot invest much in this business due to a lack of capital.

Amena heard that BJS (Kiva’s partner) gives business loans to needy rural women.  She took a loan from them with an aim of cultivating more paddies. She wants to use the loan to buy planting materials and fertilizer to start the cultivation.  She is striving for a better life through farming.  Amena hopes to have a better life with her family in the future.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva for this financial help.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en: Arevhat lives in Jermuk town with her husband and six-year-old daughter. The family has been engaged in beekeeping for four years already and currently owns 15 bee colonies. As Arevhat's daughter is very little, only two family members are engaged in agribusiness. Arevhat's husband sells produced honey in local markets. As the family is in quite a hard financial situation, Arevhat and her husband are planning to expand their agribusiness. Arevhat has applied for a loan of USD 3,000 to buy 10 more colonies with beehives. These hard working young people do everything to make ends meet. Let's help them become more able to take care of their little daughter.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bee colonies and hives.

loans.name: Antoanette

texts.en:
Antoanette is 39 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She has been selling foodstuff (coco-yam, tomatoes, garden egg, etc.) in her home for six years. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm and she has many customers because she is a good worker. They are able to pay for the household expenses using her earnings along with help from her husband.

Antoanette is requesting a loan to be able to buy more foodstuff (coco-yam, tomatoes, garden egg etc.) that she will sell to her customers. This way she will be able to make a better profit, which will help them to be more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff (coco-yam, tomatoes, garden egg etc.) that she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tanya

texts.en: Tanya is a widow from Marts village of Lori region. She lives there with her parents, brother, sister, and two daughters. Tanya's large family has been engaged in animal husbandry for five years already. They keep cattle, pigs, and hens. The family also owns an orchard and grows various types of fruits there. Tanya now wants to expand her family's agribusiness by making some investments. She has applied for a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase five calves. As this is Tanya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase livestock such as five calves for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 39 años de edad y vive en Irazola junto a su familia.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que lucha día a día para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Esta mujer emprendedora se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 7 años, siendo el plátano su principal producto cultivado en sus tierras. Tiene muchos conocimientos sobre los cultivos, es por ello que siempre ofrece productos de calidad y tiene muchos clientes recurrentes que solicitan sus productos.
Felipa está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar insumos para abonar sus plantas como fertilizantes y cubrir los gastos de mantenimiento hasta la etapa de cosecha, d esta manera podrá ofrecer frutas de mejor calidad e incrementar sus ventas. Gracias a sus ganancias podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para poder convertirse en la principal productora de plátano de la zona.
texts.en:
Felipa is a hard-working woman. She is 39 years old and lives with her family in Irazola.

Felipa's greatest motivation in life is her family. She fights every day in order to give them a better future.

Enterprising Felipa has been making a living in farming for over seven years, with plantains being her main product. Felipa is very knowledgeable about crops and so always sells good quality products. She has many regular customers.

Felipa is grateful to Kiva because, thanks to the support provided, she will be able to buy supplies - such as fertilisers - to fertilise her plants and to cover maintenance costs until harvesting. This way Felipa can offer higher quality fruits and increase her sales. With her profits, Felipa will be able to improve her family's quality of life and she will continue to put in the effort to become one of the biggest plantain growers in the area.

loans.use: to pay to look after crops and to buy fertilisers.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en: Mupa is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to increase her income greatly and help her family thanks to her hard work. She is asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, soap, and maize flour for resale. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, soap, and maize flour for resale in her general store business.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to increase her income greatly and help her family thanks to her hard work. She is asking for a loan to buy tomatoes, green vegetables and fruits for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Baijanti

texts.en:
Baijanti, 39, is married and a young mother of three sons.  She is from Dhupguri. She lives there with her husband Jitendra and her sons. Two of her sons are getting an education and are in grade eight and grade seven. The other son is too young for school. She's grateful to God above all for her daily life and health to strive and get ahead with her family.

In her childhood, she did not get an opportunity to get an education due to the poor financial resources of her parents.  So she is earnestly trying to provide an education for her sons. She and her husband, age 46, are engaged in farm labor such as weeding, caring for the crop, and other tasks before harvesting the crops.  They cultivate different vegetables in different seasons.  With several years of experience in farm work, they have been able to get ahead despite the difficulties that have arisen along the way including the rising costs of inputs and the instability of the prices for buying and selling vegetables. Now that her sons have grown up and the family expenses are increasing day by day, they feel the need to further improve their agricultural activities.  They have decided to cultivate paddy, which is an all-season crop and the staple food of the regional people in much demand throughout the year. So, they think it will be a profitable business that will earn more income.

Currently, Baijanti is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers etc. to start cultivation. She has a lot of faith and hope of getting ahead, because her household expenses depend on this work.

Her dream as a mother is to prepare her sons so they will be prosperous people in life.  With her profits, she plans to purchase more land and she conveys her thanks to her lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Fenya

texts.en: Fenya lives in Bazum village of Lori region with her three children (one son and two daughters). Fenya's husband has moved to Russian Federation to earn money and support his family. Fenya has been engaged in agriculture for around 15 years. With the help of her children, she breeds cattle and hens and cultivates beans, potatoes and various types of fruits. Fenya's younger daughter is still a one year old baby, so only three family members are engaged in agricultural activities. With the purpose to expand her family's agribusiness a little bit, Fenya has applied for a loan of USD 2,000. This amount will be used to buy one cow, two calves, and two pigs, as well as to pay for 500 kg of animal feed. Let's help this hard working woman implement her goals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (one cow, two calves, and two pigs) and animal feed (500 kg) for her livestock business.

loans.name: Tsisana

texts.en: Tsisana is a 51-year-old married woman from Gori district. She lives with her husband and they earn a living with their pension and social assistance from the local government only. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of significant income and live under poverty.  According to above-mentioned situation, Tsisana lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start-Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Tsisana to get a loan of 450 USD and start a trading business. She plans to purchase stock of used clothing at wholesale prices with the capital and sell it in her community. Tsisana will sell clothing from her house and will be able to generate some income for her family's welfare. The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: To start a trading business with used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Peres

texts.en: Peres is a 43-year-old widow blessed with two children who look to her for their upkeep. She has been operating a milk sales business for five years earning an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month. Peres was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan KES 10,000 and intends to use the entire amount to add to her personal savings to build a milk stall. Peres plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To add to her personal savings to build a milk stall.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina, 42 years old, is a very committed and hardworking woman who has a lot of dreams for herself and her family. She has three children (one son and two daughters), all of whom are students.  Two are in different grades in local school and the other one is in college.  They live in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She finished primary education with a lot of effort and support from her parents.

Bina's husband Mophijar, age 45, is engaged in agricultural activities.  He mainly grows paddy.  Bina helps her husband in different jobs every day to keep their crops healthy, which is an arduous and difficult job that is worthwhile at the end of the season.

Her family's income depends on this agribusiness. Her husband has many years of experience in this job, which he learned from his father.  The land is his own, an inheritance from his parents.  With the growing expenses of his family, he needs to expand his business by cultivating paddy in larger quantities.  This will not only meet the customer's demand but also earn an additional profit.  They need financial help.

Bina is now seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase more quality seeds and fertilizers to better cultivate paddy. She hopes for good revenue to meet all her dreams.

She wants to support her children in their studies so that they can become excellent professionals.

She also aspires to build a concrete-made better house for them with the profit because the house in which they are living at present is lacking all the minimum amenities.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Juan Wualberto

texts.es: Juan de 42 años de vive con su esposa y 3 hijos de 4, 6 y 10 años de edad  y dos  nietos, todos ellos estudiando. Él es un hombre muy tenaz que se gana la vida como albañil en su municipio y los cantones aledaños, además siembra maíz, y frijol para mejorar un poco la economía familiar, su esposa también lo apoya económicamente. Juan desea construir un corredor en su casa el cual encementará y le pondrá techo ya que el que tiene actualmente como se observa en la fotografía no cuenta con cemento en el piso y el techo se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, grava y arena para encementar el piso y comprará lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para el techo.
texts.en: Juan is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three of his children, aged ten, six and four years old respectively. He also has two grandchildren living with him. The children and grandchildren are all in school. Juan is a very tenacious man who earns a living as a builder in the municipality and surrounding cantons. He also grows corn and beans in order to improve the household economy a little. Juan's wife also supports him financially. Juan wants to build a hall in his house that he will cement, and above which he will have a roof. As can be seen in the photo, there is currently no cement on the floor, and the roof is in bad condition. Juan is therefore applying for a loan from "FUSAI". He will use it to buy cement, gravel and sand to cement the floor, and to buy metal sheeting, purlins and more for the roof.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel and sand to cement the floor, and to buy metal sheeting, purlins and more for the roof about the patio.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl de 34 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su grupo familiar. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida desde hace 16 años elaborando estructuras metálicas tales como: puertas, portones, balcones, etc. Además es agricultor, esto  permite que su compañera de vida lo apoye en la economía vendiendo en el mercado central los productos que cultivan como: banano, paterna, jocote, naranja,etc. Saúl desea mejorar el patio de su vivienda que como se observa en al fotografía no se encuentra encementado y el techo de este ya se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso y además comprará lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para el techo del patio de su vivienda.
texts.en: Saúl is 34 years old and lives with his partner and family. Saúl is a hard-working man who, for 16 years, has earned his living building metal structures, such as doors, gates, balconies and more. In addition Saúl works as a farmer; this allows his wife to support the family economy by selling the farming products, such as bananas, paterna, oranges, and mangoes, at the local market. Saúl wants to improve the patio in his house. As can be seen in the photo, there is no cement floor and the roof is in bad condition. Saúl is therefore applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy cement, gravel and sand to cement the floor, and to buy metal sheeting, purlins and more for the roof about the patio.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel and sand to cement the floor, and to buy metal sheeting, purlins and more for the roof about the patio.

loans.name: Blanca Noemi

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y elaboración de hamacas, trabaja todos los días, por la mañana se mantiene elaborando hamacas y en la tarde realiza la venta de pupusas; vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 11 años de edad.
Fortalecerá su negocio invirtiendo en insumos necesarios para ambas actividades, comprara hilo, agujas, harina, maíz, aderezos, gas propano, tomates, repollo, quesillo, chicharró y bebidas, le será de utilidad para terminar sus encargos y mejorar el servicio a sus cliente, espera poder recuperar la inversión con buenas ganancias.
Sus sueños son mantener a sus hijos estudiando hasta que logren culminar una carrera universitaria y construir una nueva vivienda para mejor la comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca makes a living selling "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) and making hammocks. Blanca works every day: in the morning she makes the hammocks, and in the afternoons she sells the "pupusas". Blanca lives with her husband and three children, aged 15, 13 and 11 years old respectively.

Blanca will use this loan to strengthen her business, buying supplies for both the hammocks and "pupusas". She will buy thread, needles, flour, corn, seasoning propane gas, tomatoes, cabbage, tortillas with cream cheese filling, pork and drinks. These items will be useful as she fulfils customer orders and improves customer service. Blanca hopes to earn back her investment in profit.

Blanca's dreams are to help her children to have a university education and to build a new house so that the family may live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, flour, corn, seasoning propane gas, tomatoes, cabbage, tortillas with cream cheese filling, pork and drinks.

loans.name: Ekiwe

texts.en:
Ekiwe is a 21-year-old single woman from the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She owns a small stall at the local market where she sells kapenta/matemba (dried sardines). She sometimes moves around to sell to her neighbors. Ekiwe inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students about how to maintain their well-being and as an adviser to aspiring entrepreneurs. 

Ekiwe started her business in 2013 when she saw an opportunity to better provide for herself. She will use the loan to purchase many bags of matemba from the fisheries to get bulk discounts and therefore increase profits. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being. She also hopes to help the underprivileged children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, como maíz, frijol y maicillo, lo aprendió de muy joven con la ayuda de su papá, su negocio funciona desde hace 20 años, en un horario de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde; vive con su familia compuesta por su esposo, sus hijos, nueras y nietos.
Comprará abono, plaguicidas, fertilizantes, abono, insecticidas y herbicidas, son materiales necesarios para limpiar el terreno, eliminar plagas y mejorar la productividad, espera tener mejor alimentación para su familia y mayores ganancias con las que cumplirá con sus compromisos económicos.
Sus aspiraciones son ofrecer a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y prepararse para la próxima siembra.
texts.en: Buenaventura grows staple crops such as corns, beans and sorghum.  She learned this work very young with the help of her father and she has had this business for 20 years.  She works from 7am to 3pm.  She lives with her family, which is made up of her husband, sons, daughters-in-law, and grandchildren.  She will purchase manure, pesticides, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides.  These things are necessary for clearing the land, eradicating pests, and improving productivity.  She hopes to provide better nutrition for her family and greater income so that she can meet her financial commitments.  She hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and prepare for the next planting season.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркул 46 лет, вдова, одна воспитывает 3 детей. У Анаркул средне-специальное образование, она работает поваром в местном детском саде. Также Анаркул получает пенсию по состоянию здоровья. Однако доходов от заработной платы и пенсии не хватает на содержание семьи. Уже после смерти супруга, когда семья оказалась в бедственном положении, Анаркуль пришлось самой содержать свою семью и искать дополнительные источники доходов, и она начала занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 1 бычок, 10 овец и 4 лошади, также имеется земельный надел мерою 6,00 ГА, где Анаркул выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет. Благодаря упорному труду, Анаркул на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль в среднем 13,000 сом(KGS) в месяц с продажи сельхозпродукции, фруктов, овощей, молока. Дети активно помогают по хозяйству, как в реализации, так и в ведении бизнеса. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на покупку дома в курортной зоне, у нее есть мечта в будущем заниматься туристическим бизнесом.
texts.en: Anarkul is 46 years old, a widow raising 3 children alone. Anarkul has a secondary-specialized education and works as a cook at a local kindergarten. Anarkul also receives a pension due to her health condition. However, the earnings from the work and pension are not enough to support the family. After the death of her husband, when the family was left in a troubled situation, Anarkul had to support the family on her own and find an additional source of income, and became involved in animal husbandry and farming. Today, Anarkul's business contains 1 cow, 1 bull, 10 sheep and 4 horses, and also has a 6.00 hectare land plot, where Anarkul grows potatoes, cereal crops and sainfoin. Thanks to her hard work, today Anarkul earns an average monthly profit of 13,000 som (KGS) from sales of agricultural products, fruits, vegetables and milk. The children actively help her with the household, both with sales and running the business. In order to further develop her business, Anarkul requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock. Anarkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business in order to save money to buy a house in a resort area; she has a dream of getting involved in a tourism business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Alva Colorina

texts.es: Alva de 32 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 7 años de edad. Ella trabaja prestando sus servicios domésticos desde hace un año y medio lo que le permite sostener a sus hijos y darles el estudio que es tan necesario. Alva desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del patio de su vivienda por lo que comprará cemento, arena y grava para encementar y comprará lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para mejorar el patio de su vivienda.
texts.en: Alva is 32 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her 3 children, ages 14,11, and 7.  She has worked as a housekeeper for a year and a half, which is how she supports her children and provides them with an education, which is so important.  Alva would like to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in improvements to the patio of her home.  She will purchase cement, sand, aggregates, galvanized panels, support beams and pins to improve the patio of her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and aggregates, galvanized panels, support braces and pins to improve the patio of her home.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es:
Geronimo es un hombre trabajador, tiene 56 años de edad, está felizmente casado y vive en Arequipa junto a su esposa y sus dos maravillosos hijos.
Es un hombre emprendedor, desde hace más de 2 años viene innovando en el cultivo de quinua en su propio predio. Le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador, honesto y sobre todo porque trabaja arduamente para ofrecer productos de calidad, siendo uno de los productores más solicitados en la zona.
Geronimo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar fertilizantes para poder abonar sus cultivos, de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos con las ventas y seguirá luchando para poder conseguir uno de sus más grandes sueños: "Ampliar sus cultivos y ser el primer distribuidor de quinua en toda la región".
texts.en: Geronimo is a hard working man.  He is 56 years old, happily married, and lives in Arequipa along with his wife and their two wonderful children.  He is an entrepreneurial man.  For more than 2 years he has been innovating by growing qunoa on his land. It is going well because he is very responsible, hard working, honest, and above all because he works hard to offer quality products.  He is one of the most requested producers in the area. Geronimo is thankful to the Kiva lenders because their support has allowed him to purchase fertilizers for his crops.  This will increase his income through sales, and he will keep striving to achieve one of his greatest dreams, which is to expand his crops and be the top quinoa distributor in the entire region.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his quinoa crops.

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 37 femmes fait parti du banc villageois a été crée le 22 octobre 2012. Il est constitué par des femmes du même village et qui entretiennent de bonnes relations. La plupart font du commerce et de l'embouche comme activité.
Boury debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est la vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons.
Elle envisage de faire du commerce d'arachide dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la zone mais aussi de l'aviculture.
Elle va acheter avec le prêt des poulets pour les élever; de l’arachide à 175f le kg. L’arachide va lui servir de semence pour l'hivernage après récolte elle va vendre le kg entre 225f et 250f.
Elle utilise les bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son commerce,épargner et s'occuper des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group of 37 women is a part of the banc villageois that was established 22 October 2012. It is made up of women from the same village who share good relations. Most work in commerce or livestock fattening. 

Boury, who is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of the group. She is 43 years old, married, and a mother of five children, of whom two are boys.

Boury plans to sell groundnuts at the weekly local markets and also work in poultry farming. With her loan, she is going to buy groundnuts at 175 francs per kilogram and chickens to raise. 

The groundnuts will serve as seeds to farm during the rainy season. After the harvest, she is going to sell them for between 225 francs and 250 francs a kilogram. 

Boury uses her earnings to reinvest in her business, put in savings, and support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy chickens and groundnuts

loans.name: Maguette's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de deux femmes habitent le même quartier; elles ont comme principale activité le commerce. Maguette l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe elle est à son 10e cycle dans le BV. Maguette est âgée de 27 ans, mariée et sans enfant. Elle s'active dans la vente de tissus teintés (thioub), elle achète au mali et revend au Sénégal au comptant et à crédit chez elle, en faisant aussi du porte à porte. Elle a plus de 5 ans d’expérience. Ce prêt de 500 000 est destiné à continuer son commerce. Elle compte acheter des tissus pour une valeur de 425 000. Elle est bien connue dans le quartier pour son activité. La clientèle lui est fidèle surtout avec les fêtes religieuses. Durant ce cycle, ses bénéfices serviront à la prise en charge de ses parents et au renforcement de son épargne
texts.en:
This group is made up of two women who live in the same area and who work primarily in commerce. 

Maguette is the featured borrower of this group. She is the leader of the group and is on her 10th cycle in the banc villageois. She is 27 years old, married, and has no children.

Maguette works selling dyed fabrics (thioub), which she buys in Mali and resells in Senegal. She makes her sales from home and by going door-to-door, for cash and credit. She has more than five years experience.

Her loan of 500,000 francs will be used to continue her business. As part of this, she plans to buy 425,000 francs worth of fabric. She is well known in her area for her business. She has a loyal base of customers, especially for religious festivals. 

During this cycle, earnings will serve to take care of her parents and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabric

loans.name: Kukivi Group

texts.fr:
J Désiré fait parti du groupe kukivi et  habite à Gitega. Il a 43 ans et est marié à Pascasie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants âgés de 2 à  20 ans, dont 3 étudient.
