I l fait le commerce de planches depuis 16 ans.

Il est à son quatrième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de planches à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
J Désiré is a member of the Kukivi group and lives in Gitega. He is 43 years old and is married to Pascasie, a farmer. Together, they have six children, aged from two to 20 years old. Three of the children go to school.

J Désiré has worked selling planks of wood for 16 years. He is on his fourth loan with Turame. 

With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital to buy many planks of wood to resell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy many planks of wood to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est crée le 08 Avril 2011 et regroupe des femmes habitant dans le même village. Les membres du groupe sont unis par la solidarité et l’entraide. Mareme est âgée de 24 ans. Elle est célibataire  et sans enfant. Elle fait du commerce de tissu. Elle a une bonne d’expérience dans cette activité. Elle vend dans son village. Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter  des tissus pour son atelier de couture qui se trouve au village. Elle est la seule à faire cette activité dans le village. Elle va et renforcer son épargne pour avoir le prêt spécial
texts.en:
This group was created on 8 April 2011 and is made up of women who live in the same village. The group members are joined by a sense of solidarity and a feeling of mutual support.

Mareme is 24 years old. She is single and has no children. She works selling fabric, and has a good experience with this business.

With this loan, she plans to buy fabric for her workshop, which is located in the village. She is the only one who does this work in her village.

Mareme plans to increase her savings, so that she is eligible for a special loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Edwin Alfredo

texts.es: Edwin de 34 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 14, 8 y 7 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida desde hace 10 años como albañil en los cantones cercanos, además aprendió la carpintería y hace reparaciones en su casa, también es agricultor y cosecha maíz, frijol, maicillo, etc. lo que le permite que su compañera de vida lo apoye con la economía vendiendo los productos que cosechan. Edwin desea construir un muro de contención para su vivienda ya que el que tiene actualmente se encuentra en malas condiciones por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar arena, cemento y piedra para reconstruir el muro de su vivienda.
texts.en: Edwin, 34, lives with his partner and their three children who are 14, 8 and 7 years old. He is a entrepreneur who has made a living for the past 10 years as a builder in nearby cantons and has also learned carpentry and made repairs in his home as well as being a farmer and harvesting corn, beans, sorghum etc. with his partner helping to sell the products they harvest. Edwin wants to construct a retaining wall for his home as the current one is in poor condition. He is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy sand, cement and stone to reconstruct this wall at his home.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and stone to reconstruct the wall at his home.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin, es soltero, vive en casa familiar con sus padres y sus hermanos, su negocio es la compra y venta de jilotes y pipianes, se los compro a diferentes agricultores en época de invierno que posteriormente los distribuye en el mercado, para la temporada de verano él se encarga de cultivarlos, ya tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad, es un oficio que aprendió de sus padres.
Comprará una motocicleta, jilotes y pipianes, le será de utilidad para mejorar el deslazamiento a su trabajo y tener productos frescos para vender  a sus clientes, espera con la inversión fortalecer su negocio y mejorar su situación económica.
Sus aspiraciones son resarcir su deuda, apoyar a sus padres económicamente y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marvin is single and lives in his family home with his parents and siblings. His business is buying and selling corn and pipian which he buys from different farmers in the winter and sells them at the market during the summer. He is careful to cultivate the products, having 10 years of experience, learning this trade from his parents.
With the loan, he will buy a motorcycle, corn and pipian which will be useful to improve his workflow, having fresh products to sell to his customers and this investment is expected to strengthen his business and improve his financial situation.
His goals are to repay his debt, help his parents financially and build his own home.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle, corn and pipian.

loans.name: Medalith Victoria

texts.es:
Medalith es una joven emprendedora, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Nazca junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace más de dos años trabaja brindado servicios de atención al cliente en un restaurante, le va muy bien porque es muy trabajadora, responsable, honesta y sobre todo porque es muy amable y respetuosa con los clientes.
Medalith está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá cercar su terreno para que sea más seguro y su familia pueda vivir de manera más cómoda, gracias a esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder "Estudiar una carrera universitaria y brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia".
texts.en:
Medalith, 20, is a young entrepreneur. She is single and lives in Nazca with her family. She is eager to succeed and has been working for more than two years providing customer service in a restaurant. She is doing very well as she is very hardworking, responsible, honest and above all friendly and respectful to her customers.
Medalith is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this support helps her to build a fence around her land, making it more secure for her family, helping them to live more comfortably and improving their quality of life. She will continue to strive "for a university degree and to provide a better future for her family".

loans.use: Build a fence around her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, wood, and iron, and she must pay for labor to build the walls of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy scement, sand, gravel, wood, and iron, and to pay for labor to build a perimeter wall for her home.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 39 años de edad es madre soltera  y vive con sus 5 hijos de 18, 16, 15, 14 y 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo diferentes productos. La venta la realiza de  viernes a domingo compra artesanías que vende en lugares turísticos y los días restantes vende variedad de ropa como: camisas, pantalones, faldas, etc. Isabel desea construir un tapial alrededor de su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, etc.
texts.en: 39 year old Isabel is a single mother and lives with her 5 children who are 18, 16, 15, 14, and 10 years old. She is an enterprising woman who earns a living selling various products. She makes her sales from Friday to Sunday and buys crafts that she sells in tourist areas. On the other days she sells a variety of clothing such as: shirts, pants, skirts, etc. Isabel wants to build a wall around her house plot so she requested a loan from FUSAI to buy materials like: cement, sand, wood, etc.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, wood, etc to build a wall around the house plot.

loans.name: Pablo David

texts.es:
Pablo es un joven emprendedor, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Lambayeque junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace casi 2 años trabaja como Operario en un taller de fabricación de plásticos, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesto y sobre todo porque siempre se preocupa por hacer bien su labor.
Pablo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un juego de comedor para su casa, de esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y podrán vivir con mayores comodidades.
Así, él seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder "Estudiar una carrera universitaria".
texts.en:
Pablo is a young entrepreneur. He is 21 years old, single, and lives in Lambayeque along with his family.
He is a person who has a great drive to succeed. For almost 2 years, he has worked as an operator in a plastic fabrication workshop. He has done very well because he is a hardworking, responsible, and honest person and, above all, because he is always concerned with doing his work well. 
Pablo is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy a dining table and chairs for his house. In this way, he will improve the quality of life for his family and they will be able to live more comfortably. 
In this way, he will continue striving to later be able to "study for a university degree."

loans.use: Compra de

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en:
Adolf, 45, is married with five children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and also has cows, works as a security guard and makes bricks. 

He faces the challenges of seasonal changes. He, however, hopes to acquire 10,000 eucalyptus trees for planting and to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Adolf needs a loan to buy firewood to make bricks.

loans.use: to buy firewood for brickmaking.

loans.name: Madinabony

texts.ru: Мадинабону молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она разведена и сама воспитывает 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Мадинабону занимается собственным бизнесом уже более 2 лет. Она торгует на местном рынке. Мадинабону продаёт детскую одежду. Она имеет свою торговую точку. Мадинабону старается развевать свой бизнес, так как ее бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Ее дети школьники и Мадинабону всегда старается для образования своих детей. Она хочет купить новую партию товара для расширения ассортимента товара и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Madinabony is a young and cheerful woman. She is divorced and is raising two young children. Madinabony has been running her own business for over two years. She sells children's clothing in the local market and has her own stall. Madinabony is trying to grow her business, as it is the main source of income for her family. Madinabony's children are in school, and she works hard to support their education. 

In order to buy a new batch of products and expand her inventory of goods, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 Somoni. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy clothes in order to increase product selection

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a 23-year-old businesswoman who is married with one child and lives in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She has been operating a shop, selling grocery items from her home, since 2010. 

She started the business as a way of raising income for her family and is proud to be the area's biggest supplier of items such as flour, sugar, soaps, toothpaste and body creams. 

Getrude volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school, facilitating life skills sessions. She also sometimes helps the elderly with their household chores. 

With this requested loan from Kiva, she intends to boost her stock by buying flour, sugar, soaps, toothpaste and body creams in bulk. With her additional profits, she intends to expand into a large retail business and also create employment in her community.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, soaps, toothpaste and body creams in bulk to boost her stock.

loans.name: Flor Delmy

texts.es: Flor de 50 años de edad vive con su madre y su hijo mayor de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo ropa de forma ambulante en los mercados aledaños a su cantón de lunes a jueves y de viernes a domingo compra sandalia por  mayoreo y la vende de forma ambulante, su hijo la apoya económicamente. Flor desea construir el servicio sanitario de su vivienda y el patio de la misma por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y la taza del inodoro para construir el servicio sanitario y encementar el patio de la vivienda, además comprará lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para colocar el techo del patio de la vivienda.
texts.en: 50 year old Flor lives with her mother and her eldest son. She is a hardworking woman who earns a living selling clothes in the markets close to her town from Monday to Thursday and, from Friday to Sunday, she buys sandals wholesale and sells them. Her son also gives her economic support. Flor wants to build a restroom in her house and a patio so she has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, wood, and a toilet for the restroom and to make a cement floor for the patio. She will also buy galvanized sheets, joists, and planks to build a roof for the patio.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, wood, and ladrillo and the toilet to build a restroom and make a cement floor for the patio of her home. Also to buy corrugated sheets, joists, and planks to build the patio roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and rebar, and to pay for labor to build the walls of his house

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 22-year-old hardworking man who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in transportation and also farms to boost his income. 

He faces the hardship of insufficient capital. He hopes, however, to achieve a stable monthly income. 

Patrick needs a loan to buy a new motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 27 years old. She is married with two children and resides in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe.  She has been successfully operating a clothing store at her homestead for 15 months selling trousers, skirts, skirts and dresses. She started the business to improve herself and cast out the poverty that has been tormenting her since she was young. Margret is also a volunteer Learner Guide at the schools within her community, promoting study and life skills. With the requested loan Margret intends to buy trousers, skirts, skirts, baby wear, jackets, shoes and dresses to have a variety of clothes to offer and boost her sales. With the additional profits she hopes to be financially stable and support her siblings and children through school.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, rice and other basic needs in order to reduce costs and boost her profits.

loans.name: El Corazon 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is one member of the 15-person group, El Corazon 1, 2, 3. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. Maria, like all in this group, decided to do business with Esperanza because she needed to bring extra income to her household. She is a single mother of three children. She is running a Beauty Salon where she also sells different beauty products, cosmetics and hair extensions.

Maria started her business with a loan she had from a commercial bank, and this loan allowed her to have her business. She came to Esperanza to reinvest in her business. With this loan she will invest in her business to increase her inventory by buying hair extensions and beauty products to resell and use with her clients.  Her future plans are to have a successful Salon or Spa and provide her children a great education and all they need.

Maria joined Esperanza almost three years ago and this is her sixth loan. All previous loans have been repaid and invested in her business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy beauty products, hair extensions, etc.

loans.name: Abibu

texts.en: Abibu of 39 years, is a married Ugandan man with no children. He primarily deals in selling agricultural products including maize, sorghum, millet, ground nuts, beans, soya beans to mention but a few.  In additional, he is also engaged in farming, mainly growing maize and bananas from which he gets additional income to sustain his family. The loan he requested will be used to buy more beans to sell. His target market are schools within his area of operation. He dreams of purchasing more stock to grow his business. Price fluctuations of agricultural products affect his performance.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат честная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1965 году. Инобат замужем и имеет 4 детей. Инобат более 29 лет работает в средней школе уборщицей. Она честно выполняет свою работу и использует свою зарплату для обеспечения семьи продуктами питания. Для Инобата наступили трудные времена, так как ее младший сын болен и врачи должны оперировать его. Инобат обратилась за займом в сумме 5000 сомони для операции сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и очень надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Inobat is an honest and hardworking woman. She was born in 1965. Inobat is married and has four children. Inobat has more than 29 years of experience as a high school janitor. She does her job honestly and uses her salary to buy food for her family.  

Inobat is in a difficult time, as her youngest son is sick and doctors need to operate on him. Inobat applied for a loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS to pay for her son's operation. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her son's operation

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 31-year-old married mother of three who resides in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a life skills facilitator and counsels students at the local secondary school. Agnes buys and sells fish. She started this when she wanted to raise school fees for her younger sister who was being kicked out of school because she was unable to pay the school fees. Since she is the eldest in the family Agnes took over the motherly roles after her parents passed. She moves from one community to the other advertising and selling her kapenta/ matemba (dried sardines). She also is a voluntary preschool teacher at the local primary school, and is a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school.  With the Kiva loan, Agnes will buy more supplies and fish to sell at her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Lado

texts.en: Lado is a Babban Gona farmer from Badamasi. Lado is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Lado to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Lado can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Lado is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Lado will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Lado will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Danjuma

texts.en: Danjuma is a Babban Gona farmer from Badamasi. Danjuma is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Danjuma to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Danjuma can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Danjuma is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Danjuma will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Danjuma will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Bahrullo

texts.ru: Бахрулло человек с добрым сердцем. Он живет в отдаленном регионе и воспитывает 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Бахрулло живет с детьми, женой и родителями. Единственным семейным доходом является скотоводство. Бахрулло 10 лет назад начала бизнес скотоводством. Бахрулло в основном откармливает коров. Он продает молоко и молочные продукты местным жителям. Бахрулло помогают родители и его жена введению бизнеса. Он введет бизнес довольно успешно, так как он имеет хорошие возможности и условия для развития бизнеса. Бахрулло запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Bahrullo is a man with a good heart. He lives in a remote area and is raising two small children. Bahrullo lives with his children, wife and parents. The family's only income is from cattle. Ten years ago, Bahrullo started a business breeding cattle and now mainly fattens cows. He sells milk and dairy products to local residents. Bahrullo's parents and his wife help him run the business. He operates the business quite successfully since he has good opportunities for growth. 

Bahrullo is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy additional cattle. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Babban Gona farmer from G/Bala. Emmanuel expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Emmanuel to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.

Like all Babban Gona members, Emmanuel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Emmanuel, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 70 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Emmanuel will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Emmanuel will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 39-year-old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He deals in retail alongside the lucrative motorcycle transport business in order to boost his income. He faces challenges of motorcycle breakdown due to the bad roads. Besides that, he hopes of buying a car.
Julius needs a loan to buy stock like sugar, soap,cooking oil, to sell in his store.

loans.use: to buy stock like sugar, soap, cooking oil, to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 32-year-old hardworking lady with 1 child living in Fort Portal Uganda. She runs a retail shop and carries out farming to make ends meet. She faces a challenge of customers who delay paying her. She hopes to educate her child to higher levels of learning. Jackline needs a loan to buy beers,sodas and waragi to sell

loans.use: to buy beer,sodas and waragi to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 49-year-old hardworking lady with 7 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She deals in farming, selling fresh foods and produce. She faces challenges of her fresh product perishing, which leads to losses. She has hopes of building a residential house for her family. 
Florence needs a loan to buy produce and fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce and fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Marufakhon

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Маруфахон. Ей 42 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более 15 лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для покупки скота. С полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Marufakhon is a kind person who is always trying to improve her living conditions, hopes for a brighter future, and needs financial support. She is 42 years old. She's married and is raising four children.  

Since she lives in the countryside, she has a good opportunities to grow her animal husbandry business. She has more than 15 years of experience in animal husbandry and has extensive experience in this field of business. Thanks to the good quality of her cattle, she has loyal customers. She wants to grow her business and generate more revenue. 

She requested a loan of 4,500 Somoni to buy additional cattle. With income received from the cattle, she plans to improve her living conditions. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Jardin Group

texts.en:
Momostenango is located in Western Guatemala and is known as an agricultural area with a cool climate. Most of the population is of Maya K'iche' descent and most are small farmers who grow corn and beans as well as wheat. Some raise animals like goats and sheep. The wool is used to fabricate warm wool blankets, quite useful in the cool climate of the area. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Jardín” meaning “Garden” is located here and consists of twelve indigenous women, three of whom are new to the group. They are about to begin a new Loan Cycle and are quite hopeful that they will continue to improve their standard of living. 

Leonarda, the 32-year-old Secretary of the group, has had five years of formal education. She is a single parent, raising two children, and works diligently every day to meet their current and future needs. One of her children is in primary school which makes her very happy. Leonarda has an animal husbandry business and is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase chickens and goats. With the income that she will realize, Leonarda will be able to pay for the family’s  necessities including food and education.

Approximately one-half of the women in the Trust Bank are unable to read and write. Realizing this, Friendship Bridge combines the small loans with educational seminars a combination called “Microcredit Plus”. A Loan Officer from the organization meets with the Trust Bank each month and the ladies acquire basic business and personal tools that are useful to them. For example, to help them with their loans, the women learn about effective business practices including budgeting, accounting, pricing, marketing, customer service and indebtedness. To support them in their personal lives, the ladies learn about nutrition, health, hygiene and self esteem.

At the end of their last meeting, the twelve women, with hopeful smiles on their faces, expressed their appreciation to KIVA investors for funding their loans. They have promised to work hard and to be responsible. Thank you, KIVA investors, from the “Jardín” Trust Bank in Momostenango, Guatemala!

loans.use: To purchase chickens and goats

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Мухарам добрая женщина. Ей 54 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 8 лет назад она начала свой бизнес купле продажи обуви. Она продает женские, мужские и детские обуви на местном рынке. Она имеет большой опыт и знает тонкости своего дела. Несмотря на все ее достоинства, мощная конкуренция  делового мира, заставляет ее быть внимательной и обновлять товар каждый сезон. Она должна купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони  для покупки товара для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muharam is a kind woman. She is 54 years old. She is married and is raising three children. Eight years ago, she started a business buying and selling shoes in order to provide her family with necessities. The business sells women's, men's and children's shoes in the local market. She has a lot of experience and knows all the intricacies of her business. 

Despite her capabilities, the powerful competition among businesses causes her to be attentive and requires that she update her inventory every season. She needs to buy goods for the new season, but does not have sufficient means to do so. She has requested a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy merchandise for the new season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy shoes for the new season

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира 42 летняя жительница района Хамадони. Она замужем, но ее муж находиться на заработках заграницей, как и многие мужчины Республики. Замира живет на родине и тут же работает. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Она любит свою работу. Замира каждый день встречается с новыми людьми и имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она недавно начала свою деятельность, но уже научилась многим тонкостям торговой деятельности. Сейчас ей необходимо привести новый товар соответствующий сезону. Но из-за нехватки средств она обратилась за кредитом. Поддержите Замиру.
texts.en:
Zamira is a 42 year old resident of Hamadoni. She is married but, like many men of the Republic, her husband lives abroad. Zamira lives and works at home. She sells children's clothing and loves her job.  Every day, Zamira meets new people and and has loyal customers. 

She has recently started her business, but has already learned many of the subtleties of retailing. Now she needs to buy new merchandise for the corresponding season. 

Due to lack of funds, she has applied for a loan. Please support Zamira.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Lilian Judith

texts.es:
La Señora. Lilian es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Floreciendo, este es su segundo crédito y le gusta esta forma de créditos porque son como una gran familia unida ya que comparten gratos momentos y siempre se están apoyando en las buenas y los malos momentos. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que esta bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico fue nombrado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad y su gente que es muy amable y cordial.
La Señora. Lilian tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de un mes de nacido y está muy feliz por ello ya que es un niño muy sano, su esposo labora atendiendo un tienda de abarrotes que es un negocio en sociedad con su suegra, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Lilian se dedica a su bebé pero también trabaja en el negocio familiar con su esposo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para el negocio. Su meta es de tener su negocio independiente y no en sociedad.
texts.en:
Lilian is a kind and gentle person. She is a member of the „Mujeres Floreciendo“ group and they are in their second loan cycle. Lilian likes this way of taking out a loan, because they are like a big and united family, sharing the good times and always helping each other in the good and the bad times. 

Lilian lives in Cuenca. Four rivers flow through this town and its historic center is a World Heritage Site. The people in Cuenca are very kind and friendly.

Lilian is 24 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has a son who is one month old. She is very happy, because he is a very healthy boy. Her husband works in a grocery store. He owns this store together with her mother-in-law. They do not own a house, this is why they live in a rented apartment.

Lilian spends most of her time raising the baby, but she also works in the family business with her husband. She wants to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of supplies for the store. It is her aim to have her own business, not one which is run with a partner.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fazila

texts.ru: Фазила занимается бизнесом. Она трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Фазила разведенная и воспитывает дочь одна. Она 4 года назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. Фазила продает продукты питания в продуктовом магазине. Она продает все виды продуктов питания как хлеб, масло, макарон, сахар и т.п. Фазила обратилась за займом в ИМОН для того, чтобы купить продукты питания для увеличения оборотного капитала. Фазила запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Fazila runs a business. She is hardworking and honest woman. Fazila is divorced and is raising a daughter on her own. Four years ago, she started a business buying and selling food. Fazila sells the food at a grocery store. She sells all kinds of food, including bread, butter, pasta, sugar, etc. 

Fazila has applied for a loan of 3,000 Somoni from IMON International to buy food in order to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food items to increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cans of vegetable oil and palm oil.

loans.name: Pool Keny

texts.es:
Pool es un joven emprendedor, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Pachacamac junto a su familia.
Desde hace casi un año trabaja como Auxiliar de Prensa en una prestigiosa empresa, le va muy bien porque es una persona trabajadora, responsable, honesta y con muchos deseos de superación.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ello que lucha día a día para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y un futuro mejor.
Pool está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprarse un celular ya que perdió el antiguo celular y no tiene cómo comunicarse con su familia. Gracias a este apoyo él podrá comunicarse con sus padres cuando trabaje y de esta manera ellos no se preocuparán. Así, Pool seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Pool, 48, is an enterprising young man.  He's single and lives in Pachacamac with his family.

He has worked as a press assistant in a prestigious business for almost a year.  It's going very well for him because he's a hardworking, responsible, and honest person with a great desire for self-improvement.

His biggest motivation in life is his family, for whom he strives every day to be able to give a better quality of life and a better future.  Pool is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support he'll be able to buy himself a mobile phone.  He lost his old one and doesn't have a way to communicate with his family.

Thanks to this support he'll be able to communicate with his parents when he's working and they won't worry.  That way, Pool will keep on making an effort so in the future he can achieve his big dream of having his own business.

loans.use: to buy a mobile phone

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Сурайё живет и работает в столице Таджикистана. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Сурайё занимается бизнесом уже более 5 лет. Она выпекает торты и продает своим клиентам. Ее торты продаются в магазинах города. Сурайё выпекает торты у себя дома, где имеет оборудованный цех по выпечки тортов. Ее мать помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она планирует увеличить оборотный капитал и развевать бизнес дальше. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки муки, сахара масла, яйца и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Surayo lives and works in the capital of Tajikistan. She is 26 years old. She is married and is raising one son. 

Surayo has been in business for over five years. She bakes cakes and sells them to customers. Her cakes are sold in the shops of the city. Surayo bakes the cakes at her home, which is equipped as a bakery. Her mother helps her in the business. 

She plans to increase her working capital and grow her business. She has requested a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy flour, sugar, butter, eggs, etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, butter, etc. to increase working capital

loans.name: Cochapamba  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Cochapamba está formado por 11 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeados de verdes campos gracias a la agricultura que realizan sus habitantes, también se dedican a la crianza de animales y comercio, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su arquitectura es una mezcla de la antiguo y lo moderno. Las socias tienen un objetivo en común el cual es salir adelante con sus familias y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, los crédito les apoyan para que crezcan poco a poco en sus negocios y se sienten orgullosas por sus logros.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Tania, es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito  Cochapamba, le gusta esta forma de créditos por la unión y solidaridad que existe entre las socias, así como también los consejos de las experiencias vividas por sus compañeras de mayor edad, esto le ayuda a su superación personal. 
La Señorita Tania tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 3 años, vive en casa de sus padres y comparte los gastos del hogar.
Doña Tania pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de su pequeña hija, pero para aportar a la economía de su casa se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura,  le gusta mucha esta actividad porque le permite ser independiente y así también genera ingresos para su hogar.
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo ha invertido en la compra de animales al igual que su nuevo crédito va a ser para la compra de pollos y cuyes, le va muy bien en esta actividad y espera seguir creciendo poco a poco en este negocio.
texts.en:
The Cochapamba credit group is made up of 11 women who live around the parish of El Valle in Cuenca.  The place is surrounded by green fields thanks to the agriculture that its residents practice. They also raise animals and work as merchants. They maintain their cultures and traditions and their architecture is a mixture of old and new. The members have a common goal, which is to get ahead with their families and offer their children a better future. The loans help them grow their businesses little by little and they are proud of their achievements.
 
One of the members of the group is Tania. She is a friendly and kind member of the Cochapamba credit group and she likes the loan method because of the unity and solidarity between the members. She also likes the advice from the life experience of the older members. This helps her get ahead.  

Tania is 22 years old. She is the single mother of a 3 year old child. She lives in her parents' house and shares the household expenses. Tania spends most of her time at home caring for her young daughter, but to contribute to the household budget she raises animals and farms. She really likes this activity because it allows her to be independent and also generate income for the home.  

The money from the previous loan was invested in buying animals and the new loan will be to buy chickens and guinea pigs. This activity is going very well for her and she hopes to keep growing this business little by little.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, guinea pigs.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KUSI CCOYLLOR, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria Magdalena se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is a member of Kusi Ccoyllor Communal Bank, located in the district of Vilcabamba in La Convención Province in Cusco Department.

She has earned a living selling food for eight years and it's going very well for her.  She makes a variety of dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and "saltados" [pan-seared meat].  She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.

María Magdalena's requesting the loan to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KUSI CCOYLLOR, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Edelmira se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edelmira belongs to the KUSI CCOYLLOR communal bank in Vilcabamba District, which is part of La Convencion Province in the Department of Cusco. She runs a small grocery store, where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits each day from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Edelmira opened the store five years ago, and although the business is prospering, she would like to expand it. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of  rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits. 

Edelmira is happy to have the opportunity for a loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de libreria, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues to work at her business selling groceries and books. She sells staple products such as rice, milk, sugar, and cookies. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Illeish

texts.ru:
Иллейш — из Берегово. Он работает предпринимателем, занимается укладкой паркета. Иллейш — очень хозяйственный, умеет много делать своими руками. Из-да событий в стране ему пришлось нелегко, так как заказов на работу было мало. Однако Иллейш не растерялся и не опустил руки, а решил временно заниматься другим видом бизнеса. 
У Иллейша собственный одноэтажный дом из 5 комнат. Но побелка в доме старая, местами штукатурка отпадает, а окна и двери не дают никакой теплоизоляции. Поэтому Иллейш давно хотел улучшить жилищные условия в своем доме, поэтому и решил воспользоваться финансовой помощью КИВА. Сумму в 40 000 гривен он хочет вложить в шпаклевание и побелку стен и потолка, а также в замену входных дверей и двух окон.
texts.en:
Illeish is from Beregovo. He works as a handyman installing flooring. Illeish is very handy around the house, and can do a lot with his hands. Because of the recent events in his country, he is having a hard time and does not have enough  work orders. However, Illeish does not dismay and hasn't given up--instead, he decided to temporarily keep busy with another sort of business.

Illeish owns a single story house with 5 rooms. But the house has paint that is aging, plaster that is falling apart in some places, and windows and doors that provide no insulation. Illeish has wanted to improve the living conditions in his home for a long time, so he decided to take advantage of financial aid from Kiva.  He wants to use the 40,000 UAH to invest in puttying and plastering the walls and ceiling, as well as replacing the entrance doors and two windows.

loans.use: to remodel his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves and fatten up cattle.

loans.name: Karen Eliana

texts.es:
Karen es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace varios años brinda servicios de Telefonía a las personas, es decir, alquila celulares a todas las personas que requieran realizar una llamada. Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y sobre todo porque es muy respetuosa y amable con los clientes.
Karen está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un televisor para que pueda disfrutar las diversas reuniones con su familia en sus momentos libres. De esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para poder más adelante cumplir su mayor sueño: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Karen is an enterprising young woman. She is 21 years old, single, and lives with her family in Ica. She is a person who is very motivated to get ahead.

For a couple of years, she has offered telephone services to her customers, which means, she lends cellphones to people who want to make a call. She is very successful, because she is a very responsible, hard-working and honest person who is, above all, very respected and liked by her customers.

Karen is very grateful to Kiva lenders. With their help, she will be able to buy a TV, so she can enjoy watching TV with her family in her free time. By this she will improve her quality of life, and she will continue to work hard to be able to fulfil her greatest dream: “To have her own business.”

loans.use: to buy a TV.

loans.name: Gladis Maribel

texts.es: Gladis: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 53 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos, mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace más de 5 años estableció su pulpería. Solicita financiamiento parar comprar mercadería: Granos básicos, chiverías, sopas instantáneas, papel higiénico, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es comprar una finca y engordar ganado.
texts.en: Gladis is 53, a native of Puerto Cabezas and the mother of five adult children. She opened a grocery store give years ago in order to generate her own source of income. Gladis is applying for a loan for the purchase of merchandise: staple grains, snacks, instant soups, toilet paper, sodas, and other groceries. Gladis hopes one day to buy a ranch and raise cattle.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise: stable grains, snacks, instant soups, toilet paper, sodas, and other groceries.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана живет и работает в Новой Каховке. Она торгует женской спортивной одеждой на местном рынке, арендуя землю у администрации данного рынка, как это заведено у многих малых предпринимателей здесь, которые пока не могут позволить себе выкупить торговую точку. В торговле Светлана работает уже 19 лет. На данный момент основной группой ее товаров являются футболки, кофты, шорты и костюмы. 
На средства КИВА в размере 31 000 гривен Светлана планирует закупить куртки, жилетки, брюки, теплые костюмы на предстоящий осенне-зимний сезон продаж. Имея достаточный опыт торговли, качественный ходовой товар и померные цены на него, а также интерес к работе в этой сфере деятельности, Светлана планирует заниматься бизнесом и в дальнейшем, развивая свое дело и обеспечивая свою семью.
texts.en:
Svetlana lives and works in Novaya Kohovka. She sells women's sportswear in the local market, renting her stall from the market's administration, which has enabled many small businesses here that cannot yet afford to buy their own stores. Svetlana has been running her business for 19 years. Currently her main products are T-shirts, sweaters, shorts and sports suits.

With the 31,000 hryvnia from Kiva, Svetlana plans to buy jackets, vests, pants, and warm outfits for the coming autumn and winter seasons. Having sufficient retail experience, quality merchandise and competitive prices, as well as an interest in the field, Svetlana plans to continue her business into the future, and grow the business to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase her inventory for the upcoming autumn season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils and milk products.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un joven estudiante que vive con sus padres y su hermano, trabaja de cajero y vendedor en un Autoservice y de esa manera va pagando sus estudios de Administración de Empresas.
Tiene como objetivo culminar su carrera y conseguir un buen trabajo acorde a sus conocimientos. En el futuro quiere ser una persona floreciente en los negocios y una estabilidad económica y personal.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar una notebook para sus trabajos de la universidad y para otros gastos de estudio.
texts.en: José is a young student who lives with his parents and his brother. He works as a cashier and salesman in a self service business. That is how he pays for his education in Business Administration.  His objective is to finish his degree and get a good job in accordance with his knowledge. In the future, he wants to be a person who flourishes in business and has financial and personal stability.  He is asking for this loan to buy a Notebook computer and to pay for other education expenses.

loans.use: to buy a notebook computer and pay for other education expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in retaining and fattening 13 cattle.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Victor, and Naomi. Samaila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Samaila will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. 

With access to high quality inputs, Samaila can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” 

Samaila is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an over sewing machine, generator and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy funeral boxes and niches.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy corn and seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Sule joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Nura, Usaina, and Jamilu. Sule is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Sule will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. 

With access to high quality inputs, Sule can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked about his future plans, Sule said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family." 

Sule is not thinking about just this year, he said in 5 years, he wants to make more money for himself and family.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase high yielding cacao trees.

loans.name: Digna Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Digna es una socia que se encuentra en su segundo crédito en el grupo de crédito Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la comunidad de Paccha en Cuenca, esta comunidad se caracteriza por su gente que es muy trabajadora, en su mayor parte se dedica a la cría de animales y mucha de su gente laboran en la ciudad realizando diferentes actividades.  Le gusta su grupo por la solidaridad y amistada que existe entre todas las socias, siempre comparten experiencias de vida.
La Señora. Digan tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hermosas niñas de 9 y 3 años, su primera hija se encuentra estudiando en una escuelita del sector, su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
Doña Digna se dedica los fines de semana  a elaborar pan para la venta, en la semana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría pollos y cuyes, también tiene ganado del cual vende la leche. Parte de su tiempo se dedica a estudiar ya que esta en la universidad. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y víveres para elaborar el pan. Su meta es de llegar a graduarse y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Digna is a member of the credit group "Mujeres Floreciendo". She lives in the community of Paccha in Cuenca. The people in this community are said to be hard-working, the major part of the people work in animal husbandry and many people work in different activities in the city. 

Digna likes her group because of the solidarity and friendship among all the members. They always share their experiences.

Digna is 27 years old. She is married and the couple have two beautiful girls, who are 9 years and 3 years old. The oldest daughter attends a small school in the neighborhood and her husband works as a private employee. They live in their own house.

At the weekends, Digna bakes bread for selling, and during the week she takes care of her household and raises chickens and guinea pigs and she also has cattle and sells the milk. She spends a part of her time studying, because she goes to university.

She will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs, and supplies to bake bread. Her goal is to get her degree and become a renowned professional.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and chair.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Pabeya Group

texts.en:
The rural community of Nahuala, in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, is known for its mild climate and for being an agricultural area where corn, wheat, beans, peaches and coffee are grown. It is here that seven women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Rosas de Pabeya” meaning “The Roses of Pabeya”. They are about to begin their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. The ladies are engaged in various endeavors including textile production, animal husbandry, and commercial sales (clothing, etc.)

Pascuala is a newer member of the Trust Bank. She is 23 years of age and unmarried. She has been elected Treasurer of the group because of her ability to speak and write in Spanish. Pascuala is a very talented textile artisan and learned how to embroider when she was quite young. When she saw how her small business would benefit from an influx of capital, she joined the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank. Pascuala is requesting a loan to purchase different colors of embroidery thread, and an embroidery rack. She wants to be certain to have enough materials on hand to create her textile treasures and increase her inventory.

As most of the women of the Trust Bank are illiterate, they are appreciative of the educational component of their monthly meetings. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares information on basic life skills including the use of medicinal plants, health, nutrition, hygiene and self-esteem. The women learn how to manage their businesses with new knowledge about budgeting, indebtedness, accounting, customer service, pricing and marketing. This combination of small loans and education is what the organization calls “Microcredit Plus”. 

On behalf of all the women in the Trust Bank “Las Rosas de Pabeya”,  Pascuala thanks Kiva investors for granting them these essential loans. In her own words, "We appreciate the help of Friendship Bridge and its partners like Kiva because they trust us to wisely invest in our businesses, generate more income, and improve our lives. It means a lot to be able to take care of our families with the money we make and meet our monthly expenses.”

loans.use: To purchase different colors of embroidery thread and an embroidery rack.

loans.name: Flores De Panimache Group

texts.en:
Panimaché meaning “the place of the big tree” is a small rural community in Chichicastenango, Guatemala. The population of the area speak “kiche” which is a Mayan language and very few speak Spanish. The community is a poor one and it is very evident that living conditions need to be improved. The eight women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flores de Panimache” or “Flowers of Panimache” realize that they can empower themselves and make a difference in economic situation of their families. They have formed several small businesses. Some work in the production of handicrafts and traditional textiles while others work in animal husbandry and raise chickens, turkeys, pigs and cattle. 

The group is starting its first loan cycle and each of the young women, who average 28 years of age, is most excited. Catalina is the 19-year-old Secretary of the Trust Bank who recently married. She lives with her husband’s family as is common in Guatemalan indigenous culture, especially in rural areas. Catalina anticipates having her own family and has a vision of a healthy and educated one, living in different conditions from the ones she grew up in. Catalina sells chickens once each week in a small local market. She wants to make a little extra income and sell a few more days each week. She is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to purchase additional live chickens, fatten them up, butcher them and sell more meat. She looks forward to attracting new customers, increasing her income and saving some money to get ready to take care of her yet unborn children.

The women of the “Flores de Panimaché” Trust Bank are most excited thinking about the possibilities that will come with their first loans. They have been participating in the educational training program of Friendship Bridge at their monthly meetings. A Loan Officer facilitates this part of the meetings and the ladies enhance their leadership skills, participate in group discussions and practice teamwork techniques. They discuss topics such as women’s health, self-esteem and leadership. They learn about women’s rights and violence against women. To help them with their loans and small businesses, they learn about business management and administration, budgeting, accounting and marketing. Finally, the ladies learn about the use of medicinal plants and nutrition. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of the small loans and educational trainings “Microcredit Plus”.

It is impossible for a poor indigenous woman in Guatemala to walk into a bank and secure a loan. Kiva investors are valuable partners with Friendship Bridge to these women. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase additional live chickens, fatten them up, butcher them and sell more meat.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 29 years old, she lives with her husband and has two sons. She studied a course on beauty and personal care and decided to open her own beauty salon in her house. She has been in business for more than seven years. 

She is asking for a loan to refurbish her salon and give a better impression to her clients. She offers different types of services such as cuts, bases, waxing, nails, etc. Her biggest accomplishment has been able to stay in business and also do some traveling.

loans.use: To refurbish her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional items for her stores including pasta, rice, grains, oil, and drinks.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and has four children. He lives in the house of his mother-in-law. He has worked in commerce for more than 30 years, he started as a kid, selling wood to bakeries. He saved some money and five years later started selling chicken, a business in which he has worked for the last twenty five years. He also sells gas. 

He is asking for a loan to buy some chicken and refurbish his food stall. Miguel says that his biggest accomplishments have been providing financial stability for his family and acquiring a truck.

loans.use: to buy chicken and refurbish his food stall.

loans.name: Faasegi

texts.en: Faasegi is 34 years old and single with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for seven years. Faasegi needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. Faasegi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una estudiante de la carrera de Ciencias Contables, actualmente se encuentra en el último año de la carrera, vive con sus padres y sus tres hermanos.
Comenta que trabaja en el área de auditoria y contabilidad en un Supermercado, con el préstamo solicitado quiere pagar sus gastos de la defensa de su tesis consiguiendo así el título de Licenciada en Ciencias Contables. Más Adelante se especializará de manera a poder seguir creciendo como profesional y persona.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a student of Accounting Sciences, currently in the last year of her degree, and she lives with her parents and her three brothers.

She comments that she works in the area of auditing and accounting in a supermarket. With the requested loan she wants to pay the expenses of defending her thesis, thus achieving the title of Graduate in Accounting Sciences. Later, she will specialize in a way to continue growing as a professional and as a person.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of defending her thesis.

loans.name: Pele

texts.en:
Pele, a 55-year-old married mother of eight, has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for seven years. 

A member of SPBD since 2007, Pele needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer,  a tiller, a rake, a new wheelbarrow, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is an artisan who specializes in hand-loomed scarves. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of cotton thread. Francisco has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story: Francisco learned how to weave from his parents. "My parents started out as farmers and then learned to weave. I started to help them when I was 12 years old, and that's how I eventually learned, too. One of the most beautiful aspects about my craft is when a client asks me to create a new design. I enjoy doing the research, making the trial samples, imagining the finished product, thinking of color combinations, and carrying out the new design." "Thanks to your support, I will be able to weave more scarves and increase my sales. Sending you a big hug from Guatemala!"

Use the link below to view Francisco's hand-loomed scarves on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7929

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of cotton thread for his scarves

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 33 years old and lives in his parents' house with his wife and daughter. For the past 12 years he has produced tortillas, selling them from the house. 

Juan Carlos is asking for a loan to acquire a corn mill; this will enable him to sell nixtamal (wholesale) to other tortilla factories in his neighborhood and also reduce his costs and increase profits. His goal is to achieve financial stability and expand the business.

loans.use: to acquire a corn mill

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is an artisan who specializes in wood and leather home accessories. He would like to buy more raw materials, including leather, wood and glue.

Mohammed has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I am Mohammed. I am from the Republic of Mali, but I presently make my home in Ghana alongside my wife. Typical of many a childhood life in Mali, mine was spent as a shepherd boy. As such, I did not have the opportunity of having any formal education. However, I started learning how to make these boxes when I was 15 years old. I come from a family of artisans. My grandfather and my father were both artisans. I trained for three years under my father; he is the very person who inspired me. Many thanks to all for helping me to grow my business."

Use the link below to view Mohammed's wood and leather home accessories on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/1141

loans.use: to buy raw craft materials, including leather, wood and glue

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 29-year-old divorced woman with five children. For the past three years she has been making and selling ice-blocks in her community to earn a living. 

A member of SPBD since 2011, Rosalina needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, bags of sugar, a large cooler and Chinese candy. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, bags of sugar, a large cooler and Chinese candy

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
Justino es profesor de música, trabaja para un colegio y de forma particular con ello se mantiene y puede seguir estudiando.
Hoy está estudiando la carrera de trabajo social, a través del cual quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas en todo tipo de situaciones. Sus metas futuras son la de trabajar en lo social .De aquí a un tiempo se ve trabajando en una oficina y tener algún departamento a su cargo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar los libros que necesita para su carrera.
texts.en:
Justino is a music teacher. He works for a college and in a particular way with this he supports himself and can continue studying.

Today he is studying a degree in social work, through which he wants to be able to help other people in all types of situations. His future goals are that of working in the social field. From here after a time he sees himself working in an office and being in charge of some department. 

He asks for this loan to be able to buy the books that he needs for his degree.

loans.use: to buy books.

loans.name: Wijayana

texts.en: Wijayana is an artisan who specializes in sterling silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to purchase raw materials in bulk, including silver and semi-precious gemstones. Wijayana has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: "When I was 10 years old, my parents, who are master silversmiths, told me to learn about making jewelry. I love this job! The nicest part of my jewelry is the uniqueness of its style. That it shows an ethnic influence makes it quite different." "I would like to say thank you to everyone who has supported me through these microcredit loans. It really helps me to expand my sales, make new designs and craft more jewelry. I need the capital to buy raw materials so that I can have all of the jewelry designs in my catalog on hand and available for purchase. Thank you!" Use the link below to view Wijayana's sterling silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8459

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk, including silver and semi-precious gemstones

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica es soltera, estudia la carrera de licenciatura en administración de empresas.
Aspira terminar su carrera, poder ingresar a una entidad bancaria y poder ejercer su profesión para quienes lo necesiten, tener un mejor ingreso. Ella vive con su mama y hermano, quiere ser independiente y ayudar siempre a su madre en lo que sea necesario.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en:
Yessica is single, and is studying her undergraduate degree in Business Administration. 

She aspires to finish her degree, to be able to get work with a bank and be able to practice her profession for those who need it, and to have a better income. She lives with her mum and brother, but she wants to be independent and to always help her mother with whatever is needed.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying for her university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Made

texts.en:
Made is an artisan who specializes in silver and gemstone jewellery. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones.

Made has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is her story:

Made comes from a village long renowned as Bali's center of silver production. "My father was one of the senior silversmiths, well trained in the jewellery arts. He taught me from when I was 12 years old until I got married. Though I graduated in anthropology, I decided to set up a workshop with my husband. We are able to offer employment to other silversmiths in our village, and we specialize in traditional motifs and designs."

"To craft more jewellery, I need some additional capital to buy silver and gemstones. I am really thankful for the support. This really makes me happy and grateful as it can help to improve my business. It enhances my creativity and spirit, too. We will always work hard to create great pieces of jewellery with our hands, and our customers' satisfaction is our pride. Thank you very much for being with me, to walk in this path together."

Use the link below to view Made's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/2974

loans.use: to buy silver and gemstones for her jewellery making

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel is an artisan who specializes in bronze and copper art. He would like to purchase bronze and copper in bulk, as well as metal-working equipment for his workshop. Angel has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story: "This art means a lot in my life; it is how I support my family and it is also my passion. It is a way of capturing all my efforts and dedication toward my family. What motivates me is that I want to learn more about my ancestors and our cultural legacy. What I want to transmit is everything that ancient Peruvian cultures left for the world. I want everyone to know these great artisans and their creations." "I'd like to thank everyone who has contributed to this microcredit, as it will help me grow my business. Some of my metal-working equipment is no longer working well, so it will be very helpful to be able to replace it." Use the link below to view Angel's bronze and copper art on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7664

loans.use: to purchase bronze and copper in bulk, as well as metal-working equipment for his workshop

loans.name: Zully

texts.es:
Zully es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está en el 2° año de Técnico en Enfermería y este semestre termina su tecnicatura, después piensa seguir la licenciatura para ser una profesional completa y ser ayuda para su padre con quien vive actualmente.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gas-tos de tesis, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene y seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Zully is from the city of San Lorenzo.  She is in her second year of her nursing technician studies.  This semester she will finish her associate’s degree.  After that, she plans to continue her bachelor’s degree in order to be a complete professional and to help her father with whom she currently lives.

She is requesting this loan to be able to cover her thesis expenses.  This way she will be able to cover this expense and continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her thesis expenses.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel la carrera de Administración de Empresas, trabaja en el departamento de auditoria de un negocio. Vive con sus padres, sus tres hermanas y sus dos tíos con sus respectivas parejas.
De aquí a dos años aspira al cargo de la gerencia administrativa o comercial de alguna empresa de prestigio todo gracias a sus estudios que con mucho sacrificio ha podido finalizar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar su matriculación y sus libros de la universidad.
texts.en:
Raquel is studying Business Administration. She works in the Department of Audit of a business. She lives with her parents, her three sisters, and her two uncles with their respective partners. 

Thanks to her studies that she has been able to finish with much sacrifice, over the next two years she will seek a position of Administrative or Commercial Manager with a prestigious company.

She requests this loan to be able to invest it in paying for her college tuition and her college books.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition and books.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is is known in the Oroquieta area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails and sticks for her house

loans.name: Kahinur

texts.en:
Kahinur is 35 years old.  She lives in a small village, Kathapara, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She never went to school, as her parents did not have enough financial resources for school costs. She is married to Alauddin, who is a 49-year-old farmer. She is a mother of three children (two sons and one daughter), all of whom are attending school and are in grades 6, 4 and 3.

With the help of Kahinur, her husband earns a living at agricultural work, especially sowing basic grain paddy as much for consumption in the home as well as for sale. But, the present income from this agribusiness is not sufficient to cover all the necessary needs for the family. They need to extend their cultivation in order to earn better for the family, for which financial help is required.

Kahinur heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them to buy good-quality seeds and manure to enrich the area where they are growing paddy, and thus get a good harvest so that their quality of life is improved.

Kahinur hopes for a good harvest of her crop. She also wants to construct a concrete-made house for them so that their children get a good, quality life.

Until now, her farming has always gone well, and she is sure she can continue working and increasing her productivity with much effort and with the valued help of her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to buy paddy seeds and fertilizers for growing paddy.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia Gladys se sigue dedicando al negocio de panaderia,la socia prepara tortas,pasteles y panes,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño dela socia es ampliar el negocio de panaderia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos como mantequilla,harina y huevos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Gladis, continues working in her bakery business. She prepares cakes, desserts, and breads. She has already had this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her bakery business.

Gladis is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like butter, flour, and eggs

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a businesswoman from Oroquieta in the Philippines. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that is sufficient to support her family. Flora is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans previously. She maintains her membership in good standing without any records of default. Now, she as happlied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.
