Flora continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Contabilidad. Ella actualmente vive con sus padres y hermanas. Trabaja actualmente en una estación de servicios. Su objetivo como persona es llegar a culminar la carrera, ya que su meta es llegar a ser una Licenciada y llegar a tener su propio negocio de Estudios jurídicos Contables.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir estudiando
texts.en:
Natalia is in the second year of an Accounting degree program. She currently lives with her parents and siblings and works in a gas station. Her personal objective is to finish her degree, since her goal is to become a college graduate and have her own legal and accounting firm.

She is requesting this loan to make tuition payments so that she can continue her education.

loans.use: to make payments to her university

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de femmes qui habitent le même village; elles ont comme principale activité le commerce et l'embouche. Astou l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe, mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont 04 filles. Elle est debout à gauche sur la photo et a levé la main droite. Elle mène une activité d’embouché. Elle capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 5 ans. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 02 moutons.Elle pratique cette activité parce que les moutons sont très rare dans le village. Les bénéfices lui permet de prépare la fête de tabaski.
texts.en: This group is composed of women who live in the same village. Their main work involves commerce and livestock farming. Astou, the featured borrower, is the group’s official. She is a married mother of five children, including four girls. She is standing at the left in the photo with her right hand raised. She runs a business fattening livestock. She capitalizes on over five years of good experience. With her loan, she intends to purchase two head of sheep. She works in this business because sheep are rare in the village. The profits enables her to prepare the Tabaski feast.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Amanecer De Limonpata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMANECER DE LIMONTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quillabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina ella es conviviente y tiene 43 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, plátanos y cacao, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de café, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the communal bank “AMANECER DE LIMONTA”. This bank is located in the district of Quillabamba, belonging to the province of La Convencion and department of Cusco. The member is Agripina. She is 43 years old and has a domestic partner and 3 children. The member works in the business of agriculture. The member has a plot where she grows coffee, bananas and cacao. She works from 8:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m. The member has already worked 5 years in this business and she is doing very well. Her dream is to grow her business of agriculture. The member is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. The other members work selling coffee, in the business of agriculture, grocery store, and restaurants. The member is grateful through this way to those who belong to this dream, and she promises to meet her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Penda's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe a été crée le 06 Mars 2008 et est constitué de femmes qui habitent le même quartier; elles ont comme principale activité le commerce. Awa l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont 02 filles. Elle est debout à gauche sur la photo a levé sa main gauche couverte d'une écharpe blanc. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits alimentaire et capitalise une bonne expérience. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 10Kg de sucre, 15Kg de lait, des condiment ( 1 Kg de piment, 1 Kg de poivre,2 Kg de ail, 1 paquet de biscuits) L’activité marche bien car j'ai une clientèle fidèle. Avec ses bénéfices elle cotise pour ses tontines, elle épargne dans le BV.
texts.en:
This group was created on March 6, 2008. It is composed of women from the same district whose main work involves commerce. Awa, the featured borrower, is the group’s official. She is 48 years old and a married mother of four children, including two girls. She is standing at the left in the photo with her left hand raise, and she is wearing a white shawl. She runs a small-scale businesses selling grocery items and capitalizes on good experience. 

With her loan, she intends to purchase 10 kg of sugar, 15 kg of milk, and some condiments (1 kg of chili peppers, 1 kg of black pepper, 2 kg of garlic, a packet of cookies). Her business is going well, since she has a loyal customer base. With her profits, she pays her tontine dues. She saves money at the BV [ ’banc villageois’].

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio Juan se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio tiene un taxi donde hace servicio a diferentes personas y diferentes lugares,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de servicio de taxi.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan continues to be dedicated to his transportation business.  He has a taxi business, providing service to various people and places.  He's been in this business for several years and it goes very well. 

His dream is to increase his taxi business.  He asks for a loan to buy tires for his car.  

He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments required.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en: From Oroquieta City, Consolacion earns a living through her clothing sales. She seeks to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. Now, she has applied for a loan to purchase roofing materials. Consolacion feels the need to improve her family's living conditions with replacement of good roofing.

loans.use: to purchase roofing materials

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita operates a motor transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales everyday. For her to continue her business, she has availed a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams to own another motor unit and to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for necklaces, earrings, anklets and waist beads

loans.name: Ya Alimamy

texts.en: This is 52-year-old Ya Alimamy. She is married and has 4 children aged 30, 28, 26 and 23 years old. She has 2 additional dependents, who are her sales assistants.  In 2003, Ya Alimamy established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband to take care of their home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,600,000 SLL. Ya Alimamy requires a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal for resale. In the future, Ya Alimamy plans to purchase two TVC motorbikes for commercial use and to get more income. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and palm oil

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Adama. She is married to a pharmacist and has two children, aged 9 and 5 years old. She has no additional dependents. In 1982, Adama established her used bags and purse business. She began her business because she has never been to school. Since she was a small girl, her parents taught her business. Up to this point, her entire life has been business. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,716,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Adama requires a loan in order to buy two bails of used bags as well as ladies purses and bags. In the future, Adama plans to expand her business, and also to give a quality education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy two bails of used bags at SLL1,800,000 each.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel learned about the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and never doubted to sign up fo his membership. He has tried his luck on doing a business focusing on farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital for his business. Samuel has requested another loan amount to purchase cement, plywood and to pay labor costs for house renovation. This will help him to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, plywood and to pay labor costs for house renovation

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Klein

texts.en: Klein runs a transportation service while working in a private institution to earn a living. He used his previous loan for licenses and repairs. With his income, his previous loan was successfully repaid. Recently, Klein has taken a new loan to finance house improvements. He hopes that in the future, he can provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to finance house improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to raise and fatten calves

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Santigie. He is married and has two children whom are aged ten and six. In 1995, Santigie established his fuel business. He began his business because he was not educated. Working 7 days a week and 24 hours a day, he earns about Le 550,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Santigie requires this loan in order to purchase additional gallons of fuel for resale. In the future, he plans to become a supplier of fuel to other stations. He is very hardworking and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of fuel for resale.

loans.name: Aida Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Aída forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Floreciendo desde hace 8 años, vive por la comunidad de Paccha en Cuenca, esta comunidad se caracteriza por su gente que es muy trabajadora, en su mayor parte se dedica a la cría de animales y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad realizando diferentes actividades. Este grupo de crédito le gusta porque los créditos le han permitido sacar adelante  su hogar y crecer en su negocio.
La Señora Aída tiene 57 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes, su esposo labora en un taller de ebanistería, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Aida se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa, a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y también a la cría de cerdos, pollos y cuyes. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para animales. Su meta es de continuar creciendo poco a poco en el negocio de los animales.
texts.en:
Aída has been a part of the community bank "Mujeres Floreciendo" for 8 years. She lives in the community of Paccha in Cuenca. This community is characterized by its hardworking residents who generally raise livestock or hold a variety of jobs in the city.  She likes this community bank because the loans have allowed her family to get ahead and her business to grow. 


Aída is 57 years old. She is married and her marriage has produced 5 adult children who are married and living independently. Her husband works in a carpentry workshop. They own their home.  Aida is a housewife who farms for her family's sustenance and also raises pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. The money from the loan is going to be invested in the purchase of chickens and food for the animals. Her goal in to continue expanding her animal business little-by-little.

loans.use: To buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a 50-year-old mother who is gifted with six children. She owns and manages a retail store within the local community, while her husband engages in raising hogs. Despite the hardship of living, they have the determination to uplift their status of living and educate all their children. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Yolanda and her husband cannot afford to finance all the tuition and miscellaneous fees of her son. For this reason, Yolanda wants to ask a loan of PHP 20,000 to fully pay the tuition fees for her son who is taking an engineering course in one of the private schools in Nueva Vizcaya. She is hoping for this loan request to pay for the tuition fees of her son.  Through this financial assistance, Yolanda hopes that her son will earn a degree and become a professional someday.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition and miscellaneous fees for her son.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful to sufficiently provide for her family.  She has a business producing school uniforms and repairing clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and to be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is 42 years old and married and has six children attending school. She owns and manages a small retail store and eatery within the local community. Two of her children are now in tertiary education. Due to the high cost of school fees, Carol wants to take out an educational loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for the tuition fees and school uniform of her son, who is studying for a bachelor of science in accountancy. She is hoping that she will get her loan request in order to finance the education of her son.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees and school uniform of her son

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda has been running her general store for five years. She is 59 years old and happily married to a farmer. Erlinda wants to increase the grocery items she offers within her village, but her capital is not enough. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will use this loan to purchase grocery items such as assorted biscuits, noodles, eggs and ingredients to sell. She hopes that through this loan, she can further generate greater income, which will enable her to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as assorted biscuits, noodles, eggs and ingredients to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional assorted dishes, cool-man plates, and baskets.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia runs a transport business with what is locally known as a trisikad, a tricycle, usually propelled by pedalling, used for transporting passengers. The business has supported her family for all their needs. Recently, she took out a loan to purchase another trisikad. Delia hopes to help others by providing jobs on her trisikad business.

loans.use: to purchase a trisikad

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 57 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed. She has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from fish vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy bags of rice and beans, condiments, and mats.

loans.name: Zarah Jane

texts.en:
Zarah Jane is 36 years old, and married with four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Zarah Jane has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Zarah Jane has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Zarah Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 65 years old, with four children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc. She has been in this business for five years. 

Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian works hard to support her family. Lilian is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lilian has been in this business for five years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva is 42 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Nieva works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Nieva has been in this business for 7 years.

Nieva requested a 24,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. In the future, Nieva would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn works hard for her family. She is operates a sari-sari store in Ozamiz. 

With good fortune, Emelyn has sufficiently provided for the education of her two children. Recently, she applied for an amount to restock her store with basic commodities. Emelyn hopes to sustain her business and would gladly see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela  operates a beauty parlor in the community of Clarin Misamis to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years and she earns a good income from this. She supported her needs, and her previous loans were successfully repaid. To improve the services, she took a new loan recently to purchase hair treatments used for the spa and relaxing.
 
She plans to improve and expand her business to gain more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hair treatments used for the spa and relaxing.

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en: Cerelyn runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community to make a living.  Cerelyn has been in her business for four years earning well to sustain their daily needs. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She used these loans to buy stock for her store. To offer more goods, she took a new loan recently, to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan, to save as a reserve for future emergencies

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella is 46 years old and widowed with one child. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Bella is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for 18 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 35 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Elna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Savat

texts.en: Savat is 36 years old, and a widow with two children. Both of her children are students. They live in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia.  She is a chef at Pernhealeu District Hall. She can earn approximately USD 4 per day. Now, Savat would like to apply for a loan of USD 700 to buy construction materials to build a new bathroom. This loan will help her live in better conditions. In the future, she is going to support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to build a new bathroom.

loans.name: La Esquina  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Esquina está formado por 10 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por la Parroquia de Sinincay, esta parroquia se encuentra ubicada al noreste del cantón Cuenca, sus artesanos se especializan en la producción marmolera, la fabricación de tejas, ladrillos, y algunas mujeres se dedican a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla. La iglesia parroquial tradicional por su belleza arquitectónica, la colonial imagen de la virgen de la Visitación que reposa en ella es el atractivo más importante que ofrece la parroquia, muy visitado por los turistas.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Rosario, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, dos de ellos están casados y viven independientes, uno estudia en la universidad y también trabaja, dos están en un colegio de la ciudad y tres hijos trabajan ayudan económicamente, su esposo labora en la arte de la albañilería, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Rosario se dedica a las tareas del campo, cría cuyes, pollos y ganado del cual vende la leche, también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y su cosecha la vende en su comunidad o en la ciudad. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de una vaca lechera. Su meta es de crecer en la crianza de animales.
Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The loan group La Esquina (The Street Corner) is composed of 10 female and 1 male members who live in Sinincay Parish. This parish is located northeast of Cuenca canton. Its artisans specialize in producing marble, cloth, and bricks, while some women weave straw hats. The traditional parochial church is known for its architectural beauty. The colonial image of the Virgin of the Visitation that resides therein is the most important and much visited tourist attraction the parish offers.      

One of the group's members is Mrs. Rosario, who is 58 years old, and married. The fruit of this union has been 8 children, two of whom are married and living independently, while one studies in the university and also works; two are in a city school, and three others work, providing economic aid. Her husband pursues the craft of masonry. The house they live in is their own.

Mrs. Rosario also works in the countryside, raising guinea pigs, chickens and cattle whose milk they sell. Also, she labors in agriculture, sowing vegetables, and she sells her harvest in the community or in the city. The money from the loan will be used to purchase a milk cow. Her goal is to expand her animal raising.

The two women in the small photos are two members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: buy a milk cow.Comprar una vaca lechera.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating vegetables for sale to earn a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for their farm and was able to put up a new business raising pigs for sale.  She joined GDMPC and took a new loan recently to buy fertilizer to produce more harvest in return.  Her desire is to improve the farm in order to have a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like canned goods, meat, fish, etc. She has been in this business for five years now.

Ruby would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like canned goods, meat, fish, etc

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 44 years old.  She is married and has five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more baskets of fish to sell for her fish vending business.  Merly has been in this business for eight years. Merly earns additional income from food vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish to sell

loans.name: Gretta

texts.en: Gretta is 61 years old and widowed with two children, one of whom in school. Gretta works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Gretta has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emmely

texts.en:
Emmely is 41 years old.  She is married and has three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Emmely is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Emmely has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: As a married parent of one child, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Lorna is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her business. Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun lives in a village across the Mekong River, 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Aun and her husband are rice farmers. Her husband is also a fisherman. They have two sons and six daughters; three are married and living separately; two are working in a garment factory; two are working in construction, and one is attending school.  

Aun does not have a proper place to cook, so she is requesting a loan to build a kitchen; she will also use a portion of the loan to finish her restroom.

loans.use: To build a kitchen and finish her restroom.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han (in the photo) lives in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has six children, two sons and four daughters. Four of her children are married, one is a garment factory worker and another one works for a hotel. 

Han and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, her husband is also a construction worker when he is not at the farm. He always commutes to work by bicycling, and he wants to buy a motorbike. Hence, Han decided to apply for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband for commuting to work.

loans.name: Hol

texts.en: Hol is 32 years old, a rice seller and a married woman with two children who are students. Her husband is a construction worker. They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Both of them can earn $12 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $500 to buy construction materials to renovate her stall. This loan will help her make her stall bigger for more buyers to come. In the future, she wants to open a restaurant, renovate her house and support her children to finish university.

loans.use: To renovate her stall

loans.name: Simplicio

texts.en: To make a living, Simplicio works on his corn farm. He has been in the farm business for many years, and he earns well from this to provide for the needs of his family. His previous loan, which he used in farming, was successfully repaid. He was able to sustain the farm and make better income in return. Recently, he took out a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. Simplicio is determined to provide the family with a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando grows and harvests rice as his family's main source of income to make a living. While awaiting the harvest, he also earns income from his motor transport services. For many years, he was able to sustain both the farm and his services.  His previous loan was used for buying tires and he has successfully repaid it. To help improve the business, he took a new loan to repair the vehicle, and a portion will be used for farm fertilization.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated for house renovations.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle and a portion will be used for farm fertilization

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amy works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Amy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business business.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 36 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Jasmin has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from directly selling Avon products. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 28 years old and and has one child. She earns a living by farming flowering plants in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase flower pots, fertilizers, varieties of flowers, etc.  Alma has been farming flowering plants for nine years and also earns additional income from selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase flower pots, fertilizers, varieties of flowers, etc.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en: Trinh would like to take another loan to repair her food-display case and purchase a variety of breads to better satisfy her customers. Trinh's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair food-display case and purchase variety of breads to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang lives in a village along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives in a separate home, and another one is a waitress.  

Neang is a weaver (shown in photo).  She wants to put an addition onto the house, so it would be better for her family to live in. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to put an addition onto the house where she lives.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy (in photo) is 27 years old and lives in a village across the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2007 and has two daughters. One of her daughters attends school and another one is still young. 

Chanthy is a weaver. While her husband constructs wooden houses, he is also a fisherman when he's free. He wants to replace his boat because the old one is breaking down. Hence, Chanthy decided to apply for a loan in order to make purchase.

loans.use: to assist her husband’s fishing business by buying a new boat.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is requesting a new loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of beverages to stock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase her sales, and it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity and variety of beverages to stock her general store

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a new refrigerator to store beverages for selling to her customers. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, will increase sales, and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator to store beverages for selling to her customers

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi would like to take a further loan to buy ingredients and plates for her food stall and to improve her means of transportation by providing funds to enable her to trade her old motorbike for a newer one. Chi's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and plates for her food stall and motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Vang's Group

texts.en:
Vang, 55, is widowed and has five children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Vang has been selling clothes for two years. She is Group leader of a 6 member loan group, that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is the first one from the left wearing a violet shirt. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.
She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a quantity and variety of clothes to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes to sell from her store

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 33-year-old single woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For 12 years, she has run a business selling clothing.

Hanh would like a loan to purchase a quantity of clothing to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and also attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a quantity of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 22 años y cursa el tercer año de la carrera de ingeniería comercial y le falta 2 años para terminar y 1 año más para su tesis. Tiene 1 hermana que trabaja y estudia como ella, su papa es albañil y su mama tiene un kiosko y aparte lava ropas de los vecinos.
Liz tiene como mayor aspiración terminar la facultad para poder tener mayor ingreso y así poder ayudarle a sus padres en los gastos de la casa.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar así cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en:
Liz is 22 years old. She is in her third year of studies for a Bachelor's degree in Commercial Engineering. She is two years away from finishing, plus one more year for her thesis.

She has one sister who works and studies, as she does. Her father is a construction worker. Her mother has a kiosk, and in addition, she does laundry for the neighbors.

Liz wishes to finish school to be able to have better income, thus being able to help her parents with household expenses.

She requests this loan to be able to pay her university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en:
Luyen, 33, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Luyen started her business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. Her husband is working as a driver for hire. 

Luyen is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall.

loans.name: Armelito

texts.en: Armelito is a man who stands out by searching for any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow him to feed his family. Ten years ago he began making a living with his services, while his wife earns from her salary as a teacher.  Based on this success, Armelito is asking for a loan to finance his vehicle’s repair and maintenance, which will allow him to continue to forge his dream of growing as an entrepreneur.  He is always looking for the well being of his family and the grace of God.

loans.use: to finance his vehicle's repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow and many types of seeds

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio está cursando el último año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Administración de Empresas, vive con sus padres.
Los gastos de sus estudios los cubre gracias al trabajo que tiene, su meta es llegar a recibirse y de ahí emprender nuevos desafíos para el futuro.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de titulación de su universidad, y de esa forma poder estar más cerca del título tan anhelado.
texts.en:
Rocio, who lives with her parents, is completing her last year of studies for a Business Administration degree. She is able to cover the cost of her studies thanks to the work that she has, her aim is to graduate and from there on undertake new challenges in the future.

Rocio is seeking this loan to cover her university's degree fees and in this manner get that much closer to obtaining the much-longed-for degree.

loans.use: to pay degree fees.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda es una estudiante sacrificada, ya que tiene dos hijas, su deseo es progresar en la vida para así poder ayudar a sus hijas en el futuro.
Con la ayuda de su marido está tratando de terminar su carrera, ya que es muy difícil cuando uno ya tiene hijos. Está estudiando para ser maestra de escolar básica y comenta que su aspiración es poder obtener su título y ejercer su profesión como docente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de estudio, y así seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Nilda is a self-sacrificing student who already has two girls. Her dream is to get ahead in life in order to help her children in the future. With the help of her husband, she is working hard to finish her degree as it is very difficult to do so when you already have children. Nilda is studying to become an elementary school teacher and tells how she aspires to obtain her degree and work in the profession as a teacher.

Nilda is seeking this loan to pay for the schooling fees and therein continue fighting to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay education fees.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto has operated his rice field for more than 30 years. He is happily married and blessed with two children. His wife is a hog raiser within their locality.The couple both work hard in order to keep their rice farm land productive.

Ernesto would like to seek additional capital amounting to PHP 25,000 to be used in purchasing  farm supplies such as fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides. He believes that through supplying his rice farm land with complete farm supplies, he could be able to obtain a plentiful harvest this next crop season. He hopes and prays that his requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides to use for farming

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She used her previous loan for the farm and it gave a better return. Her business grew and the farm improved and she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. Now she takes a new loan to finance fertilization and weeding maintenance costs. Positively, she hopes to be able to have a better living with her family in the future.

loans.use: to finance fertilization and weeding maintenance costs.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Alex, who is in his late 20’s, is married with one small child.  He has been running a butcher shop business since 2013. He works from 2 A.M. until 9 P.M. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Alex's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy meat for his butcher shop and has paid back his loan successfully. He will use this loan to open another butcher shop.  He dreams of owning a wholesale food shop.

Alex will share this loan with his loan group "BARAKA" with three members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another butcher shop.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and widowed with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15.000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Elena has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Chi is requesting a new loan to buy hairdressing accessories to serve her customers. Chi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing accessories.

loans.name: Daihana

texts.es:
Daihana vine del interior para estudiar, comenta que paso por muchas necesidades para lograr sus objetivos, además tuvo que buscar trabajo para costear sus estudios.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de derecho y comenta que su meta es ser una buena profesional para servir a la sociedad, aspira algún día a la Defensoría Pública.
Pide este préstamo para cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder seguir con su sueño como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Daihana came from the center of the country to study, and she tells of how she had to forego many needs to achieve her objectives. In addition, she had to find a job in order to finance her studies. 

Diahana is studying law and she states that her aim is to be an upstanding professional to serve society, one day she hopes to work for the Public Defender's Office. She is seeking this loan to cover her schooling fees and in this way continue to reach for her dream as she has been doing up until now.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Gadir

texts.en: Gadir is 39 years old, married and has two children. His elder child is 11 years old and goes to the fifth class of school. His other child also is school-age and she goes to the third class. Gadir is an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from Djabrayil city and now is living in Absheron region with his lovely family. Gadir is a taxi driver. He has been at that business for six years. Today Gadir has applied for a loan of 700 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to change two tires on car. He says he is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for two tires for his car

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus está cursando el 4to año de la carrera administración de empresa, comenta que su meta es recibirse y ser un profesional competente.
Sus aspiraciones serian de ser un profesional destacado. Le inspiran su padre y madre porque son gente humilde pero nunca le hicieron faltar nada a ella y a sus hermanos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y así seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jesus is in his fourth year of studies in business administration and he says that his goal is to graduate and become a competent professional. His dreams consist in being an outstanding professional. His father and mother inspire him as although they are humble people, Jesus and his siblings never went wanting. 

Jesus is seeking this loan to invest in paying his university fees and continue with his studies as he has been doing up until now.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Mkombozi Mwenge Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is her mid-60s and is a widowed woman. She has five children: three sons and two daughters. Only one of them lives at home and is at school; the rest have finished schooling. For a period of 20 years now, Sharifa has made her living by running a genge [food stall] selling fruits and vegetables. She gets up early in the morning (8 am) to start her business. Sometimes she needs to start in the market center to buy new fruits and vegetables. Her business is not located far from her home, so it ends at night (8 pm). She is able to make a very good profit every day. 

Sharifa is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania, which is her eleventh loan from Tujijenge. She will use this loan to pay for new business stock. She used her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to restock her business with fruits and vegetables. Sharifa used her business profit to build a house, buy home furniture, and cover school fees and home expenses. She is so thankful for Kiva's support since now she has a house for her family. She dreams of expanding her business up to a genge duka [small neighborhood store]. 

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group, "Mkombozi Mwenge", which consists of eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for new stock for her genge selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than seven years. She earns better income from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm improvements. She took a new loan recently to cover farm maintenance costs.

She will use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover farm maintenance costs

loans.name: Nu

texts.en: Nu would like to take another loan to buy more food ingredients, plates and to repair furniture for her stall to provide a better quality service for her customers. Nu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients and plates, and to repair furniture for her stall.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a raising pig business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for shoes and men's wear

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es estudiante de la Carrera Contaduría Pública se dedico solo al estudio, vive con sus padres y gracias a ellos puede entrar a la facultad.
Cuando termine sus estudios y sea una profesional quiere dedicarse a su profesión, lo que más desea es ayudar a sus padres cuando trabaje para poder pagarles los que ellos han hecho por ella.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de estudios, como libros, materiales y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Claudia is a Public Accounting student, she is fully dedicated her studies and lives with her parents; it is thanks to them that she was able to go to university. When she completes her studies and is a professional, she wants to dedicate herself to her profession. What she wants most is to help her parents when she has a job to be able to pay them back for what they have done for her. 

Claudia is seeking this loan to cover her educational expenses such as books, materials and more. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given to study.

loans.use: to pay for the educational expenses such as books, materials and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her thesis.

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is studying in the university in Mindanao to gain a better education. With her father, she had to travel her life and wants to support her family in the future. Her previous loan from GDMPC was used to finance her studies. She is thankful for the privilege provided to students who want to pursue their studies despite financial instability.
 
She took a new loan recently to pay for school uniforms and other needs. She hopes to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay for school uniforms and other needs

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 25-year-old single man who has been running his mobile selling shop for the last two years. He is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing his living and increasing his income.

He is well known in his region for the good quality products he sells. Abbass is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with special-released mobile phones, accessories and prepaid cards.

He hopes that in the future, he can expand his business and diversify his products. He hopes to move to a wider shop in an attractive location.

loans.use: To buy more special-released mobile phones, accessories and prepaid cards

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres Triunfadoras, están en el 7mo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, ellas están iniciando con muchas expectativas ya que están luchando para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo y unión. Todas están poniendo su mayor entusiasmo para poder crecer.
Ramona es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella vende comidas que ella misma hace, y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella pide este préstamo ya que necesita poder surtirse con insumos varios para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo y demás.
Ramona se define como una persona muy luchadora que está trabajando por salir adelante para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group is called the Mujeres Triunfadoras, they are in their 7th loan cycle of the enterprising women program and they are starting with high expectations as they are fighting to be able to help their families through their work and solidarity. They are all putting in a huge amount of enthusiasm to grow. 

Ramona is one of the members of the group: she sells food that she makes herself and then sells in the street. She is seeking this loan as she needs to have a stock of a variety of supplies to continue making her dishes such as vegetables, seasoning, meat, chicken and so on. Ramona describes herself as a fighter who is working to get ahead in life to help her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, seasoning, meat, chicken and more.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is a 59-year-old married woman with a son and three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nhung has been running a food stall for nearly nine years. She sells Vietnamese noodles to people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy new furniture and dishes to better serve her customers.

She hopes that through the loan, she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and dishes to better serve her customers.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai is a 38-year-old married man with two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Tai earns money from the business of repairing motorcycles and bicycles and selling parts. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. Now, Tai would like to take a loan to invest in his business. He plans to use this loan to buy motorcycle parts to stock his store and to serve more customers. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts to stock his store and to serve more customers.

loans.name: Rose Jgl Group

texts.en:
Salim, a middle-aged woman from Reangzeang village in the Churachandpur District, Manipur is a featured member of the group with her hand raised. She runs a grocery shop for generating income to sustain her family. She works very hard to support her family and has been the only source of income in the family. Their monthly family income is approximately 10,000 INR and she has been struggling hard to work out different financial issues. She is in need of money to upgrade her grocery store so that she earns more profit and improves her family's financial condition. She had taken two cycles of loans and this will be the third cycle. She had a good record of repaying her loans.

The group Rose was formed by women with a common interest to get a loan that will be helpful in their business endeavor. Some of the group members are vegetable vendors and weavers. The vegetable vendors will buy more varieties of vegetable items to sell from the loan and the weavers will purchase yarn from the loan for better products. The loan will be used for expanding and improving their business undertakings.

loans.use: To purchase inventory to sell

loans.name: Aleli Group

texts.es:
El comité Aleli nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Mirna es una de las integrantes y también la presidenta del grupo, tiene 31 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación. Ella se dedica a las ventas varias de todo tipo de productos, y por medio de este trabajo es que ayuda a su familia.
Mirna pide este préstamo para poder comprar azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, harina, compra de ropas para damas y caballeros, y otros, de manera a seguir con las ventas varias que hace, y con lo cual lucha por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Aleli communal bank was born from the management and support of a group of women who were working in this area.This communal bank is from the city of San Lorenzo, and the members of the communal bank decided that the growth of each of member, on a personal and a work front, was their main objective.

Mirna is one of the members and is also the president of the group. She is 31 years old and is a very enterprising group, capable of leading a large group such as this one; during all of the loan cycles she has demonstrated a keen desire for improvement. She makes her living selling all kinds of products, it is through this means that she helps her family. 

Mirna is seeking this loan to buy sugar, pasta, meat, milk, bread, rice, drinks, oil, flour and buy men and women's clothing among other items. This is in order to continue with the various sales that she performs and with which she works to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pasta, meat, milk, bread, rice, drinks, oil, flour, men and women's clothing and other items for sale.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 52-year-old married, hardworking woman who supports a family of eight children.  Her husband adds additional income to their family.  Peninah operates a cereals business stall that has been in operation for 10 years, earning her an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Peninah is now servicing her third loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy an additional and different variety of cereals to boost her business.

Peninah plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and be able to further their education to higher levels and hopes to build a permanent cereals stall in the near future.

loans.use: To buy additional cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Santo Rey Group

texts.es:
Santo Rey es un grupo muy unido, que gracias al trabajo de todas ya están en su 6to. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 de las integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben esforzarse un poco más en post de mejorar.
La Sra. Veronica es una de las integrantes ella se dedica a la costura, y es por medio de este trabajo que día a día lucha por mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia. Gracias a que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos, ha ido formándose de una muy buena clientela que siempre le trae trabajos para que ella los pueda hacer.
Veronica ve la necesidad de este préstamo, ya que con el podrá comprar mayor cantidad de telas, hilos, gomas y otros insumos que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con su trabajo, como así también luchando por mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santo Rey is a very united group which is already in its sixth cycle of the women's communal bank program thanks to everyone's work. All of the members work and help each other to get ahead. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, in which six of the members are living below the poverty line, i.e. they need to try a little harder to improve. 

Veronica is one of the members who makes her living in dressmaking, and it is through this work that she works hard every day to improve the living conditions for herself and that of her family. Thanks to the fact that she always produces good items, she has attracted a lot of customers who always bring her work for her to do.

Veronica finds herself in need of this loan as she will be able to buy a larger amount of cloth, thread, elastics and other supplies which will be of great use in order to continue with her work, as well improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, elastics and other supplies.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Nuevo Horizonte, ya que estas mujeres están en busca de un nuevo horizonte, no solo para ellas sino también para sus familias e hijos. Gracias al trabajo que todas vienen haciendo, ya están en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres.
Una persona que se destaca es Paulina, ella se dedica a las ventas ya que es comerciante, tiene una despensa que con mucho sacrificio ha podido montar, y que hoy día es de gran ayuda a su familia. Tiene ya una buena clientela formada, y comenta que poco a poco y con sacrificio quiere ir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como verduras, frutas, condimentos, hortalizas y otros productos, ya que así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad que siempre piden.
texts.en:
This group is called New Horizon, as these women are seeking new horizons not just for themselves but for their families and their children. Their efforts are paying off, as the group is now now in its seventh loan cycle as part of the Women's Committee Program. 

One of the notable New Horizon members is Paulina, who made great sacrifices to open a small store that she runs, and that is a great help to her family. Paulina has a strong customer base, and says she plans to keep making the sacrifices necessary to grow her business gradually.  

Paulina is applying for this loan so that she can buy various goods to sell in her store, such as greens and other vegetables, fruits, condiments, and other goods. Expanding her inventory will allow Paulina to offer her customers a greater variety of things that they're always asking for.

loans.use: to purchase greens and other vegetables, fruits, condiments, and other goods.

loans.name: Peace Jlg Group

texts.en:
Gailu, a middle-aged woman and the featured member of the group with her hand raised, is from Reangzeang village in the Churachandpur District of Manipur. Her family includes her husband and two school-going children. She runs a variety shop in the market, which is rented. Her husband is an auto rickshaw driver by profession and earns money by taking passengers. The family faces financial problems every now and then. Their present family income is not sufficient for their expenditures anymore, which is the reason for upgrading their business. For expansion of her business, she is in need of money urgently and her meager savings is not sufficient. 

The featured member has taken loans for two cycles now and this will be her third loan. The loan will help her to buy inventory for her variety shop and expand her business. The profit she makes will improve her financial condition.

The group Peace was formed by women with a common interest in getting a loan so that it will be helpful in their business endeavors. The loan will be used for expanding and improving their business undertakings.

loans.use: To buy inventory to sell

loans.name: Hoert's Group

texts.en:
Hoert, 42, is from a rural village located in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is married with six children. She and her husband earn a living by growing cassava, and have been in this business for two years. To better feed her family, she also sells fruits. The current business earns her family about 60,000 KHR per day.

This is Hoert’s microloan group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is a first-time borrower. As the leader, she is leading her group of two others to apply for a loan. Hoert will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and also  use a portion of it for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Hace 10 ciclos que este grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas viene trabajando de manera unidas, todas son mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan por sus familias y demás seres queridos.
Una persona destacada es la Sra. Florencia, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras frescas, que de manera ambulante sale a vender. Ella es una mujer que con sacrificio y esfuerzo ayuda a su familia y seres queridos, y está saliendo adelante. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas, de manera a poder tener siempre productos frescos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, called Mujeres Unidas [United Women], has been working in a united manner for ten cycles and all of the members are heads of the household who are fighting for their families and their other loved ones. 

A notable person is Florencia who makes her living selling fresh fruit and vegetables, selling in the street. She is a woman who helps support her family and her loved ones, through sacrifice and hard work, and is getting ahead in life. Florencia is seeking this loan to buy fresh fruit and vegetables in order to always offer her customers fresh products.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Fausto Ulpiano

texts.es: Fausto es un joven trabajador, el vive con sus padres pero debido a que él se dedica a trabajar en construcción pasa mucho tiempo  lejos de sus padres y prácticamente vive en cada lugar donde le contratan que trabaje en construcción, Fausto va a invertir el crédito en la compra abono, semilla de papas y en la mano de obra para preparar el terreno y sembrar su producto, Fausto aspira que le vaya bien en este cultivo para ya dedicarse en su totalidad a la agricultura para ya no pasar tanto tiempo lejos de su familia.
texts.en: Fausto is a hard working young man who lives with his parents but, seeing as he works in the construction industry, he spends a lot of time far from his parents and practically lives in each of the places where he is sent to work as a builder. Fausto will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer, potato seeds and labor to prepare the land and sow his product. Fausto hopes that this will go well so that he can fully dedicate himself to farming and no longer spend so much time away from his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Huu's Group

texts.en:
Huu is a 44-year-old single man who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He has run a community based flower business for 10 years. Huu is the group leader of a 7 member loan group.  The members live in Ho Chi Minh City. He is pictured in the center wearing a black T-shirt. Each of the other group members  request loans to fund income-generating activities.

Huu would like a loan to purchase a large quantity and variety of flowers at lower prices from a wholesale flower market and sell them in his store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers. 

He also hopes that he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a quantity and variety of flowers at a special wholesale price.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father of one son and three daughters. He has a disability and can not walk. 

Mohammad is employed in the public sector and earns a low income. He also has a small business to make cleaning materials for homes. He sells his products to the local traders.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more bottles and raw materials for his business.  Mohammad will be able to increase his productivity and also his sales.

loans.use: to buy bottles and raw materials for his business.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité San Juan se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona eminentemente rural, donde todas o en su mayoría se dedican a actividades rurales como la cría, venta o faena de animales de corral.
Herminia es una de ellas, es una mujer muy sacrificada, que integra este grupo, y tiene las esperanzas de poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia por medio del programa de comités. Ella se dedica a la cría, venta y faena de animales que ella cría, como gallinas, cerdos y demás. Comenta que es un trabajo sacrificado que por su familia lo hace.
Hoy pide este préstamo, para que pueda poder comprar balanceados en cantidad para sus animales, de manera a poder seguir con la cría de los mismos.
texts.en:
The San Juan communal bank was formed by the coming together of several neighbours of Santaní city, which is primarily a rural area. All of the women, or at least the majority, are involved in rural activities such as the raising, selling or slaughter of farmyard animals. Herminia is one of these women. She is a very self-sacrificing woman, who is a member of this group, and who hopes to be able to carry on improving her living conditions and those of her family through the communal bank programme. She works at raising, selling and slaughtering the animals she raises, such as chickens and pigs. She says it is a demanding job that she does for her family.

Today she is asking for a loan to be able to buy large volumes of feed for her animals, so that she can carry on raising them.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Sara Group

texts.en:
Kozette is the featured borrower of the Sara group.  She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard to support their families.

Kozette is a 34-year-old married mother of two.  She has been a secretary for 2 years and works hard to provide them with the best education and living.

Her and her husband's income isn't  enough to cover their increasing living needs.  Therefore, she requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

The photo shows Kozette in the center.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn has grown bananas for more than six  years and earns a good income for the family and is able to support their needs. She used previous GDMPC loans  for farming. 

She took a new loan recently to expand the farm, to buy organic fertilizer, and pay replanting costs.

 She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay replanting costs.

loans.name: Darwin Alberto

texts.es: Darwin es un joven responsable, el vive con sus padres y se dedica 3 años al negocio de crianza de chanchos, también trabaja de carpintero pero comenta que en ocasiones no tiene trabajo de albañil y que en este tiempo se dedica a la  crianza de animales menores, Darwin va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de chanchos para incrementar su negocio y progresar día a día.
texts.en: Darwin is a responsible young person. He lives with his parents and has been in the business of raising pigs for 3 years. He also works as a carpenter, but explains that sometimes he doesn't have construction work. At those times, he works raising small animals. Darwin will use the loan money to increase his business and make progress day by day.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 52-year-old married mother of six children. She works hard with her husband in their bakery to increase their production and cover their increasing living needs.

Sabah is a hard worker and well known in her region for the good quality of Manakish she bakes. She is working hard to develop her business properly and hopes that she soon can renew her bakery and make it attracting to new customers.

Through this acquired loan from Kiva's Field Partner, Al Majmoua, Sabah wants to buy a car necessary for covering her business and family needs. She and her husband will use it to easily transport the requested raw materials, and to deliver their requested pastries for special events to customers on certain dates. Sabah hopes to stay capable of running her business properly, and hopes to develop it more soon.

loans.use: tbuy a car necessary for covering her business and family needs.

loans.name: Matlab

texts.en:
Matlab is 48 years old and has been married for 22 years.  He has two children. Both of his children attend school. The family members  live in the Absheron region.  They have been refugees from their motherland city of  Gubadli  for over 20 years.

Matlab has been in the trading business for 20 years and sells a type of tissue. Matlab wants to support his business and therefore he has applied to  Komak  for 1,200  AZN  to buy more tissue. 

He thanks the Kiva organization for this aid. In the future, Matlab wants to increase the size of his store.

loans.use: to buy more tissues.

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is studying at the university in Mindanao to gain a better education. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC was used to finance her studies. She was thankful for the privilege provided to students who want to pursue their studies despite financial instability. She was determined and wants to finish her studies to have a bright future of her own.  

 She took a new loan recently to pay for school tuition fees for the first semester. She hopes to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old single man from Attel, which is a small village near the city of Tulkarm. He lives with his family in a small simple house. 

Ahmad works as a wedding photographer and also records other events. He has worked in this field for ten years. It is a seasonal job because of the demand.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new video cameras for his business.  Ahmad will be able to increase his productivity by providing a  better quality product and attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy new video cameras for his business.

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en:
Hanady is a 31-year-old single lady and the sole earner of her family.  She is responsible for  five family members. She has worked at a sweets shop for six years to provide her family with a better income and improve their standard of living.

Hanady requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy living room and bedroom furniture to improve her beloved family's living.

She hopes that one day, she can open her own sweets shop  and improve her family's standard of living through the increased income she might get.

loans.use: to buy living room and bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
A local resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chan is 55 years old and is a married mother of 11 children.  Two of her children attend school. 

She struggles to afford her daily cost of living by growing rice and working another job. She earns  42,000 KHR per day.  This is the fifth loan for Chan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid the previous loan  and it allowed her to gradually improve her lifestyle. 

She is a leader of a group of 2. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pay for plowing. She hopes to gain a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolas vive en la población de Entre Rios en una vivienda alquilada desde que decidió independizarse de su familia y trabajar por cuenta propia, es por ello que se alquiló 2 has de terreno de un amigo suyo, quien por la confianza que le tiene acepto alquilarle la superficie requerida, donde ahora produce yuca y estacionalmente produce maíz, de donde obtiene sus ingresos para poder mantenerse, es de estado civil soltero, el trabajo lo realiza solo pero como es demasiado sintió que le hace falta más mano de obra de la que habitualmente contrata, por ello se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para poder contratar más mano de obra y adquirir nuevas herramientas que le permitirán realizar un mejor manejo de su cultivo y así obtener un producto  de buena calidad y sobre todo con buenos rendimientos ya que todos los cultivos dependen mucho del manejo que se realiza en toda las etapas de desarrollo.
texts.en:
Nicolas lives in the town of Entre Rios. He lives in a rented house since he decided to become independent of his family and work for himself. This is why he rented 2 hectares of land from a friend, who rented him the land he wanted because he had confidence in him.
