He now produces yucca and seasonal maize, which is how he obtains an income to provide for himself. He is single, and does the work on his own. However, as it's proving too much, he felt he needed more workers than those he normally takes on.

This is why he needs to ask for a loan to be able to take on more labourers and to buy new tools, which will allow him to manage his crop better and thus obtain a better quality product. Above all, it will help to achieve a better harvest, because all his crops depend greatly on management throughout every stage of their development.

loans.use: to take on extra labourers and to buy new tools.

loans.name: Nom's Group

texts.en:
Battambang province is the residence of Nom's group.  She is 43 years old and has four children. 

Her main source of income is from growing rice and working another job.  This helps her to meet the basic household needs. This is her second micro-loan  with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid  her previous loan  and her living conditions have gradually improved. 

She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash, insecticide, and gasoline to pump water. 

She hopes that she can gain a good yield.

loans.use: to buy potash, insecticide.

loans.name: Zoila Reveca

texts.es: Reveca es una señora muy alegre, ella tiene una discapacidad para hablar claramente pero eso no le impide salir trabajar, Reveca se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, a la elaboración y venta de melcochas y a lavar ropa de otras personas para obtener sus ingresos, Reveca tiene 2 hijos el mayor de 26 años ya es bachiller y está trabajando ya que por falta de recursos económicos no puede ir a la universidad, la hija menor que tiene 18 años está en el último año de colegio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y con este negocio aspira mejorar sus ingresos para darle el estudio a su hija.
texts.en:
Reveca is a very happy woman.  She has a disability that does not allow her to speak clearly, but this does not keep her from working.  Reveca raises small animals, makes and sells molasses toffee, and washes other people’s clothes to get her income.

Reveca has two children.  The oldest, age 26, has a high school diploma and is working.  Due to the lack of financial resources, he is not able to go to the university.  Her younger daughter is 18 and in her last year of school.

She will use the loan to buy pigs.  With this business she wishes to improve her income to use for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to fertilize his crops.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es una mujer casada de 44 años de edad y madre de 4 hijos.
Gran parte de su vida la dedicó al cuidado de sus hijos, hace 10 años tuvo un emprendimiento creado por la necesidad de alimentar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de verdura por mayor, su esposo la colabora trasladando y recolectando los vegetales de sembradíos y carpas solares ubicadas a largas distancias de su comercio. De esta manera Valentina puede solventar los estudios y la comida diaria de sus 4 hijos, 2 de ellos estudian en la escuela primaria y los otros 2 en la secundaria.
El sueño de valentina es ver a sus hijos profesionales y realiza todo los esfuerzos para que ese futuro se haga realidad.
Su negocio atraviesa problemas relacionados con el estado del tiempo, las constantes lluvias o las sequías, esto ocasiona variaciones en los precios de las verduras, es por esos problemas que muchas veces no logra reunir el capital económico necesario para la compra de mayor cantidad de verduras.
Es por esos motivos que Valentina solicita un préstamo para la compra de vegetales por mayor para incrementar su stock y poder pagar el estudio de sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Valentina is married, 44 years old, and the mother of 4 children. She dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her children. 

Ten years ago, she started a business venture due to the need to feed her family. She sells vegetables at wholesale price. Her husband works with her by collecting and transporting the vegetables from farms and greenhouses located from from where they do business. In this way, Valentina can pay for tuition and food for her 4 children. Two of them are studying in primary school and the other two are in secondary school.

Valentina's dream is to see her children become professionals, and she makes every effort to make that future a reality.

Her business goes through problems related to the weather--the constant rains or droughts. This causes variation in the prices of vegetables. It's because of these problems that she often can't pull together the capital needed to buy vegetables in large quantities. 

This is the reason that Valentina is requesting a loan to buy vegetables at wholesale, so she can increase her stock and be able to pay the school tuition for her 4 children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale price and be able to pay the school tuition for her 4 children.

loans.name: Urbanizacion Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal URBANIZACION NUEVO AMANECER, el banco está ubicado en el  distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Amalec tiene 32 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el  crédito para la compra de gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la crianza de animales, agricultura, venta de cereales.
texts.en:
Amalec belongs to the "Urbanización Nuevo Amanecer" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Echarate, in the province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

Amalec is 32 years old. She has 1 child and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities with a small grocery store business. She sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other things. She has had her business for a long time. It is going well for her, thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She hopes to be able to continue working so she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy soft drinks, among other things.

She is grateful for the loan that has been granted and pledges to make the established repayments.

The other group members work in raising animals, agriculture, and selling grains.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, among other things

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en: Pilar is a married woman who helps her husband operate a transportation business to make a living. Aside from this, she also has a banana farm, raising and harvesting bananas to make extra income. She used her previous loans for farm fertilization. Recently, she took out a new loan to cover farm maintenance in order to improve her farm. In the future, she plans to use her returns for the improvement of her house to provide better living for her family.

loans.use: to cover farm maintenance

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito operates an Internet cafe business with his wife to earn a living. For six long  years, they have earned a good income for the family and were able to sustain the business. He was determined to send his children to school and provide a better education, and with this in mind, they work with love and they never get tired working. His previous loan was used for buying office furniture and was successfully repaid. 

Recently, he took a new loan to finance a computer shop expansion. In the future, he wants to build a concrete home for his family.

loans.use: to finance a computer shop expansion

loans.name: Luis Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Luis tiene 28 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta el nivel profesional (bioquímica y farmacia) desde muy pequeño tuvo que trabajar para poder pagar el solo sus estudios porque sus papas se separaron y él vivió en casa de sus abuelos desde muy pequeño quienes no podían trabajar para darle lo que el necesitaba, cuando acabo sus estudios se dedicó a cuidar a sus abuelos, actualmente los ayuda con algunos gastos en la casa, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar una motocicleta dado que la que actualmente tiene está en muy mal estado y genera un gasto extra, como la misma es su principal herramienta de trabajo no puede seguir con ella y requiere una nueva para poder transportarse por las características particulares de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 and he managed to study biochemistry and pharmacy up to a professional level. Since he was very small he had to work to be able to pay for his studies himself, because his parents separated and he went to live in his grandparents' house. His grandparents couldn't work to give him what he needed, and when he completed his studies he set out to care for them. He now helps them with some of their household costs.

He is asking for a loan to be able to buy a motorbike, because the one he currently has is in a bad state and incurs extra costs. As it's his main tool for working, he can't carry on with it and so needs a new one to be able to use it as transport for the particular needs of his work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Sreyoun's Group

texts.en:
Sreyoun, a local farmer residing in Kampong Cham province and a married lady, is 45 years old and one of the breadwinners in the family who strives for a living via rice farming on one hectare area. 

This is the first loan for Sreyoun with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. Now, she is a leader of this first micro loan group consisting of four borrowers. For Sreyoun, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay for a plowing fee, and to buy insecticide for her crop. She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to pay for a plowing fee, and to buy insecticide for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Maria Pastora

texts.es: Pastora es una señora trabajadora, ella vive con su esposo y con sus 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a criar chanchos y también trabaja a medio tiempo arreglando una casa, su esposo se dedica a trabajar al jornal de trabajo en el campo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, Pastora aspira seguir  trabajando para mejorar sus ingreso y cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pastora is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband and their four children, who are in school. She earns her living raising pigs, and she also works part-time taking care of a house. Her husband works as a day laborer in the fields. 

Pastora will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs. She intends to keep working to improve her income and cover her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro es casado  y tiene 3 hijos Alejandro vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus familiares Alejandro es policia y requiere un credito para hacer mejoras en la vivienda que ocupa  Alejandro es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Alejandro is married and has 3 children. He lives in El Alto in a house made of adobe (sun-dried brick) that belong to his family. He is a policeman.

Alejandro is asking for a loan to make improvements to the house he is living in. He is the only breadwinner in his family and he needs your help.

loans.use: to make improvements to the house where he is living.

loans.name: Nori

texts.en:
Nori is a 43-year-old married man with four children. His oldest child is 18 years old, and the youngest child is 13 years old. Nori lives with his family in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. He studied through the elementary education, but he couldn't complete his studies. 

He is the sole breadwinner, and his income is very low. His house lacks of many home appliances and furniture. Nori works hard to improve the living standards of his house. From this side, Nori decided to start furnishing his house. Now, he wants to purchase a bedroom for the house. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. Therefore, Nori applied for a loan of 350,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB in order to purchase a bedroom for the house.  
 
Nori looks forward to improving the condition of his family. He hopes to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a bedroom for the house

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Srey, a mother of four children, is a villager from Kampong Cham province who strives for a living via rice farming on 1.5 hectares of farmland. It is the business that she has had for several years. Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’ s partner) before, Srey joins a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay for the plowing fee, and to buy more rice seed for growing. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to pay for the plowing fee, and to buy more rice seed for growing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Vipaji Group

texts.en:
Abdallah, who is in his mid 40s, is married with two small kids.  He has been running a business buying metal sheets to make metal suitcases for schoolchildren, dust bins, etc. since 1994. He works from 8 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Abdallah's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to buy metal sheets to meets his customer's demand.  He dreams of owning a food shop.

Abdallah will share this loan with his loan group "Vipaji Group", which has nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets to make suitcases and dust bins

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 40 years old, lives with her husband and five children in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. A rice farmer for 20 years, she also sells grocery items. Her enterprises earn about 43,000KHR per day to feed the family, and she manages to save about 20,000KHR each day.

This will be the second loan for Mom with Kiva’s partner VisionFund.  As the leader of her group, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. Mom hopes this loan will enable her to expand her family’s business and earn more income to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Aloka

texts.en:
Aloka is a 47-year-old woman from Dhupguri.  She is a married housewife.  She is married to Sukumar, who is a 52-year-old farmer.  Together they are raising three children (two sons and one daughter).  Two of the children are students.  One is in grade 7 and the other is in the university and doing a Masters degree in Arts. Their eldest son is engaged in agricultural activities with his father.  They live in the village of Tekatuli in their own kachha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo). Both Aloka and her husband have a secondary education.

For many years, Aloka's husband has been growing different vegetables as his primary economic activity.  He toils hard all day long on his agricultural land with the help of his son and sells the produce in the local markets.  But their earnings are not sufficient to cover all the necessary expenses of the family. So Aloka and her husband have decided to cultivate tea plants on their farmland as they have enough cultivable land, which they want to use to grow other crops for additional income. They have chosen this crop because it is a profitable crop and the climate in their region is suitable for this crop.

In order to start cultivation, Aloka applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase good quality saplings and fertilizers. Her goals are to be able to continue increasing her tea crops to diversify her income in order to not to be dependent on one sole income and to continue supporting her children with their studies so that they can be successful and make progress with their goals, hopes and dreams.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating tea plants.

loans.name: Oscar Abel

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Guadalupe junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, actualmente estudia la carrera profesional de administración en un Instituto y le va muy bien puesto que es una persona muy inteligente y estudiosa.
También desde hace casi un año trabaja como vendedor en una reconocida tienda, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador y sobre todo porque siempre es respetuoso y amable con los clientes.
Oscar está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá hacer algunos arreglos a su domicilio como pintarrajear las paredes, de esta manera estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia, vivirán con mayores comodidades y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante: "convertirse en un gran profesional".
texts.en:
Oscar is a young, enterprising person. He is 20 years old, single, and lives in Guadalupe with his family.

He is a person with a big desire to get ahead. He currently is studying admininistration at an institute and things are going well for him, since he is a very inteligent and studious person.

Also, for almost one year he has been working as a salesperson at a well-known store. It's going well for him because he is very responsible, hardworking, and above all because he's always respectful and friendly to the customers. 

Oscar is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they have provided him he'll be able to make some repairs to his house, such as stuccoing the walls. In this way, he will be improving the quality of life for his family. They will live in more comfort and he will continue working for his future: "To become a great professional."

loans.use: to make repairs to his house (stucco the walls).

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El señor Orlando tiene 19 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, y no tiene hijos dependientes a su cargo,  vive con sus padres y sus hermanos,  actualmente reside con su familia en una casita muy antigua en la zona este de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde viven no es propia. Trabaja a diario prestando sus servicios como ayudante mecánico en un taller de maquinaria pesada, el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de una motocicleta nueva que le servirá para transportarse de su casa a su trabajo que es una distancia muy larga, de esa forma mejorara sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Orlando is 19 years old. He is single and doesn't have any children in his charge. He lives with his parents and his siblings. He currently lives with his family in a small house that is very old, in the eastern part of the city of Cochabamba. The house isn't thiers. He works as a mechanic's assistant in a heavy machinery shop. The purpose of the new loan from the institution is to buy a new motorcycle for transportation from his house to his job, which is far away. In this way, he will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in her community for a living. She always finds ways to augment her income and was able to successfully repay her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to purchase organic fertilizer for her farm.

Recently, she took out a new loan to purchase fertilizer in order to improve her farm produce. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Voeurn's Group

texts.en: Dambae district of Kampong Cham province is the home area of Voeurn and her family, which consists of five children. She struggles to make a living via cassava and papaya farming.  Voeurn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past cycle and has successfully repaid her first loan.  Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay a ploughing cost, a labour cost plus reaping cost, and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She strongly believes that she can gain triple the yield than before.

loans.use: to buy potash, to pay a ploughing fee and to pay a reaping fee.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Aside from her retail store, Helen is able to run a fish vending in the market. She earns better income from this business and has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for additional capital. Improving the business is one way of gaining more income. She now takes a new loan to purchase more grocery goods and a variety of fish to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods and a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en: Erkin is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and high marks. He was one of the best pupils in his school. He likes maths, computer science, geography and other subjects. His hobby is playing football. His classmates like him very much. This year he has entered the economic university.  His parents are workers. Their income is too small to pay for Erkin’s study at the university. Erkin wants to be one of the best economists in his town. He is purposeful and hard-working. He is asking for a loan to pay for his study at university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ng'anzuki

texts.en: Ng'anzuki appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She is requesting a new loan to purchase more sacks of maize and beans for resale.  She thanks Yehu for their financial support

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene, who is a 28-year-old, married woman, lives in Borjomi district.  Her family members are her husband and her mother-in-law, who works at the hospital and generates an insignificant salary.  Elene's husband has a state job and earns 700 GEL monthly.  Elena doesn't have her own business, but she works at a private clinic as a dentist and her income is distributed to the owner of the clinic.

Now, she needs financial support to purchase a stock of tools and hardware to continue running her business herself.  She has already had a large number of loyal and satisfied costumers and she can only progress by opening her own clinic.  Elena has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Elena and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: to open a dental clinic.

loans.name: Visal's Group

texts.en:
Visal is a 24-year-old, father of one baby daughter living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice and working for others for a fee for the past two years. The current business earns him about 36,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first micro-loan for Visal’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading his group to apply for a loan, Visal, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers and gasoline for his farmland. He hopes that this loan will enable him to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and gasoline for his farmland.

loans.name: Sofia Paola

texts.es: Paola es una señora perseverante, ella es una mujer viuda que  vive con sus 2 hijas de 3 años, Paola comenta que hace 2 años atrás su esposo tuvo un accidente y falleció,  ella lucho duro y saco adelante a sus hijas que tenían un año, Paola se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa y colchones, ella cuenta que  empezó en este negocio cuando Fodemi le dio el primer crédito, Paola va a invertir el dinero en la compra de mercadería en ropa para ampliar su negocio y seguir trabajando, de este negocio Paola aspira mejorar su negocio para beneficio de sus hijas.
texts.en: Paola is a determined woman. She's a widow who lives with her two three-year-old daughters. Paola tells that two years ago her husband had an accident and passed away. She fought hard and provided for her daughters, who were one year old. Paola is a travelling vendor of clothes and mattresses. She says that she started this business when Fodemi gave her her first loan. Paola is going to invest the money in the purchase of clothing goods to expand her business and keep working. With this business, Paola hopes to improve her business for the benefit of her daughters.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Moung Russey district, where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Chreb is a 35-year-old mother of seven children.  Rice farming and working as a paid worker are the main sources of the family’s income which she and her husband have been in for 16 years. 

This is the second micro-loan for Chreb with VisionFund.  She has completely paid back the first loan. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan, Chreb, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source of income so as to increase her income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe a été crée le 14/05/2009 avec 23 membres qui habitent dans le même quartier. Les membres du groupe sont unis par la solidarité et l’entraide. Ces femmes  sont braves et elles remboursent sans difficultés. Maimouna l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe ,elle est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux filles scolarisées. Elle fait le commerce de divers produits.Elle achète ses produits en Casamance en gros (du citron, de l’huile de palme, du poisson sec pour une valeur de 150 000)pour revendre en détail à Louga. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle tient une étale chez elle dans le quartier. Elle ne se déplace pas car son mari est chauffeur en Casamance et c’est lui qui va acheter pour elle. Son activité marche bien. Les produits qu’elle vend sont réputés pour leur qualité. C’est aussi des produits rares dans la zone. Avec ses bénéfices elle compte soutenir son époux dans la prise en charge pour la scolarité des filles.
texts.en: This group was created on May 14, 2009. It is composed of 23 members living in the same neighborhood. The group members are united in the spirit of solidarity and mutual help. These women are reliable and pay their loans off without issue. Maimona, a star borrower, is the group representative. She is 38 years and has two daughters, both in school. She sells miscellaneous items. She buys her merchandise in Casamance wholesale (lemons, palm oil, dried fish etc for 150,000 West African francs) in order to resell it retail in Louga. She has been in this business for over 10 years. She has a sales stand by her home, which is in the neighborhood. She does not travel to stock up on merchandise since her husband works as a driver in Casamance and buys her merchandise for her. Her business is going well. She is known for selling quality products. These items are also hard to find locally. With her revenues, she aims to help her husband cover their daughters’ school fees.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items [for resale].

loans.name: Seanghean's Group

texts.en: Seanghean, a resident from Kampong Cham province, is 49 years old and a married mother blessed with seven children.  To earn a living, she manages two hectares of farmland as her main source of income. This business earns her about 40,500 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Seanghean with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has fully repaid back her previous loan. Now, she has formed a group of four to get a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, and to pay for labour costs. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, and to pay for labour costs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pho's Group

texts.en: A mother of three kids, Pho is 42 years old and a resident from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To overcome her family’s hardship, Pho grows cassava and rubber three as her main source of income. This is not the first loan for Pho with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her previous loan completely and it has improved her lifestyle gradually. Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. For Pho, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash, to pay a ploughing fee and to pay a reaping fee. She hopes to gain triple the yield than before.

loans.use: to buy potash, to pay a ploughing fee and to pay a reaping fee.

loans.name: Blanca Eulalia

texts.es: Blanca es una señora casada y tiene una hija de 10 años que se encuentra asistiendo a la escuela, Blanca vive en una casa que  le presta un familiar, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado, su esposo trabaja de estibador de papas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, Blanca  es una señora trabajadora y ella aspira comprarse una casa para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Blanca is married and has a 10 year old daughter who is attending school. Blanca lives in a house that a family member lends to her. She raises cattle for a living. Her husband is a potato porter. She will invest the loan in the purchase of a cow. Blanca is very hardworking and she aspires to buy a house to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор родом из Виноградово. Он работает в местной службе такси, работает на автомобиле марки Жигули. Работает в этой сфере уже 6 лет. В свое время Виктор взял это транспортное средство в кредит и выплатил всю сумму в срок. 
Виктору 34 года и он пока не женат. Но свадьба входит в его ближайшие планы, почему, собственно, он и обратился к КИВА. Прежде, чем жениться, Виктор хотел бы обустроить ванную комнату в доме, сделав там полный ремонт, на что ему необходима сумма в 20 000 гривен.
texts.en: Viktor was born in Vinogradovo. He works in the local taxi services driving a Zhiguli car. He has been in this business for six years. Back when he started, Viktor took out a loan to buy his car and eventually paid off the entire amount on time. Viktor is 34 years old and still single at present he is still single. However, he plans to get married in the near future, which is why he has reached out to Kiva. Before his wedding, he would like to do a complete remodeling of the bathroom in his house. To do this, he needs 20,000 UAH.

loans.use: to remodel his bathroom

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda tiene 46 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 05 hijos,la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos  a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” ,la socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Hilda is 46 years old, lives with her partner, and has 5 children. She raises small animals, such as guinea pigs. She has been in this business for a long time, and it's going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She raises these animals and then sells them to clients who request them from her. She hopes to be able to continue working so that she can continue providing for her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

She belongs to the "Siempre Juntos" [Always Together] communal bank. She is grateful for and values the the loan and she pledges to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Gouri

texts.en:
Gouri is a very young woman from Maynaguri.  She is only 26 years old.  She is married and a mother of one young son. She has a primary education.  Her parents could not afford any further education for her due to poverty. She lives with her son and husband Mahim, age 45, in the small village of Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district.

Gouri's husband is a daily laborer.  He works on daily wages for a building contractor. He has no consistent income. As a result, his income can hardly cover his family's household.

Gouri is responsible, goal-driven and considerate. To help her husband to run the family well, she has been engaged in a milk-selling business. Initially, she started the business with the purchase of one cow.  Then she started supplying milk to her neighbors, who are her main clients. Now this business is the main source of income for the family. She wants to develop her milk production business to cope with the financial situation when the price of everything is going up. She wants to purchase one more cow.  Thus, she will be able to supply more milk to earn more profit,

With this aim, she has asked for financial help from BJS to purchase a cow. She hopes the earnings from the business will bring financial sustenance for her family to give them a smooth life.

She has a dream of constructing a concrete-made house for them with the profit generated from the loan.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jhon Braulio

texts.es: El señor Braulio tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y  tiene 1 hijo dependiente a su cargo, trabaja como chofer de taxi en una línea de radio móvil, en la ciudad de Cochabamba, en la actividad que realiza tiene 4 años de experiencia, actualmente vive por la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba en casa de sus abuelitos, junto con sus hermanos,  el destino del nuevo crédito es para la compra de una motocicleta nueva, para que se pueda trasladar desde su casa a su trabajo y asi lograra mejorar sus condiciones de vida, para bienestar tanto de el como de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: Braulio is 33 years old. He is single and has 1 child in his care. He works as a taxi driver for a radio service line in the city of Cochabamba. He has 4 years of experience in this work. He currently lives in the western part of the city of Cochabamba in his grandparents' house, along with this siblings. The purpose of the loan is to buy a new motorcycle, so that he can get from his house to his work; this way he'll be able to improve his living conditions and wellbeing, for himself as well as for his young son.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Mchekwisha

texts.en:
Mchekwisha is a hardworking woman who lives in Tiribe.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, soap, cooking oil and salt for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, soap, cooking oil and salt for resale

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is 57 years old and lives in the village of Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region. He lives with his 30-year-old son. Ashot has a specialty as a mechanic and during many years he worked in his specialty and sometimes he also worked as a locksmith and in construction. Now the only source of income for this small family is farming and agriculture. On his farm with his son, Ashot raises two cows, five sheep and twenty chickens. On his plot of land he cultivates cucumbers, tomatoes, greens and peppers. As Ashot says, he is happy with his farming activities and for his farm products. He has a lot of loyal customers who, from his house, buy milk, macun (Armenian national dairy product), eggs, meat and vegetables from his land as well.

Ashot is asking for a loan in the amount of 210,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some fodder for his farm cattle, since the hay that he has bought before turned out to be not enough.

loans.use: to buy some fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Yong's Group

texts.en: Yong, a mother of two kids, is a villager from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Her main sources of income are from cassava farming and miscellaneous paid working jobs. The business that she has had for ages earns her about 37,500 KHR as current daily average income. For this loan cycle, she and her joint borrower are in their second cycle loan with a past successful loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava seedlings and to pay for the transplanting fee. With those improvements, she hopes to earn more income than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and to pay for the transplanting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Wonderful people! Meet Daniel, who is 25 years old, very ambitious, hardworking and very humble. Daniel hails from the Kitale area of Kenya--a place that is very fertile and is the “bread basket of Kenya.” Being raised in a humble background has nurtured Daniel to have humility and patience in life.  Daniel started farming two years ago and has been making a lot of profits.
Being still young and single, most of the profits that he gets through farming Daniel invests in his farm and uses the rest to support his parents. Daniel never got the chance to further his education because of a lack of funds but that did not deter him from achieving his goal of succeeding in life.
Daniel practices mixed farming and also runs a small business to make ends meet. He is so determined to succeed in life and he wants to gather more profits so that he can lay a solid foundation for his family. Daniel sells the fruits of his labor to the nearby markets within his area but because of poor feeder roads and a poor road network, Daniel has been experiencing a challenge transporting his products to the market. Most of the products such as milk and vegetables require that Daniel take them to the market quickly while they are still fresh so that he can get maximum profits, but Daniel has been facing the challenge of timely delivery of the products due to the roads.  
That is why he is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES to purchase a motorbike that will be of great help to him.  With the motorbike, Daniel will be able to deliver milk and vegetables to the market on time and increase his profits. Daniel is sure that through the increased profits, he will be able to repay the loan on time, provide good living conditions for his family and also impact society positively.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help him transport his harvest to the market.

loans.name: Jael

texts.en:
Jael is a 41-year-old widow who supports a family of two children and has been operating a clothing sales stall for seven years earning her an income of 3,000 KES at the end of every month.

Jael is now requesting her second loan of 7,846.50 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount of money to buy solar lamps and improved energy saving jikos for her own personal use and improve the living standard of her family.  The income generated from her clothing sales business would be used to pay the school fees of her children.

Jael hopes to buy land for her family and become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy solar lamps and improved energy saving jikos.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy is from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living.  She is 46 years old, and as a mother of seven children, she has struggled to feed her family by farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for 11 years, the current business earns her approximately 59,000 KHR per day.
 
Vy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle and she completely paid back her past loan. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Thouk's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Thouk is 42 years old and married with six children. The main sources of her family’s income are from pineapple growing and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 44,000 KHR per day.
Thouk’s group consists of two members and she has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully used the past loan to better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Thouk will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it for a water pump to carry water into the rice field. She hopes to make more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net is 26 years old, married, and the mother of one son.  She lives in a rural village within the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Selling grocery items is the main source of the family’s income and her husband supplements her income by working as a taxi driver. They are able to earn about $15 USD per day to support the need of their family. 
Net just joined with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is seeking a loan to buy more grocery items to resell.  She hopes to make more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items that she can resell for a profit.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married mother of six children all of whom are in school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. 

Mose has operated a grinding machine business at the market for the past three years. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine.  She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Age 35 and a resident from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Sreymom is a mother of three children who remain in school.  Her single source of income is from rice farming, which she has done for 17 years, earning about 34,700 KHR per day.	
With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Sreymom is in her third loan cycle and she has already fully repaid her previous loans.  Now, she joins a group of four to get a new loan and she is their leader.  Sreymom will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. With that purchase, she hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, 49, is married and living with her family in a village in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has five children.

For the last 30 years, Sopheap and her husband have been farming rice as the main source of the family’s income to make a living. Together, they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Sopheap’s group consists of four members and she is in her second loan cycle. The past loans, which she successfully repaid, have helped her support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
A local resident from Kampong Cham province, Sokheng is 33 years old and married. She has three kids to support. One child is in school and one is too young for schooling.

For the sake of her family, working at a construction site is the single source of income to support her living. This is the second loan for Sokheng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan completely. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy necessary materials to support her occupation. She hopes that she can own sufficient tools to be ready for her job.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials to support her occupation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married with five children, four of whom go to school.

She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 2 years. She sells her charcoal from home. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa has operated their own farm for more than eleven years and is earning a better income for the family. She used her income in supporting her children's education.

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming and is now requesting a new loan to purchase organic fertilizers used for this cropping season. In the future, Narcisa hopes to expand and improve her farm to support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for her motorbike. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorbike

loans.name: Chengleng's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Tbaung Khmum district, Chengleng is 50 years old and married. She has five children. Chengleng is a rice farmer and she has been in this business for almost 32 years.  She currently earns about 29,000 KHR per day. 
This is the microloan for Chengleng’s group of two and she is in her third cycle.  Her past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Muhbira

texts.en: Muhbira is married parent of 3 children. His husband is a farmer, and their sons help with the farming business. Muhbira has earned a higher education in pedagogical education. Muhbira works in a local school. Two years ago, she began her own business of buying and selling children's clothes. Her salary was small and she really needed additional income. Now, she sells children's clothes in a local market. Muhbira is a very sociable and smart woman. She makes individual touches for each customer. Muhbira is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy children's clothes to increase her working capital. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Hoykeang

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Thom province’s Stoeng Sen district, Hoykeang is aged 39 years and married.

To feed the family, her husband works as a taxi driver. The current job has earned her family about 18 USD per day to support the family's needs.

Hoykeang has just been with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is seeking a loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee at university, in the faculty of banking. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee at university

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Srey Snom district of Sieam Reap province, Phorn is 55 years old and married with four children.

To support her family, she has been farming rice for 25 years. From the current business, she can earn about 35,000 KHR per day and can save about 12,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

This is a group loan for Phorn’s group of four with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is a first-loan-cycle client. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use a portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely way so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is widowed with no children. She takes care of two additional family members.

She has a pub business and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more molasses for making local gin. She generates additional income from selling firewood and charcoal. She works from home, sells on a wholesale basis and works seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

Grace aspires to expand her business into a big pub and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense is rent.

loans.use: to buy jerrycans of local brew and spirits

loans.name: Jaymart

texts.en:
Jaymart has run a motorcycle transportation business for more than three years to make a living. He gains better income from this to sustain his family.

He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for motor accessories. To ensure safety and better service, he took a new loan recently to cover motorcycle maintenance.

He is hopeful of earning more income to pursue his ambition of building his own house for his family in the future.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Kshama

texts.en:
Kshama is 41 years old.  She is from Dhupguri, a rural woman, and married to Kartik, who is 49 years old.  They have no children.  They live in the small village of Bongkandi in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Kshama studied until grade nine but could not continue further because of the poor economic resources of her parents.  Her husband attended school until grade eight.

Kshama is a very active and enthusiastic woman.  Her husband is associated with a small business, while she looks after the household.  The earnings from her husband's business are hardly sufficient for their household.  She wants to use her leisure time by doing some work to help her husband to run the family well. She wants to start a business selling clothing (saris, frocks, shirts, petticoats etc.)  She believes that she will be significantly successful in this business. She needs financial support to start the business.

Strong and independent, Kshama asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  She wants to purchase better quality clothing to bump up the size of her inventory.  She wants to resell the clothes to her neighbors who will be her main clients. With the profit, she wishes to establish a stable livelihood.  In the future, she wants to continue this business for the betterment and financial development of her family.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes to start a clothing business.

loans.name: Khursand

texts.en: Khursand was born in 1958. She is married and has four children. She is a very hardworking woman. She has been busy in the bakery business for more than seven years. She bakes flatbread and sells it in a local market. She bakes flatbread in a national tanur oven. Her husband helps her manage the business. Khursand is going to increase her business and from the profit give her son a higher education. She is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni to buy flour and butter to work to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy flour and butter

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She has a food stall business. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of carrots, eggplants, onions, green peppers, and cabbages. She works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to grow vegetables and also get a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, carrots, tomatoes, oranges and onions

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 30-year-old married woman who supports a family of two children. Her husband adds additional income to their family. Judith has been operating a barber shop business for three years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Judith is now servicing her second loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy additional quality shaving blades for her barber shop.  She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to open an additional barber shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: To buy  additional quality shaving blades for her barber shop.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is married with four children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanahamisi has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past five years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors.

Mwanahamisi is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es: La señora Avelina y su marido son personas mayores con 42  y 52 años de edad, ella alcanzo a estudiar solo hasta el nivel primario por diversas razones ya que sus papas no se encontraban en condiciones para cubrir los gastos de sus estudios, tiene su casita propia rustica y cuentan con tres dependientes económicos a su cargo, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, los productos que cultiva son papa, haba y arveja en su terreno propio de 4 hectáreas, la cual la obtuvo con mucho esfuerzo.  La señora vive en Tiraque, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, pero para poder seguir trabajando por sus hijos y su familia tiene la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para su producción, de esta forma podrá obtener mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar las condiciones  de vida de su familia para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Avelina and her husband are older people at 42 and 52 years of age. She managed to study only up to the primary school level for a variety of reasons, one being that her parents weren't in a financial situation to cover the costs of her studies. She has her own rustic house and has three economic dependents under her care. The economic activity that she pursues is agriculture. The products she grows are potatoes, broad beans and peas on her own land of 4 hectares which she got through great effort.

Avelina lives in Tiraque and she is a responsible and hard-working person. But in order to continue to work for her children and her family she needs to request a loan to buy agricultural inputs for her production. In this way she can obtain better economic income that will improve the living conditions of her family to continue their struggle.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.es: Ladislao vive en concubinato y tiene 1 hijo Ladislado vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Ajllata en una casa de adobe que tiene luz y agua Ladislao se gana la vida como pescador en el lago Titicaca desde la madrugada hasta el anochecer  y necesita un credito para comprar un red de pesca Ladislao recibe ayuda de sus padres pero la familia es pobre por eso, Ladislao necesita su ayuda para seguir trabajando
texts.en:
Ladislao lives with his partner, and he has one child.   He lives with his parents in the community of Ajillata, in an adobe house that has electricity and water.

He earns his living as a fisherman in Lake Titicaca, working from dawn to dusk.  He needs a loan to buy a fishing net.  Ladislao receives help from his parents, but the family is poor, so he needs your help to continue working.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El socio Gerardo continua dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de colchones ,el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio vende a sus diferentes  clientes que le solicitan, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como espumas entre otros.
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” ,el socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: The member Gerardo continues working at his business of making mattresses. He has been doing this for a long time and things are going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his business each day. He sells to different clients who request items and he wants to continue to work in this way to continue to support his family. The member is requesting a loan to buy materials like foam amongst others. Gerardo belongs to the “Siempre Juntos” communal bank. He is grateful  for and values the loan and promises to pay his installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy materials like foam amongst others.

loans.name: Lara

texts.en:
Lara is a 31-year-old married mother of two. For the past six years, she has worked in a shop selling sweets to support her family in a well-managed way. Lara is a hard working woman who puts much effort into developing her family's lifestyle and supporting her loved ones. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to help her brother with his wedding expenses. This will be her gift to him for this special occasion.

She hopes that one day she can afford to open her own sweet shop and further support her family.

loans.use: To help her brother with his wedding expenses as her gift to him for this special occasion

loans.name: Ada Marilu

texts.es:
Ada, es una madre que disfruta junto a su esposo ver crecer a sus hijos, los dos desempeñan diferentes trabajos para que en su hogar no les haga falta lo necesario para vivir mejor, por su parte Ada se dedica a trabajar  en su sastrería, oficio que le enseñaron en su familia, lo hace de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, de realizar este trabajo tiene 6 años.
Utilizará el financiamiento para comprar zippers, botones, hilos, telas, agujas, ojetes, dedales, tijeras y dar mantenimiento a la máquina de coser, con lo que mejorara su atención hacia los clientes y calidad de su trabajo, espera aumentar la popularidad del negocio y tener mejores ganancias.
Sus sueños son construir su casa propia, brindar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud educación y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Ada is a mother who enjoys seeing her children grow up along with her husband. The two of them take care of different chores at home, but they do not lack the necessities that are required to live better. Ada works in her own tailoring shop, a trade that she learned from her family. She works from 7:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. and has been doing this type of work for six years.

Ada will use her loan to buy zippers, buttons, thread, fabrics, needles, eyelets, thimbles, and scissors. She will also pay for maintenance of her sewing machine. This will improve the service that she provides to her customers and the quality of her work. She hopes that the popularity of her business will increase and that she will have more income.

Ada’s dreams include building her own house, repaying her debt, and providing her family with better food, clothes, health, and education.

loans.use: to buy zippers, buttons, thread, fabrics, needles, eyelets, thimbles, scissors, and pay for maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, Mejumaa wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, maize flour, and soap for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, maize flour, and soap

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 44 años de edad casado y tiene cinco hijos.
Él vive en la localidad de batallas distante a una hora y 30 minutos de viaje de la ciudad de El Alto, esta zona se caracteriza por la agricultura, ganadería y pesca. Juan es de tez morena, cabello negro y ojos hundidos en el rostro sus manos son duras como la madera que utiliza para construir botes de pesca, porque él trabaja como carpintero y necesita madera.
Su vida la dedica a la carpintería sobre todo a la construcción de botes porque en la zona donde vive son muy requeridos, sus hijos ayudan en parte de la construcción y el armado, el resto del tiempo lo dedican a otras actividades.
Juan sueña mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, lo único que necesita es un pequeño capital para la compra de madera y con eso dedicarlo a la construcción de botes para la pesca.
Es por esos motivos que juan solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera para la construcción de botes de pesca.
texts.en:
Juan is a 44-year-old man who is married and has five children. He lives in the town of Batallas, which is an hour-and-half trip from the city of El Alto. This area is known for agriculture, livestock breeding, and fishing. Juan has tanned skin, dark hair, and sunken eyes. His hands are as hard as wood since he uses them to build fishing boats. Since he works as a carpenter, he is in need of wood.

Juan’s life has revolved around carpentry, especially the construction of boats, because it is a required skill in the area where he lives. His children help with construction and assembly. He devotes the rest of his time to other activities.

Juan dreams of earning more income so that he can improve his children’s quality of life. The only thing he needs is a small amount of capital so that he can buy wood, which would be designated for building fishing boats. For this reason, Juan is requesting a loan in order to buy the wood for fishing boat construction.

loans.use: to buy wood for building fishing boats.

loans.name: Yudit Dominga

texts.es:
La socia Yudit Dominga tiene 27 años , la  socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende a pedido a sus amistades familiares, clientes entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas.
La socia continua pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” ,la socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Yudit Dominga, 27, still belongs to Siempre Juntos Communal Bank.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling clothing.  She has worked in this business for a while and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells on request to friends, family members, customers, and others.  She wants to be able to keep on working and helping her family.

Yudit Dominga's requesting the loan to buy jackets.

She's grateful for and appreciates the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy jackets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a small store instead of the stall

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en: Florencia owns and operates a tricycle transport service in order to make a living. Having operated this business for many long years he is now thinking of the possibilities for expansion. He had successfully repaid a previous loan he  used for obtaining spare parts and accessories. Currently, he is requesting a new loan to purchase a vehicle to be used for expansion of his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle used for a tricycle transport service

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en: For more  than five years, Racquel has sold motorcycles to make a living.  She earns enough that she was able to support her parents' needs and save a portion for her future. She had her photo taken with the motorcycle she used for personal transportation during a promotion for selling her products. She took a new loan to cover motor repair and maintenance.  She wants to improve her business to gain more income for a better future.

loans.use: to cover motor repair and maintenance

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married with nine children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Rehema sells household items, selling various items such as cutlery, plates, cups, basins and carpets among others.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more stock of household items such as kitchen utensils and carpets for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household items such as kitchen utensils and carpets

loans.name: Zeinat

texts.en:
Zeinat is a 46-year-old married mother of four. She works hard to support her family, who are her main concern in life. She works hard to provide them with a better standard of living, especially because they are Palestinian refugees in Lebanon and don't have the same minimum decent living standard that others do.

For this reason, Zeinat helps her husband by operating her small shop where she sells accessories, perfumes, and cosmetics. She established her shop two years ago. She used to sell clothes for a living. Zeinat enjoys her current business where she is diversifying with several new items to attract customers' attention and increase her income.

Today, she is acquiring her third loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise with special newly-released accessories and gifts. She has selected this collection to sell before the end of Holy Ramadan month's celebrations. 

She has a good reputation and is well known for her excellent customer service. She is always looking for ways to expand her shop and introduce her customers to new items, such as accessories, cosmetics, perfumes, etc. Zeinat is very proud of herself and the level her business has reached.

loans.use: To purchase new accessories and gifts for her shop

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Señora Francisca, está casada, su nivel de educación es solo hasta el nivel primario por diversas razones y circunstancias de la vida, ahora vive en casa propia junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura, su casa es de construcción rustica de adobe y techo de calamina ubicada en la provincia Tiraque del departamento de Cochabamba. Tiene cinco hijos dependientes económicos a su cargo, los cuales asisten a la escuela para tener una mejor educación. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, los productos que cultiva son papa, haba, avena y cebada en su terreno propio. La señora es una persona responsable y trabajadora, actualmente se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de trabajo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semilla y abono para su producción, que a corto plazo le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is married.  For a variety of reasons and life circumstances, her educational level is only up to elementary school.  Now she lives in her own house with her husband, who works in agriculture.  Her house is rustic, made of adobe with a corrugated metal roof, located in Tiraque Province in Cochabamba Departments.  She has five dependent children in her care; they attend school to get a better education.

She earns a living in agricultural production.  She grows potatoes, beans, oats, and barley on her own plot of land.  She's a responsible and hardworking woman.

Currently she needs to request working capital to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds and soil amendments for her crop.  In the short term this will allow her to earn more income to use to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and soil amendments

loans.name: Vaziraby

texts.en: Vaziraby lives with her two children in the South of Tajikistan. She is widowed. Vaziraby is a sewer. She sews women's national dresses but mainly she sews national mattresses. She sews mattresses by order of her clients. She sews mattresses that are high quality and in this way, she attracts clients. Vaziraby needs financial support because her son is ill. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy medicines for the treatment of her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for the treatment of her son

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 39-year-old married, hardworking woman who supports a family of three children and her husband who adds additional income to their family.  Doracs has been operating a cloth and dressmaking shop for a period of twelve years earning her an income of KES.15,000 at the end of every month.

Dorcas is now servicing her second loan of KES.70,000 with Kiva partner VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount of money to add more stock of materials to boost her business with more and various designs to meet the expectations of her clients.  She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and buy an additional tailoring machine.

Dorcas hopes to start a dressmaking and design training school in her town to empower young people in the community and become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy stock of materials to make clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Medza, in addition to the poultry selling business, operates a retail shop business.

She is asking for a loan to buy soap, wheat flour, cooking oil, salt to resell. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy soap, wheat flour, cooking oil, salt to resell.

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en: Lusik is a farmer from Vaghatin village in the Syunik region. She lives there with her husband and two teenage children (one son and one daughter). The family has been engaged in farming for 10 years already. They cultivate emmer wheat, and potatoes, and own an orchard. With the help of her husband, Lusik is also involved in animal husbandry. She breeds cattle, sheep, and hens and keeps bee colonies. In order to sustain her family's agribusiness, Lusik wants to make some investments. In particular, she has applied for a loan of USD 3,000 to pay for 1.5 tons of fuel and 850 kg of sainfoin (a legume) seeds and to finance the soil plowing process. It is also worth mentioning that she has an ideal credit history with no delinquent days.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and seeds and pay for plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for labor to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 36-year-old married woman, who has been running a small general store with her husband for the last four years. She has almost all the basic household items in her shop and it is the single shop in her town of its kind. Nasreen’s husband purchases the shop items from the city and his wife sells it in her town. They have one daughter and three sons, two of which are school going. In order to expand her operations, Nasreen has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR in order to purchase the shop items such as shampoo, surf and eatables such as buns, biscuits, spices etc. in wholesale. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior for the past loans. She dreams of earning more income by expanding her shop.

loans.use: to purchase shop items such as shampoo, surf and eatables such as buns, biscuits, spices etc. in wholesale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia vive en concubinato  y tiene 3 hijos  Ella vive en la comunidad de Chijipina  en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que tiene luz y agua Alicia se gana la vida con la elaboracion y venta de quesos y quiere un credito para comprar una vaca lechera prenañada para aumentar su produccion de leche para asi elaborar más quesos La pareja de Alicia trabaja como albañil pero esta expuesto a riesgos y lo que gana no alcanza para potenciar el negocio de Alicia, por eso ella necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Alicia lives with her partner, and she has three children. She lives in the community of Chijipina, in a brick and cement house that has electricity and water. 

Alicia earns a living making and selling cheese. She wants a loan to purchase a pregnant dairy cow in order to increase her production of milk, and thus, make more cheese. 

Alicia’s partner works as a bricklayer, but he is exposed to risks, and his income doesn't stretch far enough to invest in Alicia’s business.  That is why she needs your support.

loans.use: to purchase a pregnant dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beads and corn.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
To make a living, Marife helps her husband operate their own farm. Aside from this, she also sells snacks and barbecue in their village to earn additional income. She successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used for farm inputs. With her effort, she was able to build her own store where she began selling groceries and viands with her snacks. It brings in better income for the family. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

She is hopeful that she will gain more profits from their farm and from her business to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a single woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: A rice grower residing in Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province, Chanthou is 44 years old and has four children. Nowadays, only three kids still count on her, as they are in school. She has been involved in her current business for several years. She has been with VIsionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages and it returns her a decent support for her living. Now, she is leading a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en: Nabeela is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been running a general store for 3 years. Nebeela herself handles the operations of the shop with the assistance of her husband. She has one child. In order to make more profits, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy rice, grains, tea, spices, surf, shampoo, soaps, and other stock for her general store. She is hopeful that with this loan, she will be able to cater to more customers from her local community. She dreams of providing a bright future to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, grains, tea, spices, surf, shampoo, soaps, and other stock for her general store.

loans.name: Annatollia

texts.en:
Annatollia is a 21-year-old businesswoman from the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. As a single mother of one, Annatollia works hard to provide for her family. To do this she operates a business at the local center selling blankets, shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets. She really loves her shop and would like to increase her sales in order to expand it. 
 
Annatollia is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase more shirts, dresses, shoes jackets and blankets to increase her stock.
