She will use the proceeds to improve her standard of living, expand the business and create employment in her community. To give back to her community in her spare time, Anatolia also volunteers in schools, helping students form and maintain study groups to promote cooperative learning.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and blankets

loans.name: Hasna

texts.en:
Hassna is a 39-year-old married mother of two. She is a Palestinian refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian camp to support her family's day-to-day living expenses.

Hasna is a hard worker. She has been working as a hairdresser from her house since 2006, and her business is going on just fine. Unfortunately her family's needs are increasing her, and she and her husband's combined income isn't enough to cover these increasing needs. 

For this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. To help establish daily income, she will open a small grocery store as an additional source of income for the family.

She hopes that through this newly established business she can move to a wider supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replenish his shop with rice, cooking oil, baking flour and sugar.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Santusa continua con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia continua con su negocio de venta de comida, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Santusa, belongs to Santa Rosita de Lima Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Santusa still has her business selling clothing.  She has worked in this business for years, and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She also has a business selling food.  She wants to be able to keep on working and supporting her family.

Santusa's requesting the loan to buy jackets and other garments.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy jackets and other garments

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita runs a general store in her village while also helping her husband operate their farm for a living. Improving her business is her main goal, as it provides a daily source of income for the family. She is borrowing a new loan from GDMPC to buy grocery goods for the store and organic fertilizer for the farm.  Angelita hopes that in the near future she will be able to improve the general living condition of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina continua en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” ,la socia sigue dedicándose a trabajar como asistente en una veterinaria, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como inyectables, vitaminas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina is still a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Juntos” (Always Together). She continues to work as a veterinary assistant. Marcelina has been at this job for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

Marcelina is requesting a loan in order to buy products such as injectables, vitamins, and other products. She is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy injectables, vitamins, and other veterinary products.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es casado pero no tiene hijos El vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su padre Jorge es albañil y desea un credito para ampliar la habitacion que ocupa puesto que el cuarto es muy pequeño Jorge es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar, lo bueno es que sus habilidades le permitirán ahorrar en mano de obra
texts.en:
Jorge is married but has no children. He lives in a brick and cement house in La Paz that belongs to his father.

Jorge is a bricklayer and wants a loan so that he can expand the room that he occupies since it is very small. He is the only breadwinner in his household. It is a good thing that his construction skills will allow him to save on labor costs.

loans.use: to expand the room that he occupies in his father's house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flagstones for the yard of the house.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 30 años, esta soltero, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. El trabajo por un tiempo en un minisúper, luego de quedar sin empleo decidió vender ropa de segunda mano como camisas, blusas, jeans, camisetas, short, cameras, cortinas y manteles. Esta actividad la realiza mediante pedidos y venta ambulante. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener el negocio, actualmente solicita el séptimo ciclo que es por 20,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir de ropa como camisas, blusas, jeans, short, cortinas etc. para aumentar el inventario y las ganancias. Su plan es lograr tener un local fijo y propio para establecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 30 years old, single, and lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. He had a job at a supermarket for some time, but he later became unemployed. Carlos decided to sell secondhand clothes such as shirts, blouses, jeans, T-shirts, and shorts, as well as curtains and tablecloths. He conducts his business by taking orders and selling as a street vendor. Carlos has requested several loans in order to maintain his business.

He is currently requesting his seventh loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL. Carlos plans to acquire a stock of clothes that includes shirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, as well as curtains and other items so that he can increase his inventory and his earnings. His plan is to have a permanent shop of his own where he can establish his business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, as well as curtains and other items.

loans.name: Erika Yessenia

texts.es:
Erika, vive con su esposo y una hija pequeña, su esposo es empleado, comparten los gastos de su familia y velan por el bienestar de su hija, Erika es propietaria de una tienda de artículos varios y elabora atoles para vender, en sus inicios solo se dedicaba a los quehacer de su hogar,  luego que una Iglesia se estableciera cerca de su vivienda se decidió a realizar la apertura de la tienda, ya tiene 6 meses de poseerla y por el momento no representa dificultades.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar papel higiénico, bebidas, boquitas, toallas sanitarias, pan, dulces, azúcar, sal, frijoles, etc., surtirá el inventario para ofrecer más productos, atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas y ganancias para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Su objetivo es tener recursos económicos para construir su casa propia y dar a su familia un lugar más seguro y agradable en donde vivir.
texts.en:
Erika lives with her husband and young daughter. Her husband is employed and they both share in their family’s expenses so that they can provide for their daughter’s welfare. Erika is the owner of a store where she sells various products. She also prepare “atol” (a traditional beverage made from corn) to sell. Starting out, Erika only focused on her household duties. After a church was built near her home, she decided that she would open a store. She has already been in business for six months and is not experiencing any difficulties at the moment.

Erika will use this loan to buy toilet paper, beverages, snack foods, sanitary napkins, bread, sweets, sugar, salt, beans, and other products so that she can restock her inventory and offer more products. She wants to attract new customers, increase her sales and earnings, and fulfill her obligations.

Her goal is to have financial resources in order to build a house of her own so that she can give her family a safer and more pleasant place in which to live.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, beverages, snack foods, sanitary napkins, bread, sweets, sugar, salt, beans, and other products.

loans.name: Donald

texts.en: Donald has been running his transportation service while working at a private institution. He earns better income from this to cover his living expenses. He successfully repaid his previous loans used for his business. Recently, Donald took  a new loan to cover house repair costs. He wants to provide a better education for his children, as well as improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover house repair costs.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: To make a living, Loida helps her husband run their own farm in their village. After six years of generating income from their farm, she earns better income and has repaid her previous loans used toward this endeavor. She always finds ways to expand their farm, which is her family's main source of income. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She wishes to continue earning more in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 37-year-old married man with three children. His oldest child is 11 years old and the youngest one is two years old. Mohammed lives with his family in their own new house in Dhamar, Yemen. He has a University education. He is a very dynamic and vigorous man. The building of a new and comfortable house was Mohammed's sole challenge. Over time, he was able to build his house. His new house is very nice and comfortable. The building of the house cost him a lot of money. Now that he has completed the building of the house, it needs renovating on the inside. He wants to make the house ready to live in. For this reason, Mohammed applied for a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials such as cement and paint to complete the interior of the house. Mohammed hopes to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and paint to complete the renovation of his house.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is 34-year-old married woman. She and her husband have 7 children. Since her marriage, she has been helping her husband (also shown in the photo) with his fruit selling business. They sell dates from a small stand. She is very hard working. Through the income from this stall, they support their entire family. They have many household expenses; therefore, it is difficult to invest back in the business. For this reason Nazia has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR. With this loan amount she intends to purchase good quality dates from the market to meet the increasing demand. She dreams of giving a quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase good quality dates.

loans.name: Eluminia

texts.es: Eluminia es casada y tiene 2 hijos Ella vive en la comunidad de Tahari en una casa de adobe  que tiene luz y agua Eluminia se deedica a la producción y venta de leche y necesita un credito para commprar una vaca  para aumentar su ganado y su produccion de leche El marido de Eluminia es albañil pero lo que gana no alcanza para colaborar a su esposa Por eso ella necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Eluminia is married and has two children. She lives in the community of Tahari, in a house made of adobe that has electricity and water. Eluminia works producing and selling milk. She needs a loan to buy a cow to increase her cattle numbers and milk production. Eluminia's husband is a construction worker, but his income is not enough to support his wife. This is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase her cattle numbers and milk production.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as being appreciative. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, drinks, eggs and other items. Her business is located in a good area for making sales. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more items to sell at her shop. Her business goal is to have a bigger kiosk within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more bread, drinks, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Marvorid

texts.en: Marvorid was born in 1982. She is divorced and is raising 2 children. Marvorid began her own sewing business in 1999. She sews traditional women's dresses. Marvorid sews dresses in her home. She has a rich imagination for fashion. Her clients are happy with her products. Marvorid manages with business alone. She is going to buy an embroidery machine and in order to please her clients. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy the machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as salt, flour, sugar, butter, oil, candles, etc.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio es soltero pero tiene tres hijos y vive en Palomar con ellos en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Antonio es agricultor y necesita un credito para comprar semillas de maiz Antonio necesita tener su tierra bien preparada para poder obtener ganancias con la venta de sus productos Antonio es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Antonio is single but he has three children. He lives in Palomar with them in a brick and cement house that is his property. Antonio is a farmer and he needs a loan to buy corn seeds. Antonio needs to have his land well prepared to be able to earn money with the sale of his products. Antonio is the only source of income for his household and this is why he needs help.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a trabajar como barman en una empresa privada, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, a la vez la socia continua con su negocio de realizar eventos como 15 años, bautizos, matrimonios entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para sus estudios.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This group member continues to work as a barman in a private business. She has been working there for quite a while and business is going well because she goes to work there every day. At the same time, she continues with her own business of planning events such as 15 years' birthday parties, baptisms, weddings, among others. The member hopes to continue working so she can support her family in this way. 

She is requesting a loan for her studies. The member is grateful to those who are supporting part of this dream and she promises to repay the loan according to the established plan.

loans.use: for her studies.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine, self-employed, is from Dzithanqov village in the Shirak region. She lives there with her two children (one son and one daughter). Narine's husband has been forced to move to Russia to find a job there and help his family financially. Narine is engaged in animal husbandry, particularly in cattle and sheep breeding. She also keeps hens. The family's agribusiness needs some investments to function in an efficient way. Narine has applied for a loan of USD 1,500 to pay for 350 packs of animal feed. Let's support this hard working woman and help her family sustain their agribusiness and expand it. They will really appreciate any kind of support from the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for animal feed

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 29-year-old married man from Beddya, a village near Nablus. He works as a taxi driver in the city. His income is low and not stable. He has a barn for raising sheep. He raises the sheep and sells its meat to the local butcher shops. Mustafa would like to improve his business and expand it

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for the barn. This will help him to increase his productivity and his income.
 
Mustafa appears in the photo in his barn

loans.use: to buy more sheep for the barn

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives at the coastal region of Kenya. She is married with three children who go to school.

For the past two years, she has operated a chemist shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase antibiotics and other human medicines for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase antibiotics and other medicine for resale.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel es una joven muy emprendedora y soñadora, viven en el municipio de Medellín junto con sus padres y un hermano.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada en un restaurante, pero desde siempre ha querido trabajar como independiente y empezar a ganar sus propios ingresos.
Para iniciar, requiere de la ayuda de un préstamo para la compra de mercancía como blusas, jeans y bolsos y comenzar sus ventas con amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo.
Es una actividad que iniciara con conocimiento empírico, pero tiene mucha fe ya que se siente en condiciones de realizar esta actividad.
Su principal motivación es poder generar más ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia y propiciar una excelente calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Isabel is an enterprising and idealistic young woman. She lives in the city of Medellín with her parents and a brother.

She currently works as an employee at a restaurant, but she has always wanted to work independently and begin earning income on her own. To get started, she needs the assistance of a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as blouses, jeans, and purses so that she can begin selling them to friends, relatives, and co-workers.

Isabel is starting this business by learning it on her own. She has a great deal of faith that she is capable of running this business. Her primary motivation is being able to generate more income to sustain her family and to provide an excellent quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy a stock of merchandise so that she start her business.

loans.name: Sataran

texts.en: Sataran is a 53-year- old energetic woman. She is a mother of five children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past 12 years. One of her daughters assists her in making embroidery patterns. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong.  But her family expenditures act as a stone on the path of expanding her business. Sataran’s embroidery patterns are highly demanded in her locality. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, frames, sequins, stones and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown a good repayment history. She dreams of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, frames, sequins, stones and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Ada Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ada de 25 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable, se dedica a la prestación de servicios como estilista en su comunidad, se ha crecido con su abuela, quien se ha desempeñado en la realización de los oficios domésticos de su casa, y es la responsable de haber inculcado buenos principios a su nieta Ada que por un tiempo participo en una capacitación de  formación de estilistas en peinado, maquillaje y corte de cabello, capacitación que fue impartida por programas sociales del alcalde municipal, la joven carece de una formación educativa ya que su familia es de muy escasos recursos económicos. 

Su familia está formada por su abuela, su esposo y su hija de 7 años que se encuentra estudiando educación  básica en la escuela de su comunidad.

La joven tiene una experiencia de 4 años en realizar la actividad de estilista en la comunidad, y aprendió a realizar esta actividad cuando participo en un curso de formación impartida por la alcaldía. La joven también depende de las remesas que le envía su esposo de estados unidos.   


El dinero será utilizado en compra de una refrigeradora, ya que ha comenzado a montar una mini tienda en el área que ella tiene para realizar los trabajos de corte y peinado de esta forma podrá tener otro ingreso que será invertido en mejoramiento de su negocio. 

Los sueños que Ada tiene para un futuro son los de tener un salón de belleza en el pueblo y mejorar su casa mediante la realización de un nuevo crédito con la institución, también sueña con tener su propio vehículo para trasladase y llevar mercadería para su mini tienda.
texts.en:
Ada, age 25, is a responsible person who provides styling services in her community. She grew up with her grandmother, who takes care of the chores at home. She was the one who instilled good principles in her granddaughter Ada. Some time ago, Ada participated in a training course where she learned about hair styling, makeup, and cutting hair. This training course was offered through social programs administered by the municipal government. Ada lacks a formal education because her family has very limited financial resources.

Her family consists of her grandmother, her husband, and her seven-year-old daughter who is attending a school in their community for her basic education. Ada has four years of experience working as a stylist in her community. She learned the business while participating in a course that was given in her town. Ada also depends on remittances that her husband sends from the United States.

The money from this loan will be used to buy a refrigerator so that she can set up a mini-market in the area where she provides haircuts and styling services. This will give her another source of income that she can invest in improving her business. Ada’s dreams for the future include opening a beauty salon in town and making improvements to her house by obtaining another loan from CrediCampo. She also hopes to have her own vehicle for traveling and carrying merchandise for her mini-market.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for starting a mini-market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of tobacco leaves

loans.name: Hina

texts.en: Hina is a 44-year-old, hardworking woman. She has five children. For the last 10 years, she has been providing the service of tailoring in her locality. She is quite popular due to her skill at stitching. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. In her third loan cycle, Hina has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread, needles, laces, and buttons. Hina is very thankful for her previous loans and hopes that this loan will generate a healthy source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, needles, laces, and buttons.

loans.name: Simon

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Simon, il est marié et il s’active dans le domaine de l’élevage depuis plus de 10 ans. Il aimerait augmenter le nombre de ses bêtes et vient solliciter un crédit à l’IMCEC de 200 000f qui lui permettra certainement d’acheter deux vœux. Simon s’occupe lui-même de ses bœufs et reste actif de 6h du matin à 17h, heure à laquelle, il ramène les bêtes à l’enclos.
Simon vit en famille avec ses parents, ses frères, ses sœurs et sa femme et ses enfants. Il partage la dépense quotidienne avec ses frères à tour de rôle.
Il aimerait avoir davantage de bœufs et faire aussi l’élevage de moutons surtout à l’approche des fêtes de la Tabaski.
texts.en:
Simon is married and has worked raising livestock for more than ten years. 

He is seeking a loan through UIMCEC for 200,000 francs, because he would like to buy two cows to increase his number of livestock. He works by himself to take care of the cows and is busy from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m., after which he puts the animals in their enclosures.

Simon lives in a family with this parents, brothers, sisters, and his wife and children. He alternates with his brothers to take care of the everyday expenses.

Simon would like to own more cattle and also raise some sheep, especially for the upcoming Tabaski festivals.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with four children and all of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her brother-in-law's children).  She has a business rearing poultry and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more poultry feed and medicines. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality and transportation.  She is aspiring to own a large poultry farm and to start rearing egg-laying birds. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utilities.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and vaccines

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.en:
Evaristo sells timber and formwork. He has been in business for more than 25 years and has taken two loans from Kubo Financiero, having always paid on time.

Evaristo is asking for a third loan for buying inventory. He says than he needs to replace some inventory that is no longer of good quality. Evaristo likes to invest in his business and pay his loans on time. His goal is to maintain some financial stability for both his business and family.

loans.use: to buy timber and formwork for his business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 62-year-old man who supports three children and is married to Yunita who provides additional income for the family.  Richard has been operating a rearing and selling of livestock business for a period of eight years, earning an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month.

Richard was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 10,000 and intends to use the entire amount to buy animal feed for his livestock. He plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy livestock feed

loans.name: Naseeban

texts.en: Naseeban is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been running the business of selling milk for the last 19 years. Naseeban has seven children. She has worked very hard to set up this business and this business has been quite helpful in earning income from which she provides education, food and clothing to her family. She owns six buffalos and three cows. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has paid back her previous loans successfully. Now Naseeban has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR with which she wishes to purchase more cattle for milking. Naseeban is hopeful that additional cattle will help her expand her business and make her capable of developing her business to make sure she can cover almost all of her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for milking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tamer Group

texts.en:
Rana is the featured borrower of Tamer Group. She along with the other group members got together to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are all working hard to develop their family's living. Rana is a 32-year-old married mother of two. She has been running her convenience store for the last two years to support her beloved husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.
Rana is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special offer summer beverages to attract customers' attention and increase her income. She is the lady on the far left side of the picture with the white top. As for the other group members, Nisrine is the lady in the center of the picture with a white veil covering her face, while Hala is the lady on the right with the black top.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special offer summer beverages to attract customers' attention and increase her income.

loans.name: Cs Mont Carmel Group

texts.fr: Nabintu est une enseignante et propriétaire d’un poulailler, chez elle à domicile dans le bidonville depuis  20 ans, présidente et membre de la banque communautaire «CS Mont Carmel», entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 60 ans, veuve et mère de 10 enfants, dont 6 étudient et 4 sont déjà mariés. Elle est vendeuse  des poulets de chair et s’entraide avec ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 100 poussins et des aliments pour ces poulets (5 sacs de maïs, 1 sac de soja, les os de bœufs, les médicaments vétérinaires etc.). Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire un grand poulailler, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs  non bancable.
texts.en:
Nabintu is a teacher and owns a chicken coop at her home in a shantytown. She has done this for twenty years. She is also the president and a member of the banque communautaire "CS Mont Carmel". 

A dynamic entrepreneuer, Nabintu is 60 years old, a widow, and a mother of ten children. Six of the children go to school, while the other four are already married. Nabintu sells broiler chickens, and she and her children help each other. She started her business with funds from her husband, when he was still alive.

She is seeking a loan through Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy 100 chicks, feed (five sacs of corn, one sac of soybeans, cow bones, etc.), and veterinarian medicines.

In the future, Nabintu wishes to build a large chicken coop and feed and educate her children. 

She thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs, who lack access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a 100 chicks, feed, and veterinarian medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Iveta

texts.en:
Iveta is a farmer from Hovq village. She lives there with her husband, daughter and her parents-in-law. Iveta's son serves in the army. The family has been engaged in animal husbandry and farming for many years. They cultivate corn, beans, potatoes, cucumbers and onions. They also keep hens. Iveta's daughter is a student. As for her in-laws, they are both pensioners, so only Iveta and her husband are fully engaged in agricultural activities. 

With a purpose to expand her agribusiness, Iveta has applied for a loan of USD $1,500. The requested amount will be used to purchase five pigs and animal feed. As this is Iveta's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (5 pigs) and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy crates of drinks to add to her business

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother of one child, and her child goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (two brothers). She has a business of a bakery and has been in this business for many years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more margarine, baking flour and eggs for making cakes. She makes all types of cakes for all occasions, and sells on a wholesale basis and distributes to supermarkets and shops all over Kampala. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and the ever increasing prices for making raw materials. She is aspiring of getting a brand name for her cakes and also to own a fully stocked bakery.  

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and paying for electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy blue band margarine, baking powder and eggs

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en: Mupa appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stocks of fish for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 54-year-old divorced mother of three children whom she works hard to support since she had a divorce. Mariam started her own fruits and vegetables selling shop in 2000, with 22 years of experience in this domain.

She is a hard worker, well known in her region with the special good quality of products she sells and encouraging prices she sets.

Today, since her children's needs are increasing, she has to develop her business more in order to cover these needs. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with the special season's production.

She is always seeking the best for her family, and hopes to keep on developing her business to cover their needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with the special season's production

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She is asking for a loan to buy more bales of clothes for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with three children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a kerosene-selling business for the past year. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 40-year-old married man with six children. His oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest child is 6 years old. He belongs to a humble family that lives in Taiz city, Yemen. He has a university education. Now, he works as a teacher in the public sector. 

Over time, Mohammed accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a piece of land. With financial support from his father, Mohammed built his own house. His house is not completed and he needs to build some rooms and renovate them. Unfortunately, Mohammed doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, Mohammed is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase constructions materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steel.

Mohammed's dream in the future is to build a large yard for the house and to build another floor.

loans.use: to purchase constructions materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steel to build rooms and to renovate them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock (two cows), fertilizers (12 bags) and animal feed (100 packs)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity and variety of phones to add to her current stock for sale

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of one additional family member (a brother). She has a business of selling charcoal, and has been in this business for three years. 

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler, and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Martha María

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 8 años que  estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una picantería.
Doña Martha es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene un bazar en su casa, allí vende ropa, zapatos, carteras, perfumes y muchos otras cosas para regalos, cuadernos y útiles escolares,  también realiza recargas telefónicas de varias operadoras con lo cual le queda algo más de ingresos, le gusta su trabajo ya que se gana algo y está atenta a las necesidades de sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cuadernos y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.  Sus sueños es tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Estancia Vieja in the Colon parish within the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank “Estancia Vieja” meet every 15 days. The humble people who live in this place are devoted to agriculture and general trade.

Sra. Martha lives in this place. She is 34 years old, married, and has an eight-year-old son who is in school. Her husband works at a restaurant that specializes in spicy foods.

Doña Martha is a woman who enjoys working and helping her husband with the household expenses. She has a bazaar in her home where she sells clothes, shoes, purses, perfumes, and many other products such as gifts, notebooks, and school supplies. Martha also offers rechargeable phone cards from various companies as a way of earning some extra income. She enjoys working because she is able to make a living and provide for the needs of her children.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, notebooks, and everything else that she can sell. She has participated in four loan cycles with the Communal Bank and enjoys the help that the loans have given her. Her dreams include having a large bazaar.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, notebooks, and other products.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is a single mother of  four children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for five years. She works in a shop six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and on-and-off electricity. She aspires to own a tailoring school and also to buy more sewing machines. She resides in the family house  and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Jerry has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more thread and bolts of materials.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is a hardworking lady who lives at the Coastal region of Kenya.

For the past three years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cream, soap, oil, etc. for her retail business.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 1 Group

texts.en:
Determined and hardworking Esther represents a group of five women from a locality in the Teshie township of Accra, Ghana. She is 47 years old, smart and talented. She works hard to support her family, even though she is still a single mother with three children. 

In order to support herself and reduce the family’s financial worries, she took the initiative to sell fresh fish in the town market. She gets her supplies from the fishermen at a wholesale price and sells to customers at a retail price.
 
Esther says she has been doing this business for the past eight years. She is very happy with the turnover she gets from the business. She wants to expand her business. The sales are high during the holidays, occasions and festive season, and also ordinary days because her products are consumable. 

Esther says the business is special to her because it makes her happy; her favorite part about being in this business is giving customer service and getting profits. She uses the income to manage the family's affairs, and she saves what is left with the MFI (micro finance institution).

Most of the time, however, the poor power supply in the area hampers her work. It is difficult to work past sunset due to the poor power supply. Since she does not have any alternate source of power supply to rely on, she wants to take a Kiva solar loan to buy 45-watt solar lighting systems, each having four bulbs. Once the system is installed in her store, she will be able to open the shop past sunset or even at night hassle-free, and this will bring her more income and the ability to afford better living standards.

The rest of the group members also need solar loans for their income-generating activities. The other members are engaged in weaving, a variety store, a second-hand business and the like. Also, some of the group members have children, and they will be able to study in the evenings by the light of these solar systems.

loans.use: to buy 45-watt solar lighting systems, each having four bulbs, to open her shop past sunset

loans.name: Ruth Leyni Margareth

texts.es:
La socia Ruth continua dedicándose a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros más, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esa forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ruth continues to sell basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other items. She has been at this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Ruth wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, and other products. Ruth appreciates and values this loan and promises to handle her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has three school-going children. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is household consumables. For over twenty years, he has operated a tailoring business making curtains garments for both men and women. He cites seasonality as his major challenge. 

With the loan, he wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Faig

texts.en:
Faig is 46 years old. He has been married for 19 years and lives in the Baku region with his family. He has a lovely family and in order to provide for them, he works very hard. His wife is a housewife. Faig’s son goes to school and is preparing for University.

Faig has been in the taxi driver business for 21 years, and he transports passengers between Baku and the southern regions of the Azerbaijan Republic. As he wants to help his business, he has applied for a loan amount of 700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the engine of his car. 

Faig says a big thank you for this loan and for the help from the Kiva organization. In the future, he wants to change his car.

loans.use: to pay for engine repairs on his car

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es soltera y no tiene hijos Ella vive cn sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus padres Teresa es ginecologa y quiere un credito para cancelar un curso de actualizacion en ginecología Los padres de Teresa la ayudan pero ella quiere costear esta inversion con ayuda de Kiva porque es una mujer que percibe un sueldo que le permite cubrir este credito sin ayuda
texts.en:
Teresa is single and has no children. She lives with her parents in a brick and cement house that they own in the city of La Paz.

Teresa is a gynecologist and wants a loan in order to pay for a continuing education course in gynecology. Her parents help her, but she wants to cover this investment with the help of Kiva. Since she is a woman who receives a salary, Teresa will be able to repay this loan without any assistance.

loans.use: to pay for a continuing education course in gynecology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for the sheep kept in the barn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of wood to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy goats for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy goats for her business.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
This is Kache. She is a very hardworking woman who appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income that she used for her clothes selling business.

Besides the clothes selling business, Kache operates a motorbike business.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more spare parts for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Jona Group

texts.en:
Jona is a group which comprises of six members of women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 240,000 YER from AMB.

Warda is the leader of the group. She is a 55-year-old married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 32 years old and the youngest one is 10 years old. She is an uneducated woman. 

Warda's husband has a small grocery in his area. Due to the low income of the grocery, his family passes with an economical crisis most days. So, Warda wants to help her husband with the expenses of her family, and she wants to improve the living standards of it through saving all kinds of food materials inside the house in order to make good foods for the family. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for her house to make food for the family.

Warda looks forward to preparing her house with all kinds of foods materials in order to save a secure future for the family.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her house to make food for the family.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий работает на одном из частных предприятий Виноградово уже 9 лет. Он — женат, у нее двое дочерей. Василий очень любит свою работу. 
Василий неплохо зарабатывает, но все равно полученных средств никак не хватает на то, чтобы благоустроить свой дом, сделав жизнь своей семьи более комфортной и уютной. Семье приходится снимать квартиру в городе, и переехать в собственный дом в селе никак не выходит. Василий решил обратиться к КИВА за суммой в 40 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт фасада своего дома. Отремонтировав дом, семья наконец-то сможет туда переехать и не тратить больше деньги на дорогостоящую аренду чужой квартиры.
texts.en: Vasiliy has been working at one of the private companies in Vinogradovo. He is married and has two daughters. Vasiliy loves his work very much. Vasiliy earns a decent income, but the money he earns is still not enough to repair his house, making his family's life more comfortable and cozy. The family has to rent an apartment in the city and has not been able to move into their own house in the village. Vasiliy decided to request a loan in the amount of 40 000 hryvnia to repair the facade of his house. After repairing the house, the family would finally be able to move there and not spend any more money for an expensive apartment rent.

loans.use: to repair the facade of his house

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor que vive con su esposa y sus hijos, se esfuerza por tener el sustento diario para su familia; se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijol y maicillo), con lo que tiene alimento suficiente para abastecer a su familia y vender otra parte, trabaja de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, este trabajo lo aprendió a desempeñar junto a sus padres, el riesgo es el cambio climático.
Invertirá en la compra de abono, semilla, fertilizantes y plaguicidas, preparara el terreno y protegerá el cultivo de plagas, espera aumentar su productividad y sus ganancias.
Su sueño es cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia a uno más confortable y cancelar puntualmente su deuda.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who lives with his wife and children. He strives to provide for his family’s daily needs. José plants basic staple crops such as corn, beans, and sorghum, which provide enough food to feed his family. He also sells part of his harvest. José works from 7:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. He learned this trade by working alongside his parents. The risk he faces is dealing with weather changes.

José will invest in the purchase of compost, seeds, fertilizers, and fungicides. This will enable him to prepare the land and protect his crops from pests. He hopes to increase his productivity and his earnings.

His dreams are to upgrade his family’s lifestyle to one that his more comfortable and to repay his debt on time.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, and fungicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal for her charcoal retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a set of aluminum pots to sell.

loans.name: Al Wafa Group

texts.en:
Labibeh is the featured borrower of the Al Wafa group. She got together with the other group members, who are neighbors and friends, in order to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua.

Labibeh is a 20-year-old married mother of one child. She works in raising and selling sheep for a living, and she supports her husband in covering their family expenses. She is working hard to develop her business, but most of her income is spent on their daily needs, and she doesn't have enough money to expand the business. Therefore she has acquired a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy more sheep in order to increase her income and earn a better living.

Labibeh is the first lady on the far right of the picture. The other group members are Nour El Huda (second from the right), Itidal (first on the left) and Wafaa (second from the left).

loans.use: To buy more sheep to increase her business income

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married with two children and both her children go to school.  She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She works in her shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care and being friendly. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, cooking oil, flour, and sugar

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio  Mario pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Mario continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, dvds entre otros, él socio continua vendiendo  de forma ambulatoria a todos sus clientes que solicitan, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de Dvds entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Mario is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosita de Lima” which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco. He continues to manage his business of selling clothes, DVDs, and other products. Mario still sells as a street vendor to all of his customers who request products from him. He is a responsible and industrious individual who works in this manner so that his family can get ahead.

Mario is requesting a loan in order to buy DVDs and other products. He is grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and other products.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is a 21 year-old single man from a small village near Jenin. He lives with his parents in a very simple house. Yazan and his father work as construction workers. It is a good business, but the income is not stable due to the demand. Yazan would like to study in the university and open his own construction business in the future. Yazan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new construction tools for his work. By taking this loan, Yazan will improve his business and also his income. Yazan appears in the photo while at work.

loans.use: to buy new construction tools for his construction work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stylish ready-made women and children clothes in order to resell to the customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Gane

texts.fr:
Gane s’active dans l’élevage, plus particulièrement dans l’embouche bovine depuis plus de 10 ans. Il habite dans un village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville principale. Le matin, de très bonne heure, Gane, emmène ses bêtes paitre dans la nature. Vers 18h, il les ramène à l’enclos pour leur donner de l’aliment bétail. 
Gane veut augmenter le nombre de ses bêtes et vient solliciter un crédit de 300 000F avec lequel, il pourra aussi bien acheter un à deux vœux et de l’aliment bétail en supplément à l’herbe. 
Gane a comme ambition de devenir un grand éleveur dans le village qu’il habite.
texts.en:
Gane has been farming livestock, more particularly fattening cattle, for over 10 years. He lives in a village located a few kilometers from the main town. Gane leads his livestock to graze in the countryside very early in the morning. At around 6 o'clock in the evening, he brings them back to their enclosure to give them cattle feed.

Gane would like to increase his number of livestock and is requesting a 300 000 franc loan so that he can buy one or two calves and some cattle feed with which to supplement their grassy diet. Gane aims to become a big livestock farmer in his village.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and resell and cattle feed.

loans.name: Helen Ingrid

texts.es:
Helen es una mujer de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja y es madre de dos bebes.
Helen es una joven de tez morena y cabello negro como la noche, sus bebes son muy pequeños; el mayor ya sabe caminar y el menor ya se pone de pie solo, ella trabaja para alimentar a sus hijos. 
Ella se encarga de la venta de comida durante todo el día en un local alquilado detrás de su casa. Su negocio es bastante sencillo y un poco improvisado, ella necesita comprar muebles como; mesas y sillas para su restaurante y también necesita comprar comestibles por mayor.
Helen sueña con su casa propia para ver a sus hijos crecer y lucha cada día para darles un futuro mejor.
Es por esos motivos que Helen solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles de restaurante y con los beneficios darles un futuro mejor a sus bebés.
texts.en:
Helen is a 22 year old woman, she lives with her partner and is the mother of two babies. Helen is young with a dark complexion and hair as black as the night. Her babies are very young; the older one is already walking and the younger one can already get on his feet unaided, she works to feed her children.

She takes charge of selling food all day long in a rented premises behind her house. Her business is quite simple and somewhat improvised, she needs to buy furniture such as tables and chairs for her restaurant and she also needs to buy wholesale food.

Helen dreams of having her own home to be able to watch her children grow and she struggles every day to give them a better future. 

It is for these motives that Helen is requesting a loan to buy furniture for her restaurant, with the benefit of giving a better future to her babies.

loans.use: to buy restaurant furniture so she can give her babies a better future.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with 3 children aged from 4 to 15 years old. She describes herself as courageous. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are locals. She says her biggest business challenge is theft. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. 

Her business goal is to be a grocery supplier within 5 years, and to have an independent business. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a hardworking woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling leso (women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase pieces of leso (women's wrap)  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase lesos (women's wraps) for resale

loans.name: Cerafina

texts.es:
La socia Cerafina continua dedicándose al negocio de  crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes. 
La socia Cerafina se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cerafina continues to manage her business of raising small animals, such as guinea pigs. She has been at this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Cerafina wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs. Cerafina appreciates the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old and married to Irene who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children. Peter has been operating a retail shop business for four years, earning an income of KES 20,000 at the end of every month.

Peter is now servicing his fifth loan of KES 108,000 and intends to use this amount to add more variety of stock of goods to his retail shop. He plans to use the anticipated income to start an M-PESA or local money transfer business and educate his children. He hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success and provide the best quality education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods for his retail shop

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel vive en municipio de Santafé De Antioquia, un municipio muy turístico en el departamento de Antioquia, allí vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos mayores de edad.
Manuel se gana la vida prestando el servicio de parque de carros y motos a los visitantes que llegan al municipio, es una actividad que realiza de domingo a domingo sin ningún tipo de ayuda.
Su meta es poder tener un negocio bien consolidado y convertirlo en una actividad rentable que genere empleo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos elementos de seguridad como uniformes, conos, valla de separación y algunas sillas; de esta moda podrá prestar un mejor servicio de más calidad y comodidad.
Manifiesta ser un hombre muy emprendedor con muchos proyectos en su mente.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in the town of Santa Fé de Antioquia, a tourist area in the Department of Antioquia. He lives there with his wife and their two grown children.

Manuel earns his living by providing parking services (for cars and motorcycles) to visitors who come to town. He operates this business from Sunday to Sunday without any help. His goal is to have a well-established business that he can turn into a profitable venture that creates jobs.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a few safety elements such as uniforms, cones, separation posts, and a few chairs. This will enable him to provide better service that is comfortable and of higher quality. Manuel says that he is an enterprising man who has many projects in mind.

loans.use: to buy uniforms, parking cones, separation posts, and a few chairs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps cows that produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the unfavorable weather conditions. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bright future. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be self-committed. She operates a farm where she grows maize and millet. Her business is located in a cool and wet area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the poor weather. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be well. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a married lady of 41 years. She is married to Urban and together they have been blessed with four children between 20 and 8 years old. Urban helps provide additional income for his family.

Violet is a tailor, a business she has done for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of KES 13,000. She has requested a loan of KES 15,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase rolls of different tailoring cloth (material). This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

Violet will use the anticipated profits to build rental houses. Her hope and dream for the future is to have her business expand further.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of different tailoring cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, oil, flavoring cubes, pepper, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and refurbish his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy necklaces and food (yams, fruit).

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo es separado tiene 4 hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un anticretico pero al menos cuenta con todos los servicios Eduardo se gana la vida como profesor de primaria y necesita un credito para incrementar el monto de su anticretico para que el dueño de casa le permita seguir ocupando el lugar donde vive ya que Eduardo esta muy comodo y feliz en ese lugar con sus hijos
texts.en:
Eduardo is separated with 4 children and lives in La Paz in a house of brick and cement where he pays an anticretico [a fixed sum upon renting a house instead of monthly rent] but at least he has all the services.

Eduardo makes a living as a primary school teacher and needs this loan to increase the amount of his anticretico so that the owner of the house will allow him to continue occupying the place where he lives, as Eduardo is very comfortable in this place with his children.

loans.use: to increase the amount of his anticretico so that the owner of the house will allow him to continue occupying the place where he lives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as seeds, composts, irrigation and pigs to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food and canned goods.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosita de Lima” de la Asociación Arariwa.
El socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de  venta de veneno para plagas y roedores, antenas entre otros, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de antenas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the 'Santa Rosita de Lima' communal bank, which is part of Arariwa Association. He continues to operate a business in which he sells poisons for pests and rodents and antennas, etc. The borrower has been in this business for quite some time and it's going well thanks to the effort he puts into his business every day. The borrower wants to continue working in order to continue supporting his family.

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy antennas, etc. He feels grateful for the loan provided and commits to making his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy antennas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes.

loans.name: Yeny Alexandra

texts.es:
Yeny, a sus 38 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. 
Ser independiente fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida.
 Desde hace aproximadamente 8 años, comenzó a un negocio de comercialización de todo tipo de mercancía como ropa, accesorios de belleza y para el hogar para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el municipio de Santa Fe De Antioquia. 
Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará mercancía al por mayor y así podrá cubrir algunos pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 
Sueña con tener un gran almacén de ropa y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Yeny, 38, is a charismatic, active, service oriented woman.  Becoming independent was her main reason for struggling tirelessly every day to look for ways to earn a living.

Approximately eight years ago she started a business selling all kinds of merchandise such as clothing, beauty accessories and home products to diverse cliente.   Her goods are very good quality with excellent prices which have allowed her to become well known in the muncipality of Santa Fe de Antioquia.

This is what motivated her to request a loan to strengthen her inventory.  She plans to buy merchandise wholesale to be able to fill orders she has from customers.  This will help improve her income.

Her dream is to have a large clothing store and a more stable income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Bernardina tiene 43 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de realizar eventos como matrimonios, bautizos, cumpleñaos entre otros, la socia  lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar vasos, platós entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is part of the 'Santa Rosita de Lima' communal bank. The bank is situated in the district of Cusco, which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco Region.

Bernardina is 43 years old, has a partner and three children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of organizing events such as marriages, baptisms, birthdays, etc. The borrower has had this business for quite some time and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. The borrower wants to continue working this way to continue supporting her family. 

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy glasses and plates, etc.

The borrower is grateful for the loan and commits to making the established payments.

loans.use: to buy glasses, plates, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as manure and fertilisers and to cover costs of irrigation.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Margarito de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado debido que en el tiempo que él estudiaba no habían escuelas cerca de su casa solamente en el pueblo lejos de su casa y logro sacar el tercer grado debido a que se quedaba donde unos amigos de sus padres; pero debido a que tenía que ayudarle a su padre a trabajar tuvo que dejar la escuela.

Margarito está acompañado su  esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijas de las edades de 22 y 24 años la mayor estudia en la universidad, en su casa habitan cuatro personas sus dos hijas y su esposa.

Margarito se dedica a la agricultura siembra de granos básicos, comenta que debido a que su padre cuando era pequeño lo llevaba a trabajar en las siembras él aprendió este trabajo y también trabajaba con otras personas  y ahora esa experiencia le ayuda a él para hacer sus cosechas para darle de comer a su familia, comenta que también se dedica a la construcción de casas de adobe,  él tenía un amigo que construía casas y le enseño a hacer casas y comenta que muchas personas lo contratan para la construcción de casas.  Los cultivos están  a un kilómetro de su casa,  no tiene horario de trabajo debido a que sus cosechas necesitan de mucho cuido, pero cuando trabaja en construcción trabaja ocho horas de siete a  tres de la tarde.

El préstamo lo utilizara para la recolección de granos básicos y para  ampliar más su casa para vivir mejor con su familia darle un espacio más amplio a sus hijas.

Margarito planea para un futuro aprender la albañilería para tener más ingresos económicos y así poder ayudar mejor a su familia también desea poder ayudarle con los estudios a sus hijas para que puedan obtener una carrera universitaria y así poder desarrollarse mejor en un futuro.
texts.en:
Margarito is 42 years old and completed only up to third grade at school. He left school so young because, when he was a boy, there were no schools near his home. The only school was in a town far from his house. He was only able to go to the first three years of school because he was able to stay with a friend of his father. As Margarito had to help his father with his work, he left school at the end of third grade.

Margarito is married; his wife takes care of the household chores. The couple has two daughters, aged 24 and 22 years old each. The eldest is studying at university. The family lives together under one roof.

Margarito makes a living in farming. He grows basic grains. Margarito says that when he was a boy, his father took him to work to learn about the crops. Margarito learned this trade and also worked with others in the field. This experience now helps Margarito to grow a harvest to give his family food to eat. Margarito says that he also works building adobe house. Margarito has a friend who used to build houses, and he taught him the trade. Margarito says he has many customers who give him contracts to build houses. Margarito's crops are one kilometre away from his house. Margarito does not have a fixed work timetable as his crops need a lot of care. When working in construction, however, Margarito works eight hours - from 7am until 3pm. 

This loan will be used to collect the harvest of basic grains and to put an extension on his house to live more comfortably with his family and offer his daughters a larger space.

Margarito wants to learn to work in construction in order to earn a higher income and better help his family. He also wants to help his daughters to complete their university studies and have better futures.

loans.use: to collect the harvest of basic grains and to put an extension on his house to live more comfortably with his family and offer his daughters a larger space.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia  de 34 años de edad, estudio bachillerato, debido a que tenía que ayudarles económicamente a sus padres no continuo con sus estudios universitarios, ella es soltera se ha dedicado siempre a ayudar a sus padres y no ha dedicado tiempo en su propia familia,  en su casa viven sus padres y dos hermanos de los cuales solamente sus padres dependen de ella sus hermanos trabajan y estudian.

Silvia trabaja en una nevería desde hace diez años,  ella decidió trabajar debido a que tenía que ayudarle a su familia económicamente y opto por trabajar y desde entonces ha conservado su trabajo y no continuo con sus estudios universitarios, comenta que ella se siente muy bien en su trabajo la distancia de su trabajo es de medio kilómetro de su casa, el horario de trabajo hora de entrada a las 8 de la mañana y hora de salida 6 de la tarde.

El préstamo lo necesita para su vivienda la construcción de una cocina, necesita comprar material de construcción como hierro, arena, cemento, ladrillo, y pagar mano de obra, comenta Silvia que gracias al crédito ella podrá tener un lugar más amplio para  habitar mejor con su familia.

Silvia planea para un futuro poder seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria, comenta que quiere en un futuro tener su propio negocio y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia, 34, went to high school but because her parents were unable to help out economically she was unable to continue on to university studies.  She is single and always has helped her parents, so does not have her own family.  She lives with her parents and two siblings who work and study.  But only her parents depend on her.

Silvia has worked for ten years at an ice cream parlor.  She decided to work in order to help her family economically and since then she has had the same job.  Her place of work is half a kilometer from her house.  Her work schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. 

The loan Silvia needs is to build a kitchen in her house.  The materials she will buy are iron, sand, cement and bricks.  She also will hire labor for the job.  Silvia says that thanks to the loan she will be able to have a larger living space for the benefit of her family.

In the future Silvia wants to get a university education.  She also wants to have her own business and more income to improve her family's qualtiy of life.

loans.use: To buy iron, sand, cement, bricks and hire labor to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad es soltera pero tiene dos hijos  Ella vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe afortunadamente ella tiene luz, agua y alcantarillado.  Natividad es vivandera, lo que quiere decir que prepara y vende comida  Ella necesita un credito para comprar provisiones como mote, chuño y otros que le permitan preparar deliciosos platos tipicos de Bolivia Natividad es la unica fuente de ingreso en el hogar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Natividad is single but has two children. She lives in El Alto in a house made with adobe bricks. Fortunately Natividad has electricity and water in her house, and the house is linked to the sewage system. Natividad works preparing and selling meals. She needs a loan in order to buy supplies, such as potato starch and boiled wheat, allowing her to prepare delicious, typical Bolivian meals. Natividad is the only one in her household who earns an income and so needs your help.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as potato starch and boiled wheat, allowing her to prepare delicious, typical Bolivian meals.

loans.name: Gloria Amparo

texts.es:
